description: Went here wirh a group of Danish people to watch the World Cup soccer game.. They show all the games at Mad Dog - pretty impressive, the time difference taken into account.. However, at 9am we gathered and I like Mad Dog! It's great for bigger groups that are interested in sports, and for groups that might be a little loud..
author: Nadia S.

description:
Came here for Thursday night trivia, which surprisingly wasn't overly packed. It was an okay trivia, but I'd say that I've been to others that were a little more exciting and drew the crowd in a bit better. There was also limited seating so people were staggered in random places as well. Service was a little lacking, but whatcha gonna expect at an average bar.

This is in my hood, so I will probably come back for future shenanigans and will have additional things to report on!
author: Allie L.

description: Love coming here, food is alright but the service (particularly Kurt! Such a lovely fella!) is fantastic even when short staffed. Drink selection is decent but as you would expect. It's the service that has always stood out
author: C M.

description: A great place to grab a drink and watch the game. Excellent service and great food. Try the corn dogs. Yummmm
author: Christina T.

description:
This place gets very crowded during big events so as others noted it feels understaffed  but does have a very lively happening vibe. 

Went here briefly recently and while it was o.k. I think there are better options just due to the layout .  

Still , a decent place to watch any of the big sporting events.
author: Rod M.

description: Ok pub/bar that we stumbled upon after a 9 mile walk, so the 2 pints of beer were very welcomed. Went in for happy hour and asked wht the happy hour deal was and that was $1 off beer that was it. No one really in there but the bar tender was friendly and the beer did the trick. They have an outside patio which is pretty cool.
author: Mark J.

description: Showed up here, looking forward to watching my clubs soccer match early Sunday morning. Ton of Tv's, nice draft selection-I'm excited. They have the firestick for NBC Sports gold....Think I'm good to go. But nope, they refused to put my team's match on any of the TV's due to the fact a Chelsea match was on. They weren't rude, just said it was their policy. I don't appreciate that if you're a sports bar you can't find one TV for a couple of guys to watch a match on, but hey it is was it is. So one star for not being even slightly accommodating to your customers. Seems like a fair trade off.
author: Keith H.

description:
Man, I really miss this place. As the rest of SF crumbles to a gentrified trash heap, Mad Dog has managed to stay alive and well!

The back patio is about as perfect as it gets for a nice pint and ploughman's platter during a sunny SF day.
author: mary r.

description:
Avoid this bar like the plague.

TLDR: Cheater (14oz) pints, billed for items we didn't order or receive, did not receive items we actually ordered, extremely slow service, calamari gave my wife and i stomach ache, tip included for parties of 4+, make sure you get itemized receipt!!

Met some friends here on Saturday a couple of weeks ago.  The service was atrocious.  We ordered things that never came and every time we checked on the item (chicken wings) we were told the order went in but in reality it only went in after about an hour when a new waitress took over our table.

When we got our first check from the waitress who was closing out it did not com itemized.  We only found out from the second waitress that tip had already been included because they charge mandatory tip for 4 or more guests.  So we essentially double tipped on items we didn't receive.  It took us a long time to sort it out with the 2nd waitress. 

I've got a pet peeve about bars who charge $8 for a beer and then serve it in a cheater pint.  We didn't notice until my wife ordered a 12 oz beer and it nearly filled the entire glass.  When i asked how big the pints were they responded "Everyone else is doing it so we do it too".  Umm....what about integrity? What about giving a F for your customers.  I would take my business to any of the other great beer bars on Haight street before i came back here.

One star for the bar tender who felt so bad for all that we went through and comp'd a couple of beers.
author: Jay D.

description:
Came in Tuesday night with my coworkers for trivia (started at 9 after the World Series game ended) and was not disappointed! It gets crowded but lots of fun.

Got there at 7:30 to grab some beers and food first! 

5/5 - black bean quesadilla. Delicious, hot, lots of cheese and enough beans. 

3/5- side of fries, nothing special weren't particularly hot when they came out 

3.5/5 - nachos! We got ours with guac and chicken. Found there were too few chips for the entire thing - some chips were also either completely buried and soggy or completely untouched by the cheese. Still solid overall 

4/5 - wings. So yummy with just enough kick. Blue cheese and ranch dressing made them even better. 

Beer wise- we just got the buckets of bud light and Budweiser!

Will be back another time! We ended up getting second place (tied) which means that you get a free bucket of beer at the end too! :)
author: Kristie M.

description: Delightful; quiet; good beer selection including sours.
author: Gabe B.

description: If your a fan of beer they have plenty of beers on tap and bottles. It's just a beer and wine place. So if you want mixed drinks or shots you gotta go somewhere else. Which is kinda of a big disappointment. They do serve food, but we didn't try any of it. It was your basic pub food. The service was just ok, the bartenders were nice but not overly excited to serve you. The atmosphere was cool and up beat.
author: Ron V.

description:
One of the BEST bars in the area!! Great food, great beer selection! Great for PACKER GAMES! Kimi is one of the BEST bartenders they have. She is very attentive, hard working and knowledgeable on everything. So when you come here make sure you ask for her and you will have a great time!!! 
#CHEERS
author: Dorothy M.

description:
I never write reviews, but I hope the ownership reads this. I work in the service industry myself and understand the importance of courtesy and respect when speaking to any staff member. There was a man behind the bar named Seamus who was extremely short and rude to me from the moment I referenced those who worked at your beer bar as 'beertenders'. I said this in a joking manner referencing James (an exceptional beertender who was serving me for the majority of my time here).
I asked which nachos I had ordered, because I was curious as to what the other options were since I had skimmed the menu and his exacerbated response was 'I was not your server, I have no idea what you ordered!!' Even though he had witnessed me eating and commented on my selection moments earlier.
I just left and am in disbelief with how I was treated, I hope you are able to address this with him. I would hate for other valuable employees and a rad bar like this suffer from someone so incredibly miserable.
author: Carlee K.

description:
I came here yesterday to watch the Packers-Falcons game and little did I know this place is a Packer bar! Tons of cheeseheads lol

I thought this place was ok. It's ok for what it is; beer, bar food, short seating, etc etc. Unfortunately, they don't serve hard liquor so that becomes a small turn-off. 

I wouldn't come back but it's an ok place to watch a game in case every other bar is packed up.
author: Allister D.

description:
I'm not a complainer (less than 10% of reviews are 1 or 2 stars). I am compelled, though, to do my best and try to steer patrons to other bars in the area.

I have been to Mad Dog at least ten times, for happy hours, trivia nights, and sporting events. Mostly, I let issues with the place pass. Issues such as slow to nonexistent service or the lack of displayed prices.

My most recent experience caused the two of us to realize that something isn't right here, and it's only gotten worse over time. The majority of times a "special" is displayed, it is unavailable because it's sold out. The beer pint prices have steadily climbed from $4-5 to $8 on my last visit. The wait while sitting at tables or sitting/standing at the bar has always been a gripe for me, well above the norm I've observed at places around the Bay Area.

Folks, you have several great options nearby, including Toronado, Noc Noc, and Nickies. They offer you quality product at reasonable prices, sharp service, and better seating options. I will not willingly choose to return to Mad Dog, and I will not include it as an option with friends when trying to decide on the starting point for a gathering.
author: Randy M.

description:
Ordered food on a quiet Friday had the Irish bartender come walking over to our table 25 minutes later which an angry look on his face. He asked us if he "looked like a bar maid and if we expected him to act like one?" I asked him to please explain what the problem was and if we were expected to "grab our own food from the kitchen window?" To which he replied "ahh you're f**king English you c**ts are always causing f**king trouble with us Irish". Now this in it's self is an incredible case of racial profiling which left me completely gobsmacked to say the least! We sat and ate our food and watched him throw back countless shots and drinks with the barmaids whilst serving behind the bar. Golden rule "Don't drink behind a bar if you're going to act like an asshole"

I will not be returning to this place... Ever!
author: Barns L.

description: I walk in w| 2 others. Looks closed. No greeting. We sit. No acknowledgement, but I did see him look up. One other guy walks in & his whole vibe changed. I hate to throw the whole racism shit in this, but he definitely came off as a racist fuck. IPA bomb dot com but not enough to come back, I'll get an IPA elsewhere. Wish I got his name, bc another worker came in & she said hi before she even clocked in- super sweet.
author: Vanessa B.

description: I went to mad dog for the World Cup game and the atmosphere was amazing.  The only thing better than the game was the service.  The bartender Sam was beyond exceptional.  She was attentive to all of the snobby French customers and still managed to get my order and keep her cool.  She was as cool as the cucumber sour that she recommended. 10/10 will come back.
author: Jordan M.

description: This place is terrible!  The service is awful. It took 10 minutes for someone to greet us and then another 10 minutes to get our drinks and then another 20 minutes for someone to come back to ask us on whether we wanted food. One of the joys of sitting at the bar is that usually you get your drinks within 5 minutes of sitting down especially when you know what you want not 20 minutes! I'm usually a pretty patient person but this place definitely tested my patience. Furthermore when asking the bartender a question she was extremely argumentative apparently kindness and customer service is not part of the training program here.  It's unfortunate that the front of the house is a poor example for the back of the house because the nachos were excellent (REAL cheese and not fake liquid cheese!)
author: Theresa F.

description: Great bar food. Love their fish tacos. Very nice servers. Great sports games. nice patio in the back.
author: Emmanuella A.

description: This place was fantastic! The beers were definitely better than the average bar, with hefeweizens and sours in draught. And the food was incredible; I had the fish and chips, and even the next day, after being microwaved, it was still delicious! Their ambiance is definitely casual with a little divey, but not gross. And on a sunny day, the back patio is really nice. Go check it out!
author: Karishma K.

description: Good to watch sports, it gets crazy crowded though when there are big games, and when that happens it's obviously understaffed - that was the big no no, waitress couldn't keep up with the amount of people ordering in the back patio. Pub food is good.
author: Martino P.

description:
I like the bar scene here!  They deck this place out when it comes to a certain themed holiday!

They have a wide variety of beer selections and TVs hung for an adequate view of the game going on!  

Their wings are nicely fried and of the norm of buffalo flavored!  Yum!  They have other bar grub food as well!  Wings, however, are a classic favorite of mine!

They have an outdoor patio so you can treat this place as a biergarten, by all means!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I had a terrible experience here last night.  Exploring the Haight, I walked in here with a friend of mine, on her birthday.  The bartender (an Irish sounding guy) was mid-pour when I tried to get some info about the bar: 

1. Do you do mixed drinks? "no"
2. Do you take cards? "yes"

The next words out of his mouth I couldn't believe.  He told me that I was being rude and i shouldn't be "barking orders at him", and to "calm down".

Being 2 beers deep already from another bar, I realized immediately that it was quite possible that I was coming across rude, so I apologized and tried to order our drinks, yet the bartender kept his sour personality and became very curt with me.  I can now see why this place was the emptiest bar on Haight street!

I'm 27 years old and I've been to plenty of bars in my lifetime; never once have I had a situation like this happen to me.  I was absolutely appalled.

Dear bartender; I'm sorry if it is outside of your capabilities to multitask, I know that serving beer and answering binary questions is very hard, but you don't have to take it out on a customer, especially after that customer tries to apologize for any misunderstandings.

Will not be going back.
author: Peter M.

description:
Go here to watch soccer games and for the beer selection. But the service is horrible!

A friend and I ventured into Mad Dog last night to grab drinks and watch the Niners pre-season game. When we got there, the bar was't packed but it still took our server a really long time to get us our drinks and subsequent rounds. 

But the highlight was when my friend took two sips of her wine, and then realized there was a bug floating in her glass. She pointed it out to our server, who looked at her and said "so...you want another glass?!" Ummm..yes please. The server took forever to replace her drink and also charged her for it. When we pointed it out on the check, the server says "Yeah, the bug wasn't in the bottle and it wasn't there when I poured the first glass....and your glass was half done anyways when I replaced it..."

I know bugs fall into drinks occasionally. It happens. We all co-exist. But in the few occasions this has happened to me before, every establishment had always apologized for the hassle, and then replaced the drink as a courtesy. Maybe I've been spoilt but I've never had a server give me attitude for a bug falling in my drink! Wow.
author: UMich W.

description:
The European football bar!! I love going to this place on Saturday or Sunday mornings to watch the English Premier League (soccer). It's a great atmosphere for a big game, as there are always fellow football fans eager to support their teams. There are plenty of big TVs to watch the game, and the breakfast is pretty good too. I usually order the bacon, egg, and cheese breakfast burrito, with a side orange juice. They also offer some English breakfast options, if that's your thing.

I can't say I've ever been here in the evening, but I love the atmosphere on weekend mornings for EPL games!
author: Andrew L.

description:
Ok, ive probably been to this place 50 times without exaggeration. I live 4 blocks away, been in SF for a while. The place is a reliably good sports bar.

But nobody, and I mean nobody likes to hear "our computer is 10 min fast, I can't offer you happy hour prices" when you've made it to the bar with 5 minutes to spare. It's deflating. And not uncommon, c'mon. Who hasn't quickly placed an order moments before happy hour ends?

Yes, mr. bartender, I went to the server area of the bar to get your attention. A no-no. In my defense, it wasnt packed, but there weren't any gaps between people at the bar. And there was no server nearby that needed to access it. And I just wanted to find out what the hell was included with happy hour because time was ticking, there was nothing posted about it except for the hours, and I couldn't find an unclaimed menu. 

"'Scuse me, quick question"
"You're standing in the server station."
"I know, just a. . . "
"This is the server station"
"Right, I understand..."
"... server station."
"May I ask you a question before I get out of it?"
"..."
"I just want to know what's included in happy hour."
"Happy hour is over"
"It's over at 7, right? [Checks phone] It's not 7 yet, I've got 4 minutes"
"Our computer is ten minutes fast so I can't ring in happy hour"
"That's very convenient for you"
"So are you going to order a beer"
"Nah."

Sheesh.
author: Rob G.

description:
This's the worse place ever to go and watch a game the service is so slow and the food is worse, plus you can be watching a game and the bartender Changes the channel without saying anything! 90 mins in!! 
Plus when I went to pay I informed the server that we would like to pay cash and she still charged both our cards we used at the star !!!do not try to call the manager, it does not help much.
author: Sergio S.

description: Refused service for a belligerent guy who was not affiliated with our group. As we held out our credit cards they declined service. The guy that wasn't affiliated with our group was of a minority as am I, and it was very discriminatory.
author: Nicky V.

description:
Came here during Bay to Breakers for some lunch and beer. It was pretty packed but we were able to get a booth. Its SUPER dark in there. Gosh. It was so difficult to see the menu. There's a pool table and an outdoor area.

The main reason why I had a semi bad experience here was because of the food. I ordered a chicken club. Our food took FOREVER to get to our table. I'm pretty sure the food sat out there for a while before they brought it to us because my sandwich was cold. Straight up cold. The bread was still toasted but the chicken was cold and rubbery. Pretty sure it was precooked and microwaved and then left outside for forever. The fries were bland. The only redeeming factor was the beer. They have a mad dog pilsner which is pretty good. Still can't get over that nasty sandwich though
author: Amy T.

description: Fantastic Tuesday Trivia nights. 7 rounds, starts at 8pm and ends around 11pm. A mixed crowd which shows up when you get to the music and picture rounds of trivia. Cheap pints for the table and lots of space.
author: Tia W.

description:
The beers on tap are pretty standard fare, but there are at least a dozen options. There are plenty of televisions that show all of the relevant sports matches. The regulars are a bit rowdy and always up for a conversation, and the bartenders are incredibly friendly.

Cute little back patio. And they are open to having dogs in the bar (which I'm all about). Pretty solid dive bar on Haight. Three stars because I'm a beer snob who prefers more craft options and the ability to bring in my own food (from Rosamunde across the street).
author: Michelle K.

description:
Dark ambience, great beer selection, excellent back patio and soccer all the time. Interestingly enough I came here to watch a basketball game, because nearby Danny Coyle's was packed to the gills, and there were still a group of soccer hooligans who managed to out cheer the whole bar even though their game was only on one TV. 

Reasonable prices though ($6/pint for most drafts) and again, great selection including some sours and more difficult to find bottled beers. Pub food was also pretty cheap and although it was sort of standard, it still hit the spot. 

Would definitely recommend checking this place out.
author: Andres B.

description:
I went to Mad Dog in The Fog with a group of friends for Trivia Night. Walked up to the bar and politely asked the bartender (Brandon, name taken from the check) what the cheapest pitcher was. This was after ordering two other more quality beers. Brandon very rudely scoffed at the question and said "I dunno Stella?" $24. Note that later we saw posted paper signs near the tables that bud lite was really the cheapest at $18. So Brandon, the bartender doesn't even know the menu offerings OR clearly is trying to scam people. Strike one.

Next up, we get the check. My boyfriend puts his card on the clipboard and when the clipboard is returned it is sans card. Hmm? Did Brandon hold it behind the bar? So my bf asks if he could check for it. Brandon very rudely raises his voice and slams the clipboard with his hand proclaiming that he "always" puts the card there. So with the others sitting at the bar, we start scrambling and looking on the floor for a fallen card, frantically checking the wallet. Okay. The card is nowhere to be seen. So once again, we politely (I point out politely because we were 100% sober and acting as mature adults) ask Brandon to check for the card. He quickly grabs the cup of cards near the register and sifts through them. He picks up one (which looked liked my bf's card- it very obviously stands out because it is made of a thicker metal than other cards) and asks, "what's your name again?" We tell him and after a few seconds, puts the card back. As if considering, "You know what? Better to just be an ass and keep this" and tells us he doesn't have the card. At this point we are getting very concerned. Is he plotting to steal the card? Is he really that much of an asshole?

We go to ask another female staff member to please look for the card. And alas, what does she retrieve from the cup? My boyfriend's card. Thank you to her for not being a douche. We very loudly said our thanks to Brandon and he throws up some type of sarcastic fist pump gesture without turning around. 

I have some serious concerns about this establishment. Does Brandon have such a fragile male ego that he simply couldn't apologize and admit his mistake and return the card? Or was he really trying to steal the card? 

Beware of this place!! 

Tl;dr - horribly rude staff who might be trying to steal your credit cards
author: Per S.

description:
Very disappointed. Came here for the rugby World Cup game between Wales and England. 

Upon arrival, was made to pay $20 to enter...ok I thought, should be worth it. It wasn't. The main screen had a baseball game on throughout the whole rugby game, no one was watching the baseball. There were 30 of us crowded around a small tv smaller than what I have at home. A larger screen was also displaying an Italian soccer match which no one was watching. I asked the barman to change to the rugby. He said he would look into it. Apparently he didn't as we continued to crowd around the tiny screen we were forced to pay for. 

The waitress in a word sucked. And that wasn't just my opinion. I asked for bacon sandwiches, they were served cold. When I asked for ketchup, she pulled a face. When I asked for the prosecco with orange juice as displayed on the menu, she informed me I would have to pay extra for juice. Upon complaining she pulled faces and "managed to get" a plastic cup of juice to go with our prosecco from the bar.

Never in my life have I experienced such a bad waitress situation. In the end I closed out from the brunette and opened a new tab with a shorter haired waitress, she was very nice and I feel bad for her having to work in this obviously customer indifferent environment. 

Oh and ps. After half time, no one else had to pay for the privilege to be made to feel like sh*t
author: Simon M.

description:
Open on Thanksgiving and many other major holidays.

Beer is cheap and the food is good. 

Beer and Wine only but they're from all over the world.
author: Matthew M.

description: Honestly, the name was the draw. We were passing by and had to stop in. We ended up drinking multiple pitchers of beer of a few games of poorly played pool. There are plenty of televisions so there were a good crowd of people watching various games.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Mad Dog in the Fog has bright lights, flashy interior, standard micro brews on draft, much more selections in bottles. hot inside the bar in the daytime. 

drink: redd's apple ale (4)
-tasted so so, 
-surprised it's made by miller's beer.,
not mentioned anywheres, 
-certainly not a bargain if domestically made.

on draught:
-patio seating also. 
-strange configuration, maybe it works better at night.
author: Victor G.

description: Nasty business! Letting people in to watch the game and then charge afterwards a cover fee pp... Don't go there!
author: Valerie W.

description:
I miss this place soooooo much! I went to college and lived in SF for over 15 years.   (I moved around a bit within the city over the years, experiencing many different neighborhoods  over the years. I had apartments in areas including the Western Addition, the Tender-Nob, the Panhandle, SOMA, Upper Terrace/Buena Vista and of course, the Lower Haight, about two doors down from Mad Dog's).  I was very social and ate out, went out for drinks, etc. frequently. I went out a LOT back then and people would kind of look to me to lead the evening's festivities. No matter what part of the city I was in at the time, the Marina, North Beach, Noe Valley, etc. I  knew just where to go. But, at a certain point in the evening I would almost always get everyone to jump into a cab or take a bus back across town to close out the night at Mad Dog's. Never a dull moment - never had a bad or even disappointing time there. I felt like people should scream out, "Norm!" to me when I walked in. LOL.  And I was always bringing a bunch of friends with me and meeting new ones there...friends I still have to this day. (Even though I am "trapped" way up here in Portland now. Sigh). 
I can say, without fear of contradiction that for me, out of all the fancy restaurants, bars, pubs, etc. Mad Dog's was the place I loved the most. So many memories...a million great night's out and always, always amazing people - both the staff and the crowd. I can't remember a bad time.  People were always up for a game of darts or watching a football game in the morning, or hanging out in the grass patio out back on sunny Summer afternoons...I do not miss the long line to the women's restroom on a Saturday night, (LOL) but, I always, always had an amazing time. Everyone I ever met there was so positive and fun. Mad Dog's had the hottest English, Irish and Scottish guys, too.  I admit they were a big draw for me...LOL ;-) I sorely miss the Snake Bites, Black & Tans and of course, the food.  My favorite was the English cheddar and bacon muffin sandwich or the Banger's and Mash. (No Spotted Dick for me, thanks)...
When friends and family - or hell, even total strangers, would tell me they were planning a trip to the city I would regale them with local non-tourist places they should try- depending on what kind of food or beverage or mood they were in and the neighborhood, etc. And Mad Dog's was always a "you must-visit" on my referrals to them.
I still have my "Mad Dog in the Fog" green and white footballer's jersey that I bought and wore into the ground. Being a big foodie and having worked as in TV advertising and worked as a television producer for my profession. And a lot of our clients were San Francisco-based restaurants, bars and five star hotels. I wrote and directed many, many restaurant and bar commercials (TV spots) within the city. Unfortunately, Mad Dog's was not one of them, but I never hesitated to tell anyone that would listen that it was hands-down my favorite bar in the city. Because of my job, I was fortunate enough to have the opportunity to experience a wide variety of places, cuisines, pubs, bar, etc. in every possible neighborhood, nook and cranny of the city, i.e. if you want a kick-ass cappuccino, you go the Steps of Rome in North Beach. If you want a romantic dinner with the most succulent roast chicken, you go to Zuni Café. If you love escargot you can either go to La Brasserie Francaise (I think it is shut now), or my personal preference, John's Grill. Cajun ? P.J's Oyster Bed.  Sushi? Duh - everyone knows you go to Yoshi's in Oakland. Period.  Business lunch or dinner in the financial district? Gotta go to Palio d'Asti (an order the Mezzeluna Monneferrina - sorry if I spelled it wrong -  if it is still on the menu). 
 But, if you want to just lift a pint with your buds or even have an amazing, guaranteed night out with a date or a pack of friends, you definitely MUST head to Mad Dog's. 
I am so stoked to see it is still alive and kicking and would give my left eye to be back there in the city, sharing a pint in the fog So, for what it's worth, I dedicate these words to you, such as they are, I honor and deeply miss you, from a very homesick ex-pat. I also want to "give a shout out" to the current owners and past proprietors of Mad Dog's,  its loyal fans who know exactly what I am talking about, and  of course, to the city I still stubbornly call home.  I will solemnly and with great reverence raise my glass to you: Long may you live. Mau the wind always be at your back, and your doors and hearts always be open.  With all my love... Céad míle fáilte and Sláinte !!
author: Erika W.

description:
The Mad Dog in The Fog is a typical pub / sportsbar on lower Haight st. For those of you not from SF this means it is not in the Haight-Ashbury area, despite its being on Haight the bar is a good 1 mile / 20min walk from Haight-Ashbury. They take credit cards but the last time I went their card machine was broken so I would recommend bringing cash just in case. 

The bar itself is clean and spacious not cramped or overly divey. They have multiple large flatscreen TVs showing sports. They have some of their own signature beers available as well as your standard domestics, imports, along with some less common microbrewery beers, and a kitchen with your usual pub grub. They have a nice pool table but it is right by the front entrance so sometimes if you are playing and taking a shot on the far side of the table you are blocking people entering and leaving the bar by standing in doorway.  

+1 star: Nice pool table.
+1 star: Clean overall!
+1 star: They have a very spacious outdoor brick patio in the back. 

-1 star: Two of the beers on tap I got were completely flat
-1 star: A bit pricey ~$7-9 per beer + tip and your money starts to go fast
author: Tomas K.

description: Beers on tap taste as if the lines have not been cleaned in forever? Oh, there are services for that...so disappointing to pay for flat, skunky beer. Stick to hard liquor or bottles...personal rule of thumb is to never order wine from a dive bar. BUT if you're just looking to get drunk, or are already drunk, and need a place to watch sports, you've found your match. The bartenders here are not going to pay attention to your empty glass, however, so I would just always be sure to order two when they finally check to see how you're doing. Wanted to like, but I think I would just prefer my own couch--much better service and much cleaner beer.
author: Elle N M.

description:
This place is awesome!

a page of draft brews, and a half dozen double sided pages of bottled beers =).  There is definitely something for everybody.  Trivia is pretty amazing, although the microphone situation is a little hard to parse sometimes.

Highly recommend showing up early for the 830 pm Thursday trivia with a big group
author: Matt U.

description:
This may be an alright bar, but the 2 stars are worthy of the atrocious service experienced from the pixie-haired waitress out on the patio. 

Not only was it nearly impossible to get her to take our order, but the service was super unprofessional and rude. I would not suggest eating here. Just stick to the beers.
author: Nina M.

description:
Well, to be honest I was here mostly because Toronado across the street was impossible to get a foot in edgewise, and I needed a place where I could hear my friends talking without having a screaming contest.  Around 11 on a Saturday night it was not full at all, but after an hour, the crowd that was in Toronado seemed to have somehow mysteriously flip flopped with this location, so I guess the congestion comes and goes with the bars on this street.  

Beer's ok, didn't have a problem with service (but we clearly were not here at a busy hour), sound system was randomly super loud at times, had to switch a few times for wobbly tables (but props for having booths), and I'll hand them credit for the friendly DJ who immediately sent his original EDM mix to my boyfriend when he asked what song it was.
author: Anita T.

description:
Great sports bar/irish pub in the heart of Haight Ashbury neighborhood.

We stopped in during SF BEER WEEK - my go-to spot, Toronado (across the street) was beyond packed and only had minimal brew on tap. Luckily Mad Dog was spacious, had ample seating and a variety on tap & bottled craft beers. We opted for a Gulden Draak & Raging Bitch, paired with a charcuterie plate and some tacos that were pretty tasty. Prices are fair, staff is friendly and love how they have a backyard patio.
author: Juanita D.

description:
Went here to get drinks during Santa con! The service was great and the bar food was good too. I got the chicken strips and they were crispy and hot.

They give you the hot sauce and also ranch or bbq as well which is nice of them. It doesn't come with fries, just chicken strips.
They have a good selection of beers!
They do not sell liquor though only beer and wine which was a little downer for our group but we stopped there, got a beer, and went on our way!
author: Bori B.

description: Love the fried fries ! I finish it too fast and I don't even had time to take a picture first. Hahahha.
author: Donna Z.

description:
I came here to watch the final 49ers home game at Candlestick and for a Monday night had a great atmosphere, they also show the Premier League football matches early on weekend mornings which is useful for people like me to get their fill of proper football. 

There are plenty of TVs so you can catch the action no matter where you are in the bar. A large group of us managed to guzzle our way through nine pitchers of Anchor Steam which didn't break the bank at the end of the night.
author: Matt B.

description:
It might be OK as a sports bar showing football but if you want to go for a beer it is well below average. Arriving at about 7 on a Sunday evening we asked if they had a beer list. And was told no. We weren't even given any choices . I just had to wander up and down the bar looking at the pull handles in bad light. I then went to the restroom and it was disgusting. 
We finished our drinks an left.
A terrible terrible experience
author: Chris D.

description:
Some might say it's your standard "Irish" pub among three in Lower Haight, but what's most overlooked is their excellent selection of commercial beers. While Toronado across the street is known for their craft beer selection, if you want to grab a pint of a more obscure commercial brewery that's not Budweiser, this is the place to go. Boddingtons is on tap, Goose Island, Allaghash etc. Apparently they also have a large bottled beer selection that I've never gotten around to.

Come for a few drinks, & stay to watch a game. There's plenty of seating and standing room, the bar is kept really clean for a pub that's always busy with rowdy, drunk sports fans. Friendly bartenders a plus.

There's also a small back patio if you want to have a conversation but it closes early at 9pm.
author: Steven C.

description: Horrible service. Do the bartenders know they're a bartender?   Completely rude and idiotic.  Used to come often when I lived in the Haight. Not anymore.  Learn boys learn.
author: Geno B.

description: Doesn't look like it from the outside, but it's actually quite big and roomy on the inside. Plenty of TVs with a very large screen in the back. I like the high table by the window the most. Bartenders are super nice.
author: Sherry L.

description:
I'd been to Mad Dog a year ago, but hadn't come back.  It was on a Friday or Saturday night, pretty empty, but I didn't have a bad time because there are a lot of booths for your friends to sit around + pool tables.

THENNN I came back here this past weekend when it was 80+ degrees. I had never noticed the back patio and board games + menu, and that completely changed my mind about Mad Dog!  The patio isn't huge, but there are 5 tables to share + a lot of chairs that you can pull up.  I stayed there with 4 of my friends playing Apples to Apples for a solid hour and a half.

Since we had been drinking earlier that day, none of us ordered drinks.  Our waitress didn't speak to us nicely, but she acted nicely.  Does that make sense?  She seemed disappointed that we weren't ordering drinks (but at least we ordered nachos!), but wanted to take care of us + gave me juice + pitchers of water... so I really appreciate that.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Great place! My friends and I stopped in to watch the Raiders. They put the game on the big screen and turned the sound on and made it very nice for all. The two Irish guys working the bar were great and very friendly. Prices are awesome, very nice value and the food was good. I'll stop by again for sure next time I'm in SF. Thanks for a good time.
author: Alessandro B.

description: Worst service ever. The bar tenders at this place are extremely rude. I have come to this place couple of times and both times I have had bad experience.
author: Vandeep G.

description: They have beer and lots of it.  But no liquor here so be warned.  Bring your own maybe just don't tell the bartenders! Only joking that's unethical.  Decor is fun and cool. Lots of tvs and a pool table the music is kind of like electronica/dance but not a total head ache.  They only had one porter on the menu so have a few choices ready for the bartender in the event that they are out of your first choice ( as was the case with me ) otherwise super cool and fun
author: Stephanie D.

description: Nice place. Big space so it never feels that crowded despite all the people. They have Delirium in a bottle! Other tasty beers available.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
The food was 3.5 stars
The atmosphere is 4.5 stars (good patio, large windows on street, good for trivia and sports)
The service is 1 star as it took at least 30 minutes to get a beer.
author: Scott S.

description:
I brought my non-American friends from China here.  They are slowly learning the culture.  Waitress wasn't very patient and not so flexible in interacting with my friends.  I found that disappointing.  

Food wasn't good.  Middle-grade small frozen beef patties where there is no other way to cook than brown in the middle.  

It was a 2 star experience.
author: C L.

description: trivia night on thursdays! a fun lil divey bar but only sells wine and beer.  no outside food either. they make a point to make sure you dont eat any outside food.  pretty good beer selection on tap.  ordered 2 drinks at 10 and 12 bucks and i asked the waitress to combine them too.  she told me 14.  i was like sweet! great deal.  :) gets crowded for trivia night and people are super serious about it.  plenty of tables.  they turn the pool tables into regular tables so more people can sit which is cool.  a beer and wine place thats cheap and fun in the city.  lots of tvs to watch games.  they had soccer on when i was there.
author: Matthew G.

description: Great find in a great location - perfect for watching the Premier league.  12 screens dotted around and 1 large projection screen just in case.  Decent beer selection although could have some better local brews on tap.  Friendly staff and a nice atmosphere
author: Maneesh G.

description: Have been here twice now. One time for dinner/ drinks/ trivia night. Food is alright. Nothing special whatsoever. They serve typical American food and it's just decent. They have quite a few drinks though on tap. Love that the pear cider is on tap. Other than that, it's an alright place. Good place to be able to have a group and catch up.
author: Julie L.

description:
I am not one to write reviews on yelp. However, this review is a testament to how AWFUL mad dog in the fog's service was. 
The "waitress" or "bus lady" or whatever she does is the devil reincarnated. I have never had someone be so rude to me at a sports bar before. She seemed so unhappy with her life that she made me want to quit my job to train to be an astronaut like I have always wanted to be... I mean seriously though. As a customer that is spending $50+ on food and drinks, I should not have any thoughts that my waitress isn't about to go on a psychotic episode and shoot up the place. This is how rude and unhappy she presented herself the entire 2+ hours I was there. 

Just one example for her devilish approach to waiting on a table (there were plenty of examples but I have a life to attend too):
I received my burger. It did not have any cheese on it. So I kindly asked for cheese. She told me that I did not order cheese and that it was an extra charge. I told her that I had no problem paying extra for cheese. She then proceeded to tell me that since I ordered my food from the bartender, I had to propose my problem to him...

So I sat there quietly while she took the order from my 4 friends sitting at the table with me.

Once she was done with taking their orders, she looked at me (with those possessed devil eyes) and said, "Ohhhh.... SO you're not even going to eat the burger without cheese or what?"

I looked up and reiterated to her that she told me that I had to go up to the bartender to propose my problem. I did not want to get up rudely while she was taking my friends order so I decided to wait until she was through....

She then said "FINE. I will go get your cheese. Does cheddar work?" At this point, I am speechless. I just nod my head with a small inclination of agreement. My friend finally says what I have been itching to say the whole time "Excuse me but why do you have to be so rude about this cheese thing?" He just wants a piece of cheese on his burger."

She proceeded to ignore this comment completely and came back with a piece of cheese 10 minutes later. 

I will NEVER come back here to eat food. I will also never order a drink for the devil reincarnated even if it means I wait 30 minutes for the bartender. 

This was a very mind blowing experience. After reading all of the reviews below, I question the ownership of this bar. It seems I am not the only person who has had the unpleasure experience of meeting the worst server in human existence. 

ADVISE TO OWNERSHIP, there are a few 100,000 people in the bay area that could do a 10x better job than this girl is doing. Also, she is clearly unhappy. She will probably leave willing if you just bring it up.

Get her out of there so the food experience can be more enjoyable.
This place has amazing potential.

End of rant.
author: Andrew W.

description: Good beer selection, lots of TVs. Wasn't crowded on a Friday night, so we were able to get a booth. The music was loud, but not so loud that we couldn't have a conversation. They also serve food till late. Pretty decent place overall!
author: Jaching H.

description: We've been coming here for years to watch Packers games and sincerely miss Jules (both of them) and Derek (sp?). We love Mickey and the overall vibe of the bar.  We love the food; highly recommend the black bean quesadillas and wings! Have had Karissa as a server on a few occasions...she's just not the same...no friendly smiles, forgets orders (and blames it on us), and just not as genuine as the old crew. #bringbackjules
author: Sara J.

description:
Absolutely LOVE this place!
Stopped in the other day, and before I could even get my two feet in the door, I noticed that they have an interesting table with beer taps in the center of it. Turns out, after further inspecting this long table, the sign on it said that it was California's first self serve beer table. If you bring in a party of 8, you can sit here, put one card on the tab, pour your own beers, and enjoy! How awesome is that?! I've already begun rounding up some friends just so we can go experience this.

Aside that, the bartender there was extremely welcoming, personable, and knew how to pour some great drinks. They have a fully stocked bar, cash only though (ATM near by!), and there is an abundance of seating. I really liked that they have good prices on drinks and a nice patio outside if you want to grab some fresh air or sunshine rays during the daytime. If you prefer to stay inside and drink, you can enjoy watching a game of futbol/soccer on the TV's or play a game of pool!
author: Akvile D.

description: Decent selection of beer, terrible staff. Rude and unaware. Slow Sunday and 2 of us sit down to eat and drink with our two friends (who's beers were very low) and nobody comes to the table. After about 15 minutes I asked the bartender if there was a server, and he said "yeah. She's somewhere around here". Nice...
author: Sarah J.

description:
I came on a Saturday night. This place was alright. The beer was expensive. There was not that many people hanging around. The DJ was not really mixing, just pressing play. It was pretty spacious inside though so if you have a big party and not looking to clash with a big crowd, come here. It was also loud so don't expect the best heart-to-heart conversation to occur here.

This spot is A-OK!
author: Marlon T.

description:
do yourself a favor. order the grilled cheese and add grilled onions, tomato, jalapeno and avocado. sub the fries for garlic fries. your tummy will thank you.

we play trivia here every tuesday night.  the trivia is challenging without being douche-y and while we take issue with the music round week in and week out, we still keep coming back.  the beer list is extensive, they have many screens to watch whatever sports game suits your fancy. and that sandwich is really really very...very good.
author: Archana P.

description:
Before we begin, take some time and read the previous reviews for Mad Dog. Go ahead. I'll wait here.

No. Really. Read some of them.

All done? Okay. First, and real quick, did you also notice that most of the high-rating reviews say something to the effect of "I only went here once" (or implying some other number that can be counted on one hand)? Huh. Anyway, the reason for that preliminary exercise was so you could take in some patron reviews.

I'm not a patron of Mad Dog in the Fog. I'm one of their unfortunate neighbors.

Ask anyone who lives on that block, or in the buildings behind them. They'll tell you the same -- Mad Dog in the Fog runs their own little banal microcosm of beer-fueled stupidity with no regard to the people and places around them.

They hold really random hours which seem dictated by how much of a nuisance they can be. I was woken up at 7:00a this morning to the staff and early morning boozehounds SCREAMING at a soccer match.

They allow their patrons to ignore the smoking ordinance, but then whine and gripe about any of their neighbors smoking out back.

When the Giants won the World Series, it was Mad Dog's customers that trashed the street and nearly obliterated Memphis Minnie's work vehicle. They did nothing to keep their customers in check and, to my knowledge, never offered to help Memphis Minnie's with repairs (while the rest of the neighborhood did).

It's great that so many people want to visit the bar during the big sports games... and this somehow grants Mad Dog the divine providence to start an entry line that completely blocks flat and storefront entryways.

Any attempt to talk with the place about a peaceful coexistence is met with a shit-eating grin. Some of their closer neighbors have reported hearing them bitch about it later as they clean the back patio.

And the list could continue. But this is already at TLDR length.

With trivia night excluded, which seems to be the nights where Mad Dog sees the most sanity, it seems like a good place to shut off your brain, start some screaming matches over whatever, and hit on anything with a pulse. If that's your thing, then godspeed.

[EDIT]: Since writing this review a year ago, the bar has spiraled out of control. Their patrons continue to trash the block, they've had SFPD visit them on noise complaints, and their owner was seen tossing street items into the building above. Oh... and to the dealers who have started slinging openly at their front door, a warning -- there's currently a city initiative to install CCTV cameras along the block, so be on the lookout for those if the plan passes.
author: J. S.

description: The server was great   The nachos were ok.  Also, they only serve beer.
author: Dainis C.

description: Cool spot, but lacks in execution.  Happy hour specials are hardly even specials.  Minimum on the card that makes it pretty impossible to sit down for one drink alone.  Being a bartender seems like a job that is really pretty easy to be cool, but these ones don't seem to get it...won't chill & chat, don't seem happy, and don't really offer much other than a set of arms to pour drinks and give you change.  It's a shame being so close to a bus stop and so many laundromats that they don't really cater to the random person walking in just for a drink.
author: Alec W.

description:
This is a fun place to watch a soccer game! Obviously, it gets packed during the World Cup or European Championships, but they also open early on weekends so dedicated English Premier League fans can get their fill over a 7 AM Guinness.

They also have a great trivia night on Tuesdays and Thursdays. It is scheduled to start at 9, but by my experience it doesn't get going until at least 9:15.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Our server told us not to use the beer menu because it wss so outdated. When we asked what they did have, she referred us to the menu she just discredited.
author: Brandon M.

description:
I have waited to review this Pub because my experience is based off of the Euro Cup 2012 Championship game. My team won so of course it was a fantastic day at the bar. Alas, 4 stars despite by 5 star nestalgia. 
Points that stick out in my mind
-Somehow I always had a full beer in hand. Nice work servers!
-For big games, eating may be an issue. It was hard enough not elbowing someone while I tried to drink my beer. (PACKED standing room only) 
-Ladies beware....only one stall in the bathroom. 
Oh and Ladies...GET IT TOGETHER when you go to the bathroom! Multitask so you can pick up the pace in there. And sports bar primping is a no no.
author: Melissa R.

description: Whoa man, beer. For the newly 21, you will surely enjoy this place.
author: Em L.

description:
Casual spot, good place in the Lower Haight to play some pool and drink some beers.

11.11.13
author: Angela L.

description:
I usually come to this bar to play the trivia quiz on Tuesdays, but as that's an extremely popular night, so I hope the owners do pay attention to the review. 
First, the bar lacks coziness and seating room ever since its new reincarnation in its current shape. Sure, there are booths out there, but it's simply not enough space for all willing to play. I wouldn't be surprised if it gets too full even on a regular night. The other benches and bar seats do not really make a good seating for groups. 
The quizmaster was this Irish geezer who was okay albeit slow and somewhat repetitive in his questions. Still, his presentation made it tolerable. The new guy, however, is just waaaay toooo slooooow. I don't know if the bar encourages him to be slow hoping people would buy more drinks or what, but it's Tuesday night, for God's sake, and not everybody can stay past 11 pm, especially for a quiz starting at 8:30!

Service is so-so - typical SF, where you can often wait for his/her majesty The Bartender to finally look in your direction. Decent beer prices for specials (in SF terms, of course). Terrible street parking, so beware. What else? I much prefer the Mad Dog's sister pub Kezar, but I don't think they do quizzes there, unfortunately.
author: Evg R.

description: Horrible food, bitchy Irish waitress.....I ordered the guacamole and it was whatever, chicken strips burnt.....nice tvs to watch games though
author: Isabel S.

description:
I came here a couple of years ago for my friend's birthday gathering and hadn't been back until last Friday night. I hear their pub trivia nights are quite popular (read: crowded) but I've never attended. And last Friday the tables were mostly empty - please don't take that the wrong way, I prefer a less than packed scene!

Funnily enough, although this place is known for their beer list, half of our party was in the mood for wine. Apparently it was okay. I ordered an alcoholic ginger beer, and although it was a tad to sugary for my taste, it wasn't bad - and a nice change from regular ol' beer. 

This seems like an order at the bar type of place, but shockingly, the bartender/server came by about 4 times to check on us within the space of an hour. I guess it was a slow night for them....but no complaints about the service!

While I don't love the atmosphere or decor here (too many TVs showing too many sports games - of course, I'm sure this appeals to many people, just not me) the drinks and the service, plus the fact that I can nab a seat, are enough for a resounding 4-stars.
author: Lindsey B.

description: Really weird - we received terrible service or just outwardly mean attitudes from 2-3 different employees, but 1 bar tender was nice.  Great beer though.
author: Michael M.

description: Good beer selection, but be prepared for rude bartender and waitress when it's not busy. Toronado across the street is better.
author: Deborah C.

description:
Thankfully they don't serve hard alcohol here so saved myself from having to take birthday shots...that alone is worth 5 stars!

We booked the "Pour Your Own Beer" table and it was so fun.  They have 2 beers on tap and you pay per ounce.  The final bill wasn't bad at all and the novelty of serving yourself is fun...kind of like a keg party for grownups!  If all else fails in life I probably could be a bartender.  Service here was super nice also.
author: Jen C.

description:
watched australia vs argentina in rugby finals here on 10/24 at 9am... $20/person to get in (same at their sister pub kezar for international sports events). barman was friendly when i ordered their $20 pitcher special of palm belgian-style ale.

reason for low star rating: my irish boyfriend and australian friend ordered the full english breakfast and noticed it came with hash browns instead of baked beans. shrugging it off as some weird american twist they asked the waitress if they could substitute beans for the hash browns. 

the waitress accommodated and we enjoyed watching the wallabies win. when we got the bill we saw that they had charged $7.50 for the beans! sorry mad dog, those are beans from a can... both lads said the beans were cold and for that price they could've included the hash browns.

when my boyfriend asked if they could take off the charge the waitress refused, saying they had to charge extra for the beans... great customer service skills- no attempt to make the situation right.
author: Lorraine Y.

description: Disappointed in the rudeness of the bartender (aka Australian chick). She seemed unhappy with her life.
author: Kristine M.

description:
Came here to watch the Mexico vs. Brazil game, everything was great except for the fact that all the food tasted and looked like a blob of oily cheese. 

Overall the experience I had here was great. The crowds are fun and the waitress is great! She consistently checked on everyone and was great about keeping tabs in order without ever having to write anything down. I liked that there was outdoor seating as well and atmosphere was perfect for a pub. 

I just wish that my potato skins and sandwich weren't so soggy and overwhelmingly covered in grease and cheese. Yes I understand it is pub food but the grease was a little above and beyond.
author: Jacqueline C.

description: While this place has an extensive beer list and decent atmosphere the service my husband and I got was just awful. We sat down and ordered two beers, we were not planning on food and when the waiter discovered that we got totally ignored. We drank our beers and were planning on getting a second round but he just kept passing us up. We waved, we even said "hey, excuse me" "sir" and he just walked by. This went on for 30 minutes. The busser came by and grabbed our bottles and glasses and we asked if he could grab our waiter. We sat another 10 minutes as we watched him continue to go back and forth to his larger tables. Maybe he was overwhelmed. Maybe he didn't care to check on us because our tab was just drinks as opposed to wings and beer and everything. This bar could of had a lot more of our money this evening, had we not been ignored for an hour. 3 stars for a solid beer list.
author: Amanda E.

description:
place is nice and ventilated, servers are friendly and prompt, 
Food: does not seem to be their focus! :P their nachos were awful :( friends did not like their chicken wings either, on a different ocassion/day their breakfast sandwich was tasty, mimosas are just ok
difficult to park in this area of town
author: Giselle C.

description: Great bar crowd, which gives it 3 stars but the worst bartender ever. The owners must be really cheap - an Aston Villa cup final and only one bartender, and one waiter working the booths. They ran out of Mad Dig Pilsner early but the one so so bartender is way too busy to change it out.  The owners are AV fans, so WTF?  Didn't they think it might be busy?!
author: Scotty P.

description:
A few years ago I poked my head in the door of this joint to get a feel for a real, honest-to-goodness Irish bar and was not disappointed. Oh, it was divey. And if you weren't a regular, you got an honest-to-goodness Irish stare from those who were. But in its divey-ness it certainly didn't disappoint.

Word on the street was that they had a remodel take place. Probably the old word on the street, but finding myself back in SF and with a little time before dinner at the BBQ joint a few doors down I popped my head in again to check the work. Wowza. Is this the same place? It needed more verification, so this time I popped my whole body in and we bellied up to the bar. I wasn't drinking, but the other two in the group got an Irish something-or-other (beer ain't my strong suit-deal with it) on tap, and a glass of white wine. You can guess how this ends. Beer=yay. Wine=shoulda stuck with beer. It's a pub, for crying out loud. It's like getting pork links at a Jewish Deli. I mean, it's not exactly their strong suit. 

The remodel looks great. Much better lighting, much lighter in general. I never knew there was a back patio, but it looked delightful to go hang out. A much more mainstream crowd now, so if you have your fill of bars with "character" (see also: Toronado across the street) you can come here for a brew. There are a few coolers with bottles of some harder-to-find suds for the beerventurous.

There's plenty of personality left over, but now with a more welcoming atmosphere and staff. Stick with the beer (I didn't taste the food) and grab a booth, sit on the patio, or belly up to the bar.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
This place was my main hang on Trivia Thursdays - pretty much EVERY week. 

Only problem - there are only about six booths [they are large] and about 10 barstools. On Trivia Thursdays I would regularly arrive about two hours early to secure a booth for my team - otherwise we'd be huddled around anything that we could write answers on. 

Beer and wine only, but that's not so bad - they have an awesome selection.
author: Stephani C.

description:
Not the worst bar. Definitely not the best.

An okay beer selection, but nothing to write home about. Food is decent, but again not great. Plays lots of soccer on the multiple TVs, so that's cool.

Not great customer service. My boyfriend and I visited one evening that wasn't very busy, maybe 8 other people at the bar. The bartender spoke to us enough to take our initial drink order and then our food order (once we flagged him down). Once we finished eating, we waited nearly 20 minutes before I had to walk across the bar and get the bartender's attention myself in order to get our check. As we were putting on our jackets, the bartender finally came over to us to apologize for "abandoning" us and offered us a drink on the house. A fairly decent gesture, however, we were OBVIOUSLY already on our way out. Too little, too late.

Wouldn't say we'll never go back, because I think it might deserve a second shot. But I'm not in any rush to give it that second shot quite yet.
author: Bridget M.

description: Mad dog has a tremendous beer selection and a large bar. Service was prompt. There is also a variety of seating options so my friends and I were able to play several rounds of cards.  The crowd grew and shrank every 30 minutes as this bar is one of several on the block...so if it looks crowded just wait a few minutes and chances are you'll find some space.
author: Mike S.

description:
If I lived near this bar, I'd be there every Friday night.  Friendly employees, big, clean space and a fun crowd.  Dogs allowed.  Also saw some kids bring their pizza in to eat.  A totally laid-back "neighborhood pub" feel.  Even though my friend and I closed the place, they never made us feel like they were eager to get us out of there.

My only complaint is a trivial one...the lightbulb in the bathroom burned out so I had to, um, take care of business in pitch black darkness.  Good thing I have lots of practice.
author: Valeria R.

description: I like this place...the beer selection is outstanding.  Staropramen on tap?  Awesome.  I have heard friends disparage the food enough that I have never eaten here, nor do I plan to.  For a big space there is not a lot of seating, including the patio, so get there early if there is a popular game on.  As with all of Haight Street, parking sucks.  A go to spot to watch EPL.
author: Ken P.

description:
I love Mad Dog in the Fog.  It's one of the few places around that has NFL Sunday Ticket so they play all the NFL games.  The place is also an unofficial Green Bay Packer bar, which I enjoy because I'm a die hard fan and I live less than a mile away from this place.

Mad Dog can get really crazy during soccer games when Euros and Spaniards fill the place.  Actually a really fun atmosphere, even when you're trying to watch real football.  

Great beer selection, reasonably priced, friendly bartenders.  I'm a regular at this bar, and while I love going for games or for an afternoon drink, I probably wouldn't choose this place as a late night option.  Rather head to Toronado for that.
author: Timothy J.

description:
I hate to be this person and give a bad review but . . . 

Went here last night and before I went to order a drink, I had to use the restroom. The ladies room toilet was clogged and filled to the brim. So I thought I'd just mosey into the mens room and use that. Much to my dismay, there was no toilet seat annnnnd there was poop on the wall.

We told the bus boy about it and all he said was, "Well it's a bar, people shit all over it."

This probably wouldn't have bothered me as much if it weren't for the fact that this place serves food and alcohol.

There was another time I went and it was pretty empty, but they had to music SO LOUD that my group could barely hear each other. Normally I'm down for loud music, but it was uncomfortably loud.

Kind of a bummer considering the other bars on that block are out of this world.
author: Ronnie C.

description: I've only been to this place once, but I got the fish and chips and it was great. The piece of fish was almost the length of my fore arm. I expected it to be mostly fried batter but I was wrong. I would definitely go back.
author: Sean B.

description: No hard alcohol, but other than that a great place and they have pub quizzes!  Perfect to watch a game or have a casual hangout with friends.  Authentic Irish bartenders is a plus.
author: Leith M.

description: Service ok but charging 20USD for rugby fans to watch a game is crazy,don't come here to watch the rugby if you do find ypurswlf in san francisco
author: Anaru P.

description:
Mad Dog in the Fog does what few neighborhood brewpubs in San Francisco can claim. 

They make damn good tacos. 

Sure, most other bars serve tacos, but they're tossed together street taco style and either immolate your face upon impact, or they're so bland that they should come with their own 'womp womp' upon biting. Mad Dog has some seriously good chicken tacos with chipotle sauce that I heartily gobbled down last night.

Speaking of last night, definitely come out for Tuesday and Thursday night trivia. It starts a little after 9pm, runs deep into the 11pm hour, but it's a great crowd and all sorts of fun. Try the Alchemy Beer while you're there, it's a flavorful IPA that goes down way smoother than most.

I'll definitely be back, great job!
author: Kevin B.

description:
I need to go back to this place asap. I only spent an hour or so here last time, but was amazed by the GIGANTIC selection of beer. Any place with that many beers on tap and huge refrigerators filled with import beers is my kind of place.

Also important, bartenders seemed pretty friendly, unlike another nearby beer haven (*cough* toronado *cough*.) The night I went they were also playing a bunch of 60s/70s reggae songs, which made the experience even better.
author: Jon T.

description:
This is a solid neighborhood bar. 

Highlights:

- Tons of space, although I've never been out on the patio... but there's a patio.
- Great service: waitresses/bartenders/possible-owner-types... all really nice/efficient.
- Decent food: I've had the nachos, wings, and probably some other things I can't remember (chips?)
- Great beer selection
- Tons of TVs... and they're not whine-y about changing channels for you
- Awesome trivia on Tuesdays AND Thursdays. Doubling up on trivia is the secret to my heart.*

___________________________


*NOTE: It would be better if trivia teams that are smarter than mine stopped showing up. Cool? Cool.
author: Jake D.

description:
Bartender gave me grief for 

A. Liking the Red Sox.
B. Not tipping more than $1 per drink.

Unacceptable.  You never make fun of your customers.  Especially when they are being generous to you.  Worst service of my life. 

Even if the prices are good, I will NEVER return to this place. I'd rather grab a 40 of OE and go drink with a bum.
author: Bill C.

description:
A ton of bottled craft beer!

Micky gave awesome service. Super chill vibe with a pool table, tv's, and great Pandora jams. (Key in artist: Oasis). I loved my experience here.
author: Elise G.

description:
Used to come here years ago, and would enjoy the kind of crappy pub vibe and trivia. Went last night for the first time in a while, and yeah, this place got a make over.

Which is fine, but it's like a different bar now. Flat screens all around, still showing soccer games, but now they have pool tables and such. It was cleaner, but the local watering hole vibe was gone.

Good beer selection, though not comparable with Toronado. Had a pint of the Newcastle Summer Ale and a pint of the Drifters IPA, both came in at $5 a pop. 

The food looked a bit pricey (large order of buffalo wings was $15.50!) so we skipped it.

Overall, nice place to watch a soccer game, but seeing as how I don't particularly like soccer, I probably won't rush back.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Great bar! They carry a huge selection of beers. The vibe is cool. Wish they had mixed drinks.
author: Molly V.

description:
I've been here a few times with my football(soccer) loving buddies for some early morning beers. Every visit is a great time, even the standing room only World Cup game between England and Germany.

The beers are cheap and cold, the staff are friendly, and the patrons are welcoming. The selection of brews is larger that I expected but a good fall back is always a cold PBR's. You guess the card under the cap and the beer is on the house, always a fun game. I've only won a few times but the bartender was pretty damn good; two in a row is impressive. But enough of that.

I hear the food is pretty tasty; it sure did look and smell delicious. It's a cash only place so stop by the money machine before you head there; the ATM inside, next door, and across the street all charge a hefty fee. Parking sucks.

I will undoubtedly return.
author: Justin C.

description:
I should definitely revisit my review for Mad Dog, given that it became a regular stop for me and my friends while I lived in the Lower Haight.

The bar staff is extremely friendly, even when the bar is packed for sporting events.  The weekday trivia contests are fun, and between the pool tables and the board games behind the bar you'll be able to keep yourself busy.

The beer garden's a nice touch, though it is only a couple tables big.

+1 for dog-friendliness, though you'll likely want to keep your pooch on-leash.

Only real gripe is that the pitcher prices are ridiculous.  Very little in the way of volume discount for us people with drinkin' friends.
author: Bill H.

description: I love this bar. It has sooo many freaking beers on tap and in bottles. It makes my head spin a little just thinking about it, but the selection is topped by the fantastic prices. The food also helps soak up the copious amounts of alcohol you'll be drinking, especially if you come on St. Patrick's Day as my girlfriend and I did. It helps that I also won two pitchers of free beer through the raffle. Trivia nights on Tuesdays and Thursday as well. Cool beans, man, cool beans.
author: Danny C.

description:
It's a great, local-feeling, chill bar... the kind of place where "everybody knows your name" and you know exactly what you're going to get no matter what night of the week. 

We had a farewell party for a friend there one night, rented the front table with our own keg/tap and they had a great set up for us with plenty of pint glasses, napkins (we were messy), and great service when we had issues with getting the pressure right with the keg. 

Long story short: Pool table, back patio, trivia, good beer, good food (2 words, corn dogs), good people... I mean, what more could you really want?
author: Littany W.

description:
This spot (and spots like it) beg the question, "why is there a Yelp ambience category "hipster" but not one dubbed "brodeo" or "fratastic" because the pervasive vibe of Mad Dog screams for "Jager Bombs!!". For that reason I only come here Thursday nights for Trivia which starts around 9:15. The spots jumping by 8:45 so come early to grab prime seating. The trivia is alright. Not too easy. Not too hard. 

There are often drinks specials and ridiculously awesome number of beers on tap-- probs to rival their neighbors Tornado. Price point is $4-6 depending on the draft. The serve pitchers which is a godsend considering the crowd makes for a 10 minute bar line.

A weird note on bathrooms. Urinals are in clear view from the smoking patio. While I doubt that ladies are actively trying peep on some dong, I'd hate for a random glance on a random cold evening to stir negative impressions/derisive laughter and may in turn cause unconfident bros to angrily buck at this here brodeo. That would not be a good scene at all. So cover up to avoid unnecessary scrutiny.
author: Quentin J.

description:
Great neighborhood sports bar with a huge beer selection. Can be hard to get a table or seat at the long barfor a big game so get here early if you want a seat! Decent bar food, reasonable prices, and big tvs everywhere. They have a tv in the back patio too which is great on a nice day. Irish nachos with bacon (fries with nacho toppings and bacon) are a standout on the menu and the service is usually great. I'm a fan.

BTW their WiFi password = the bar's phone number with no dashes or spaces.
author: Jake L.

description:
Overall good Irish bar. Boddingtons on tap!
Cash only.
Had the hot wings, which was no different then most and he burger was good.

will definitely return
author: Stephen T.

description: Charging $20 to watch the rugby World Cup final when it is free to air is a joke. We went down the road and watched for free. Poor form. For the previous games they claimed it wasn't for them but the broadcaster. Never going there again.
author: Ed H.

description: Mad dog has tremendous beer selection, great for sports. Unfortunately there is tons of totally wasted space with the large booths and they have the worst trivia announcer ever. Seriously, speaking fast with an accent in a loud bar makes it so we are lucky to hear 50% of your words. Nice patio.
author: John S.

description:
The Story of the Time I  Locked Myself INSIDE the Bathroom at Mad Dog for 4 Minutes-

I had spent about 2 hours at Mad Dog, which certainly meant I had to pee. I went into the bathroom and locked the door. Minutes later, I tried to leave. I made several attempts to unlock the door, you know, by turning the lock and - nothing. I could see the lock not moving. I was trapped. I fumbled with it for A GOOD 4 MINUTES, almost giving myself a panic attack, and then got so mad I kicked it. It opened. 

As I walked out I realized they had sports on their tvs. It'd be a chill place to watch a Lakers game. I'm just going to use the mens bathroom next time.
author: Emily D.

description: Went in for trvia night. it was nothing special. We could barely hear the questions that were asked for the trivia. they only serve beer with only ONE bartender. (korean liqour) the only really good thing i liked were there fries.
author: Tiffany C.

description: This bar is extremely disruptive to the neighborhood. There are always people screaming, which can be heard from blocks away. Lots of drunk aggressive guys hanging out. Weird, sketchy people who may or may not work there handing out flyers in front of the bar. And there is ALWAYS tons of puke all over the sidewalk in front this place. Any bar that allows drinking customers to serve themselves their own alcohol should be closed forever. After this place finally closes it will take years to permanently wash the puke away.
author: Grey Z.

description:
This place is absolutely my goto pub in the lower haight. They've always got football playing on the TV and have a wonderful selection of beers on tap. They pour a pretty decent guiness too!

The pub grub is okay... I wouldn't recommend the nachos. Stick to the Pub essentials: hamburgers, fish, and chips. 

Trivia night is a hoot as well. We usually have to show up two hours early, at seven, to get a table. I'm absolutely terrible at trivia, so my plan is to just drink till I'm decent at answering the questions... That doesn't usually end well.
author: Mike C.

description: You suck!! Have people from the UK wanted to watch soccer said you open up @7a but it as closed. Thanks for nothing!
author: geoff k.

description: A perfect place for a soccer fan. I go there for any US national team game and the place goes wild when we score. It's nice to be surrounded by soccer passion
author: Lana P.

description:
While compiling my newest list, I was shocked to find I had yet to review the Mad Dog. HANDS DOWN, the best football (soccer) bar I have ever been to in the 48 continental states. I often wonder while in the midst of early morning matches about moving out to SF just to be closer to the place. 

I've spent way too many mornings with a plate full of the Greedy Bastard and an ice cold Guinness in front of me all while either cheering audaciously or writhing in the misery in an Arsenal or Inter win/loss. 

The staff can be a little hard edged until you get to know them and if you are not particular to dark and dank British style pub atmospheres, this may not be your cup of tea. But if you find yourself awake at 5am to follow your own team's season, why not come in and join the damn fine few of us who do too?
author: Tony C.

description: What an extensive beer list! A must see if you are a beer enthusiast the food is decent bar food & quick service!
author: Jakke F.

description:
I can't help but like this place since our team (Nietzsche's Moustache) won trivia night here! We somehow hauled together a decent team that knew random ass crap. Pretty well-organized trivia game and we didn't see much cheating on all them smartphones. We'll always remember what albumen is.

Beer selection is great (Bloo moon) and plenty of people were doing wine here.
author: Kevin L.

description: Kudos to mad dog to staying true to what they are all about.  I have had mixed experiences here, but meeting "Irish" Jules and chatting cider (why can't we have the old Strongbow, she and I wonder?)  Made me love this place.  She's awesome, and turned me on to the Blackthorn dry cider on tap.  Delicious!  Thank you,  Jules!
author: One Girl's Opinio N.

description:
Their name is dumb. 
Cider selection is good. 
Irish bartender is a dick. But go figure.
author: L P.

description:
I had a pretty good time here - early evening/afternoon to watch a basketball game with friends. Tons of tvs, so if you wanna watch sports you will have a tv to entertain you no matter where you sit (I hear there is even one on the patio). But if you want to talk to your friends while you watch the game, good luck. It is extremely loud (to the point of it being on the ridiculous side). The service was a tad slow as the place was pretty busy for the game - but had to go get drinks from the bar every so often as we were never sure when we were going to see the server again. 

The food was, eh ok. Bar food - nothing to talk about, got the BLT probably wouldn't order it again. The nachos looked good, but didn't try them so can't comment on the taste. 

Seems like they have a pretty good vibe and steady regulars.
author: Shannon H.

description: Free pool during trivia night. Guess more places is doing this so nothing special.
author: Minh H.

description:
I love coming here for Tuesday Trivia. Mad Dog serves beer and wine but their beer selection should impress any beer snob. 

I can not speak highly enough of the Tuesday night waitress. Last night we ended up leaving her a 40% tip because she's that awesome. It doesn't matter if we are having a water night or a beer me every ten minutes night, she's always there to fill our drinks. She's also recognized us as regulars and helped us to find a booth when we once arrived late. 

They have a patio they leave open even during the winter. It's great for those unseasonably warm days but patrons going in and out tend to leave the door open so it can get really cold inside, I normally bring a heavy jacket to leave on.
author: Amy L.

description:
Reasons Why I Enjoyed my Thursday night @ Mad Dog In The Dog:

1. BYOF (you can bring in food from the pizza place across the street, snacks and chips from the walgreens across the street or get an Aaahh-mazing sausage at Rosamundes.
2.  $15 pitcher special (regular pitches are ~ $18)
3. Great mixed crowd 
4. Trivia questions were relevant and fair

Note:
