If you're going to trivia which starts at 9:15pm, be sure to get there about an hour earlier, especially if you have a large party... unless you don't mind standing!

Overall, I enjoyed my experience there. Prob better than the other trivia places I've been to. Atmosphere is real chill and everyone gets really into trivia, which makes it a lot more fun!
author: Gloria C.

description:
Oh I love the atmosphere of this place and very chill and relaxing. I meant to come here to watch the Rugby games but never made it out so I finally made it to this place for the San Francisco Beer Week and I tell you... They have the BEST Cider beer! Their Apple cider on tap is good but my favorite is the Pear Cider Beer on tap... oh so DELISH!! 

I love them even more because they also serve food and considering during SF Beer week I was bar hoping this place was my last stop and I am glad I ended it on this note so their appetizers that we ordered were tasty :) 

I am definitely a fan and will definitely be back when I am in town
author: Alisi M.

description:
I Already loved this place, but now I love it even more!

So, My friends and I go to thursday night trivia pretty often, It's become a bit of a ritual. It's always a great time! The staff is awesome, trivia is a blast, the food is yummy, and beer selection is plentiful. 

I had a little bit too much fun and unknowingly dropped my wallet on the ground and didn't realize it till the next day. Panic stricken, I called and they had indeed found it and kept it for me. A LOVELY gentleman named Derek happily gave it back to me. :)
So obvioulsy, the staff is honest and the people that go there are decent folks. 

I love you Mad Dog xoxo
author: Dayna E.

description:
I came here based on a recommendation of a friend who called it "the nicest sports bar he's ever been in." So, when I came in, there were high expectations, and Mad Dog meets them!

- Reasonably priced drinks: one of the big negatives of fancy sports bars are high priced drinks, but here, a pitcher of Shocktop (what we had flowing all throughout Sunday Football) will run you $17. Not cheap, but pretty reasonable.
- Okay food: Huge quesadillas and awesome garlic fries.
- THE BOARD GAMES: The best part of this place is that Mad Dog has all your favorite childhood games (Apples to Apples, Cranium, Jenga, Connect Four, etc) that you can play while buzzed. An opportunity to be with your inner-child once again! 

So, there you have it -- beer, food, football, friends, and board games . . . what more can you ask for!?!?
author: Linna L.

description:
Ah... the local watering hole.

Every Tues/Thurs night around 9PM is Trivia Night. I totally suggest going early or you'll end up writing your answers using your friend's back as a writing surface. It gets crowded, but it's a ton of fun and the bar service never falters. My favorite bartenders (Jordan and Jules) are also behind the bar on those nights and that certainly makes it all the better.

Something to keep in mind... this place is beer & wine only. Typically that doesn't seem to be a problem for most of my friends, and the ones that have issues with it usually run down to another bar, have a shot and run on back.

It's an all-around, great bar with a mind-blowing beer selection.
author: Justin G.

description: We went here today for lunch. There was a soccer game going on so the bar was filled with people watching the game. All of the booths that could sit 6 people had 2 people in each of them. We had to sit outside in the cold on wet benches. That was pretty annoying. The waitress was very friendly. I tried the bangers and mash because you have to try an authentic English dish at an English pub. I was very pleasantly surprised by how good it was. We also got their garlic fries which were really good! So, seating situation, don't come if there is a soccer game going on! Other than that, the food is good!
author: Tara T.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood. Love this place! The beer selection is HUGE and the food is great as well. If you're looking for a solid bar you can regularly traffic, Mad Dog in the Fog is for you.
author: Chase M.

description:
Came here with three others on 2/15/13 at 3:00 pm.  We walked by, saw a happy hour specials sign and decided to give it a try.  It was completely empty except for maybe about 4 people.  It was self seating and you had to approach the bartender to order your drinks. 

I was impressed with the selection they had on draft during SF Beer Week.  The bartender allowed us to try beer samples for free before buying and offered fantastic recommendations to the variety of beers that we liked.  Her recommendations were spot on. 

Overall, I would definitely return if i am in the neighborhood.  It's across the street from Toronado, another awesome bar.
author: Sokha S.

description: Really fun trivia and nice selection of beers. Food was just ok.
author: Mark W.

description:
I only really come here for trivia and would never come here for the food, which is terrible.  I mean, I guess it's bar food, so I guess it meets my low expectations, but that is pretty much it.

I guess I'm not really qualified to judge sports bars, though, considering I have no affection for either sports or alcohol.

Recommended:
Ahi tuna tacos
author: Norman S.

description:
Really a three star place but I sometimes go here to catch footy since it has what I think is a Euro pub feel - even before the recent remodel to make it more so. The bartenders are nice enough - service with a smile - but may change if you don't order more than one beer while here. 

The crowd is definitely diverse, though a bit geared toward the European-ish and "hipster" crowd. As a result, sometimes there's a general snobbiness towards MLS and US soccer unless it's a big time event. Still, there are usually a smattering of American fans in full support. Plus, the place makes it up with fun trivia nights.

However, I would not go out of the way to come here only for this place, since it's difficult to find parking in the area. If have other reasons or passing through, then yes.
author: Peter L.

description:
My first time at Mad Dog was yesterday for the Super Bowl. I thought it was smart of Mad Dog to charge a cover in a busy part of town - it kept the place from getting too crowded, and the crowd was fun and friendly. There were a lot of people, so very few people got to sit, but the service was still excellent. We still got food in a reasonable amount of time, and the pitchers came regularly. Our waitress was great about checking in and making sure we were ok, and her attitude stayed positive and professional, even after 8+ hours of us asking her for things!

Overall, I would definitely go back to Mad Dog as a stable "grab a beer and watch a game" kinda place on Haight Street. Yay! I'm a fan.
author: Sally R.

description:
Waited over 30 minutes for a sandwich when the place was dead empty and slow. Can't fathom what they could possibly be doing that would take the kitchen so long to make a simple sandwich when no one else was ordering food. WTF!

This pace, however, is a great spot with a good selection of beers and a nice outside patio with a foose ball table. Service is slow and terrible as is the food, but it's a great fun place in the Haight to get some good beers and watch the games.
author: Uriah B.

description: Very congenial place with excellent fish and chips and friendly, attentive service. Large selection of draft beers. Highly recommended!
author: Rita O.

description:
Trivia on Thursdays is SO crowded. Don't expect to get a place to sit unless you come well before the 9:15 starting time. And by 9:15 I mean 9:30, they never start on time. I've heard there's trivia other nights, but I have yet to witness it. 

What I like about Mad Dog: 
-Large selection of beers
-Festive, cozy wintertime decorations (They put up a huge real xmas tree over the holidays!)

What I don't like:
The food. Not worth it. Go across the street to Rosamunde's if you want bar food.

Things to note:
-Cash only
-Pool table
-Outside patio that closes at 9pm
author: Talia G.

description:
I'm actually a little upset this place had such good reviews because we came here yesterday based on that and I had found a Groupon for it when I was searching for a pub but it was lack luster. The service was non-existent and the food was not worth the wait or price. 
    
    The service:
We walked in a little after 4pm and it was hot and muggy inside, a few people at the bar, they kind of looked like regulars and nobody acknowledged us until we walked up to the bar. I was unaware the kitchen didn't open until 5pm (my mistake) but we got a pitcher and the boys played billiards until we could order. The bartender told me the server would come around when we could order, which did not happen. When I finally went back up to the bar she sent the server over. We ordered 3 apps(guac and chips, potato chips and onion rings) and 4 entrees ( 2 fish and chips, 1 house salad and a grilled chicken sandwich) It took this place over an hour to get our food and it was incomplete. We ended up leaving before or 3rd appetizer (potato chips) made its way out and told them to give our 4th app to the people at the bar because we had a concert we needed to get to and could no longer wait.
 
   The food:
The fish and chips were greasy and the fries were soggy. My salad just looked like someone opened a bag of greens and put it on a plate and the grilled chicken sandwich which took the longest to come out was pounded so thin (don't know why) it was barely an inch thick and it was drier than sand. 

The most annoying part of it all was that we had to keep flagging them down to get any attention (a problem "the regulars" sitting at the bar didn't seem to have). A few times we looked over the staff looked bored and the server may even have had a drink at one point. When we tried to get our check it took them another 5 min to box our onion rings! They told us one of the ovens had broken down that morning and had we known that before we ordered we would've cut back on our order. Either way I think it's time an honest review was put here because this place was far from a 4.5 star place.
author: Karina G.

description: Is there a better place to watch sports in this end of San Francisco? I think not.  Huge beer selection, about 20 flat screen TVs, one giant projection screen, and great atmosphere.  Roll Tide.
author: John H.

description:
This place is a good spot to go to for watchin' Giants game and drinking excellent beer. They also have a few things of wine, and every time I've been they had their house Sangria for $6. Sadly, I am allergric if I have too much beer :'( but 1 is A-ok!

+ Dope layout, can get crowded, if you see a table open snag it while you still can because people like myself do "park it" here for a couple hours. 

- A couple of times the staff is really flakey. A few times the waitress forgot to refill/ bring me my drink. And sometimes they accept card, other times it is cash only?? Pick one please. 

- Occasoinally realllllly slow, even when it isn't busy. Common people, we want to drink/ spend money. Get it?

+ Hot wings are boooooooooomb. I can smell them right now..... mmmmmm

Conclusion: This place is alright, I've been to better places. It's a hit or miss.
author: Julia D.

description: I went back here for trivia night again. It's much easier with a bigger group but still had fun with 2 other friends. The BBQ pulled pork sandwich is awesome. The second time I went I tried the mahi mahi fish tacos... WOW. These were good. There were 3 of them and they had a nice spice to them and squeezing the lemon slice over it made it that much better. Great spot for Tuesday night trivia. They usually have a drink special and have a variety of choices.
author: Marty J.

description:
I'm rating this bar 4 stars mainly because of their outside patio- always a great addition to a sports pub, and a great place for large groups!
Besides this the bartenders are friendly, they have a good selection of brews in tap, it's a fun place to watch a game at, there are generally a good handful of cute boys to glance at, their corn dogs look and smell amazing, and it's in the Lower Haight. My only complaint is that they won't let me bring my dog in. Boo on that.
author: Sonya D.

description: I do not know if there is a mad dog in the fog but I can tell there was a mad guest at the bar. That was me. Something was wrong with my chicken stripes and I wanted to pass my feedback to the manager but he was not available. It was not a big deal but by ignoring me the manager missed the chance to avoid losing a customer, after all my disappointment would have been fixed with just an apology.
author: Pancho M.

description:
I just have to reiterate.....

I HATE THIS PLACE

I also hate the people who go here and scream...especially that woman with the shrill voice
author: Marz W.

description:
Mad Dog is a pretty solid Irish bar in the lower Haight that has a great trivia night and a lot of TVs for watching the game.  Run by *real Irish people*!

I have mostly only been here for trivia nights, which are well-done but are perhaps a bit too crowded for my liking (unless you get there like an hour before it starts, you have a hard time getting a booth and end up standing basically on top of others teams).  Trivia on Tuesday is slightly less crowded than Thursdays.  

They also have a table you can reserve that has its own tap built-in, and you can pour your own beer (I think it's unlimited at least until the tap runs out??).  

Mad Dog pretty laid-back / casual / divey, it is but not run down.  They only serve beer / sangria / I think a few types of wine (no hard-A here) and don't take CCs but do have an ATM.  I slightly prefer Toronado because it seems to be a little quieter, but this is a fine spot as well.
author: Molly B.

description:
I want to start by saying I used to LOVE this place... back when it was an English pub!  I give it 2 stars for the nostalgia...

I love the owner, but I find it disgusting what he's done with the place.  Free space with tables has been replaced by booths and all of the English flags, national scarves, and footie jersies have been taken down. The place has been turned into a typical yuppie-friendly Irish bar...  as if we don't have enough of those...  And I just want to say for the record that if an English person bought an Irish pub and did the same nobody would shut up about it.  Disgusting.

I can't stand watching games at this spot anymore because it's worse than getting a root canal.  Everyone's talking, debating stats to prove how "die hard" they are, and trying to get laid so you can't even watch in peace.  The separate room has been removed to accommodate a pool table, so you can't even watch replays in peace or get away from all the nonsense.  There are much better options for drinks and catching matches...  The owner also owns Kezar pub, which to me is actually a far better option of the two, though not the only options in the city.

And now for my rant...  Footie has only in recent years started being televised in US.  Years back, folks had to pay to watch in a pub and do the best they could to keep updated on teams via online or newspapers which was difficult at best.  When I was going to pubs and paying to watch, the place was filled with Euros and Brits, so any American who tries to tell me they're a "die hard" fan for years is full of bollocks and I mean no disrespect in saying this, it's just the truth.  Take off your brand new jersies, be quiet, and let folks watch the game!
author: N J.

description:
I met some friendly pool mates here and had a blast. The kind staff and unpretentious crowd found here is what keeps me coming back to the Lower Haight. I need to schedule a return visit!

P.s. A good number of eateries are conveniently located nearby for those post-pool workout (boozing) cravings.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Mad Dog In The Fog is the closest thing to a sports bar in the Haight.

The place has a small patio in the back and the place has several TVs around the joint.
The place is decent size, but it can be difficult to find a seat if it's busy.

They have a decent selection of beers and the wait staff is friendly.

This is a decent spot if you're in the area and craving a sports bar atmosphere.
author: Ayall S.

description:
Has the only drinkable perry (pear cider) I know of in SF: Sir Perry, in the can. Also carries Dry Blackthorn on draught, which while not a great cider is a far cry above the usual cider offerings.

Great pub-style food, though a bit lean on the vegetarian options (they're modeling a pub of about 20 years ago). I recommend sharing the nachos with a few friends, as they're huge.

The main drawback of the place is the sheer number of televisions. I can understand one or two, and since they've gone for a sportsbar theme over the original "London pub" theme, I can accept that they're on all the time, not just for big games. Fourteen TVs is overkill, and a big detraction from pub atmosphere.
author: Doc Splendid E.

description:
This place gets three stars instead of two for two reason: One, trivia night is really fun, and two, their beer selection is awesome.

First, trivia. It happens on Tuesdays and Thursdays at nine(ish). You get with a group, and are given pieces of papers on where you must write your (carefully selected and witty) team name. There are seven rounds of eight questions each. First is general knowledge (easy). You'll have a current affairs round, a picture round where you are given a piece of paper with pictures of people that you need to name, a music round where you need to name the artist (think name that tune, but just the artist) and other trivia. Some questions are very easy, some are very hard. There are breaks between every 2 rounds and scores are read periodically. The winning team gets $30; the runner up gets a pitcher of beer. It's fun times.

Beer selection: great. GOod selection of stuff on tap, but then they've also got a lot of rare and special beers in bottles. If you are a beer fan or snob, you are going to love their beer menu.

Everything else about this place gets two stars in my book. It's just nothing very special. If you order food here, make it bar food to munch on (wings, fries) and don't plan on coming for dinner.

My friends came last week for pre-trivia dinner. We were there before 8. Maybe 7:45? We ordered a few burritos and a sandwich and they came well after 9pm, after several "just five minutes guys..." It was just a few burritos. What were they doing back there?

On top of that, the food was not very good. I had a black bean burrito and it was flavorless--I had to douse every bite with salt and hot sauce to even want to keep eating it (and I was hungry). The fries were limp. I was very unimpressed. Even bar food is supposed to be tasty. It's bad for you! How hard can it be?

On top of that, we were sitting outside. Then someone came and turned the lights out and said the patio was closed. Which no one had told us before. Then they said they'd turn the lights back on and we could stay. Then someone else came and told us it was closed. Now we were in the dark and still waiting 45+ minutes for our food.

The staff was nice, though, and our very sweet waitress managed to snag us a booth inside once it opened up so we could finally get our food (1.5 hours later?) and could stay there for trivia night.

Come for a beer, but not to eat.
author: Courtney A.

description:
A friend of mine, and I waltzed in here one day while we were in the neighborhood, simply because the name tickled us. What we found was beer heaven.

It seems like something of your standard dank dark dive from the outside, but the interior is actually not too shabby, a nice glossy wood finish with some pool tables. 

I recommend that you check their list of beers before you approach the bar. It is on a nail at on the wall just before the bar, the list is by country. It's sort of overwhelming at first looking at however many pages of beers, but just pick a country and go for it!
author: Samatha S.

description:
I thought it was OK...just that....OK!

You can watch the games.....you can eat some good food.....but I have had better!

The service is what saved this place!
author: Kenneth G.

description:
It's in my area so I go but I wouldn't go to it if it weren't in my area.  I think it has so many things going for it but there are just some things that don't work for it...

pool table almost fits and maybe could ---- but just doesn't

some beers a bit on the pricey side for what they are

the tap beer seems to taste old liney to me

food is HORRIBLE - dull menu, old grease taste, and god just do not use the "bbq sauce" I don't know what it actually is but it's sweet and bitter and rancid 

no longer allowed to bring Rosamund's sausages in from across the street like you used to

some good things...

a decent place for sports watching on TV

the big booth tables

the new bar extension

the outside seating on the patio out back

lots of space
author: Dizzy L.

description: Pretty chill establishment here. Came for the NBA finals and one person in the group reserved the Keg Table which is freakin awesome. The happy hour food was great too - although I can't remember what I ate, possibly due to alcohol. I would definitely come again for HH or just good ol' drinkin.
author: Ryan D.

description:
This was my spot for the World Cup a few years back, and I've been back sporadically for trivia night. They have decent offerings on draft, but they can get pricey for the area if you get into the craft offerings. They have solid European offerings (Leffe, Stella, Harp, etc) in line with the pub theme.

The trivia nights are fairly challenging, and the place can get very very crowded. Tuesday starts at 8 and Thursday starts at 9, the latter being a bit of a downer because it is difficult to stick around until the end if work beckons the next morning.

Overall, I enjoy coming here and will definitely be back, but it's the company I'm with not the destination that always takes me to the Dog.
author: Gregory S.

description: I love the atmosphere. It's really the only thing that brought me back. This review begins on a Sunday, I ordered a chicken sandwich. The chicken sandwich came out cold, tasteless, and plain. No big deal, I send it back. The staff is apologetic, but only apologetic. Fast forward to last Sunday evening. I go in to meet a friend, we grab beers. After the first beer we had to chase the bartender down each time. Had there not been a 10$ minimum on cards we would of left. The majority of the time was spent chasing a bartender. Epic fail.
author: Jillian M.

description:
Tried to hold a party there, when we got there we did not feel welcome in the bar.

I took my guests to another neighborhood bar where we felt welcome.

The male bartender was indifferent and not welcoming to the bar!

We called to ask about the following week at Kesar Pub and told we could not hold the party which was booked about four weeks in advance.

very disappointing.
author: Dean C.

description:
I heard a lot of hype about this place when I moved into the neighborhood. Having been there twice, I don't get it.

Once, the music was fun. That was nice. But it's just a bar. Nothing more. Nothing less.
author: Jenny J.

description: They don't take credit cards? They don't take credit cards?! Not even when you buy food? All joking aside, this is a lively place to come during a weeknight to watch sports.
author: Andrew M.

description: Roaches right on the bar. Bartender called the boss. But there are fucking roaches on the bar! Not eating food here ever again.
author: O J.

description:
Based on my experience Sunday morning, I feel a more suitable name for this establishment should be Mad Douche Bag Behind the Bar.

Here's the story: 
We came to watch Sunday football with burritos in hand. We walked in, sat down, ordered beers, and started eating. NOTE: We hadn't been in here in the past 6 months, before they remodeled and started serving food. No one was eating at the bar and we didn't get menus so we had no idea they even had food there. Also, we'd brought food in here before without a problem. 

Several minutes later, an extremely agitated looking and sounding Irish guy asks us, "What is this guys? What is this?" We look at each other a bit confused. When we ask what's wrong, he points to us and says "What the hell do you think you're doing?" Ok, what?? Then he points specifically to my friend's burrito and says this is a restaurant, and goes on a tirade on how dare we bring food into a San Francisco restaurant. 

At this point, we're just a little taken aback, (still completely sober) and dumbfounded. We apologized and said we didn't realize. We suggested we could leave and come back, or order some food they had. We asked him what thought. His response? Shaking his head and storming away from the table. Um, what? Yes, it was our mistake. Yes, we shouldn't had assumed. Yes, we apologized a few times. Yes, we really did want to resolve this. 

But clearly the irate leprechaun clearly didn't want to resolve it, accept our apology, or consider it a misunderstanding. Instead, he came back to our table a second later with an angry disposition...but no clear solution. So when my friend said, "Look, we're sorry, but this was unintentional. Is there a way we can resolve this like adults?" Apparently, that made him completely lose it and he replied with, "I don't like your attitude and get the F out of my bar!" 

Wow. Not sure how many other times I'd been kicked out of a bar while stone sober and no yelling (on our side.) Our friend walked outside, and my other two friends and I calmly cleaned up and followed him out. Again, we weren't angry, just dumbfounded this little misunderstanding couldn't be resolved. 

Bottom line: we made a mistake on our part, a silly misunderstanding that could have been resolved, but it was clear the bartender, owner, whatever--instead was honestly looking for a fight. So he kicked us out in a dramatic fashion and got his way. 

Maybe he had a bad night. Maybe he had a bad morning. Or maybe he just wanted to exert his "power" on someone. Well, he did and I hope he's satisfied. I just hope he realizes there are far more sports bars in SF that we don't have to risk dealing with a moody asshole when trying to resolve an issue.
author: Kelly R.

description:
At the risk of making my identity known (there are several people who say they know I'm on Yelp but can't find me, for good reason), I was here last night for the Pub Quiz.

Anyone that has been around me knows that, while I can impress with useless knowledge of random facts (i.e., ants have alcohol in them so they don't freeze), a *plethora* of facts dating from the 70's to the present, from current events to music, you can't really count on me for. Luckily for me, my team- The Bush Doctrine is Not a Grooming Decision- comprised of stunningly intellectual individuals. 

While drinking beer with my teammates, I was informed about Mad Dog's reputation for having .75 cent sex toys in the ladies bathroom. Despite them being unreliable and more than likely to finish before I do, I reminded them that it sounds like most of the boyfriends I've had, so it's not like I would be any MORE disappointed than I have been in the past.

However, when the quiz was fully underway I found myself engrossed in trying to figure out the answers, screaming and shouting, smiling and cursing, and everything in between. 

Then came my moment. 

When I ride the elevator up to my floor, I read the television screen's "Top Headlines" or snippets from them. It's a nice way to be informed of our failing economy and a reason of why we should all panic. Yesterday I happened to glance at the screen that said, "Two Americans Released Today from Syria". Hm, whatever. 

This time, not whatever. Suddenly, they called out the trivia question: "What country released two journalists today?" My group stared at each other and shrugged their shoulders. SYRIA. SYRIA. WRITE SYRIA. I was going insane, and unable to contain my excitment. 

When the answers were finally read, I think we were the only ones in the bar to get that answer right. High fives, fist bumps, and more drinking led to the end of an amazing night with friends. Also, I was drunk, so of course it was amazing. 

Out of the +10 teams that played, we came in 3rd place. I'd like to thank Syria for that. 

4 stars because, despite pub quiz night and their beer leaving nothing else to be desired, the patio was pitch black, and one of my friends almost went head-first into the urinal from lack of your even flooring. Then again, the patio at night would make for a great first-date spot if you were set up on a blind date. 

I will be back, and this time, Syria had better release two more people, because that's my answer and I'm sticking to it.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Mad Dog in the Fog is my kinda place! I've been hearing a lot about them, and finally dropped in. Totally casual, divey bar. They have drink specials, a ton of beer choices and seems like they are up for events for current happenings (i.e. an Oscar Party tonight at Mad Dog. Srsly.) I was most excited for Harp on tap, and can't forget to mention the great Guiness pour including shamrock art. It's the little things.

Still looking forward to trivia night one of these Tuesdays or Thursdays, too!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Good place to watch games.  They take cards and serve food, but no liquor which is fine i guess....  The homemade potato chips and french fries are my favorite.
author: Julie B.

description:
Bars can be strange places.

The second-to-last time I was here, not too long before last call, I decided to do something stupid.  Well, not stupid, really, but stupidesque.  I waved at a random group of people who were entering the bar, and as they approached, their youngish-looking ringleader came up to our table and introduced himself.  At this point, I was completely convinced that he thought he knew me or something, because he ended up buying the birthday girl a beer and introducing his entire crew, which included someone's parents and the son of the guy who played Colonel Sandurz in Spaceballs--seriously, I'm not making this stuff up.

Some of my birthday-get-together colleagues were also beginning to believe I had orchestrated this social experiment, but I quickly had my self-confidence dashed when I learned that someone (we'll call him "Granger") had actually just called or texted this ringleader, so his group was technically coming to see someone in our group, though only tangentially.

I got business cards from a restaurant on Mission Street in Bernal Heights that I may or may not ever visit, and everyone seemed to enjoy themselves until the bartenders began executing last call rather abruptly and college-librarily.  (If you don't know what I mean, please don't ask.  Just think about it for a few minutes.)

Mad Dog in the Fog doesn't know what it wants to be.  Is it a sports bar?  Not really, although it thinks it is.  But I believe there's a bylaw somewhere that requires sports bars to serve liquor, and this place is a beer-and-wine place, so there's that.  And a wine bar?  Really?  With pool tables?  In the front?  Who's ever heard of pool tables in the front?

They have live music some weekdays, and the bartender was very nice when I came in a few days later looking for my lost umbrella.  (I ended up finding it in my flat.)

Ooh, and they were playing The League of Gentlemen DVDs on one of the screens during my friend's birthday.  A certain Lower Haight drummer and I were trying to figure out what it was, as the sound was off and every female character seemed to be played by a man.  I've got to rent that thing.
author: John S.

description: I used to really love Mad Dog In The Fog. I live in the Bay Area 10 years ago and this place used to be a cozy place to just come and chill. It was a bit grungy and dark, but that's what gave it the character I liked. It's now a bit sterile and refined, which takes away from the charm of the old Mad Dog I remember. My buddies and I came here for Sunday NFL games and to their credit they had them all on. But, we were a bit disappointed in the IPA selection. We were much more thrilled with the IPA's when we went across the street to Toronado Bar!
author: Ray G.

description: Went to watch the UEFA final  with my sister early this summer and loved the service , the Euro  working class ambient . The food was tasty, economical and delicious . The beer selection is unique in the Bay.  Definitely the place to watch the real kind of football.
author: Diego D.

description:
I love you, Mad Dog Trivia Night.  I just wish you had more tables.  And just once I'd like to win the $30 prize.  But a pitcher of beer to the winning small team isn't bad either.  Unless you have to work Friday morning and Thursday night at the end of trivia is not when you were hoping to get your drink on.  

The fries are tasty.  The beer selection is above par.  They have a lot of options on tap and several bottled delights.  Take a look at their beer menu and treat yourself to something really unique.  Play some pool, watch some sports, and make friends with the people sitting at the booth that you want in on.  Too bad the neighbors must've complained so now the patio is off limits after 9pm.  

A neighborhood gem, this is.  (If you consider dive/sports bar combos to be gems like I do.)  Also when the weather's nice, the windows out front make for excellent conversing with people on the street.
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
Mad Dog has a great draft selection, but not really anything special since the neighborhood is full of impressive draft lists. Plus, some of the beers seem a little on the pricey side compared to places even just a few steps down the street.

I guess if you are into watching a sports match, screaming at the tv, and bumping into a bunch of wasted sports fans, this might be your spot. I'll pass.

Even when there isn't a game going on, and the place seems laid back, I have still had a bad time there. On an empty Monday, I walked in and ordered a drink (after waiting several minutes) at the bar, then found an empty table. About 10 minutes into our beer, a waitress appeared and made us feel guilty for ordering at the bar and not from her. Sorry, maybe if you were around or someone had acknowledged us we would have been happy to order from you. She then asked if we wanted to look at a food menu. We said yes, and she rudely said, "well the kitchen closes in 2 minutes." We handed back the menus because we didn't even really want food anyway, but why even offer if you are just going to be rude and tell us you really won't serve us anyway? Lame.

They have a great back patio, but it's usually full anyway. Other than that, I'll pass on this place and enjoy many of the other options just steps away.
author: Meowy C.

description: Whenever I'm in the Haight I try and come here. Descent beer selection. Good service. Great place to watch your favorite sports team. Especially a Giants or 49er game. They also have a nice little patio in the back. And some of their bartenders aren't bad looking either ;)
author: Rachel C.

description:
I really like this bar. They've got stiff drinks, good beer selection, friendly staff, trivia, and a patio! What more can you want. Plus they are conveniently located in the lower haight making it a great place to meet up for a drink, or a place to pass the night.

I don't really do sports, but my soccer-loving pals tell me this is the place to be.
author: Nikki M.

description:
Mad Dog has a good selection of beers and I love the fact that there are so many TVs that I can just turn and be watching a different sport. Definitely a great spot for a game.

The menu isn't very extensive and I didn't get any happy hour deals. But their nachos are pretty good. I also do realize you have to be pretty incompetent to make bad nachos.

I'll definitely go back, especially to watch some good games.
author: Analisa S.

description: Huge beer selection and tons of TVs. I like the vibe of the bar. Tons of space. Nice bartenders.
author: Rochelle I.

description:
My friend and I go to the Mad Dog often as our meeting point. Great staff, great Irish bar, and great little garden with lots of sunshine.

They have also recently brought food back to the menu and it's pretty damn good. Proper fish n chips but also many other great options. Nice job mates!
author: Juliann B.

description:
What the hell happened to this place? Are they under new ownership? This is not the Mad Dog I once knew. 

Maybe it's more profitable to blast dance music and get rid of the board games, but the last chill neighborhood bar is now dead. They'd been making improvements to the place for a long time now, and some of them weren't bad (the new tables and seating areas are comfy!) but now it's so crowded, even during the week, that you won't be able to sit there anyway.

So, good for you Mad Dog. I'm glad the place is making you some money, but I'm sad that you lost your soul along the way.
author: Veronica B.

description:
This place is absolutely awesome. It has that quintessential laid back Irish bar feel and the service is great. Derrick is awesome!!!!!! I mean an Irish guy serving you in an Irish bar. Cant get more authentic than that. He is friendly  and fun.

Absolutely recommend this place if you want a nice place to just hang out with friend and grab a few beers! 

And yeah the music is AMAZINGGGGGGGG!!
author: Shruti L.

description:
Strengths:  Casual, neighborhood, cheap beers, decent eats.

Weaknesses:  Parking!!!

Opportunities:  Seems understaffed, wished service could be faster.

Threats:  Shotwells in the Mission feels just like this place.

Total:  $70 for 4 ppl with some bar food.
author: Jenny K.

description:
I've been wanting to write a review for Mad Dog in the Fog, but I keep thinking the name of this place has the word "pig" in it. Boy am I wrong with IDing animals! 

Anyway, I came here with my sister and her friends to watch the Germany Argentina World Cup semis. The place was basically standing room only with people facing various directions depending on which TV they were staring at. In exchange for the 10 dollars you pay at the door, you get 5-2 dollar vouchers for food and drink at the bar. They might as well have said it was a 10 dollar cover, because it was practically impossible to walk all the way to the bar for anything since the place was so packed. 

Even though parking sucks in the Lower Haight, I must admit that it was pretty fun to watch the game with so many people. Everyone gets all rowdy anytime there is a close play or a goal. Definitely a cool place to hangout for sporting events.
author: Diana C.

description:
Come here for the beer. They have beers on tap, and a WIDE selection of bottled beer that you probably haven't seen before. I am an avid Blue Moon drinker, but wanted to find something similar since I saw all the bottled beers stashed above the alcohol. The bartender suggested me to a beer which tasted amazing. I only wish I remembered what it was called. 

There is an ample number of booths for seating, and the bar even offers a pool table for patrons. Great undercover spot on Haight.
author: Chris E.

description:
Came here for trivia night last Thursday and had a great time!  I'm no trivia buff and was very pleased that we didn't come in last.  However, I also have little faith that the winners didn't cheat just a little bit!  The set up of the game makes it pretty easy to look something up on an iphone between rounds.  Ah well, I'll come back and try my hand another week.

~$5 beers and $5 fries, cash only.
author: Cathy Y.

description: Really sweet bartenders, good deals on any new beers they have in (a pint of new IPA for $4.50, for example) as well as a large selection of beers, and a laid-back cool ambiance. The way it's set up is long and skinny so I don't think it's good for groups unless you're sure you can get a table. My 5 friends and I struggled a bit at the bar to turn our barstools towards each other but left after two beers. Still a fun place for groups of two-four, I would think.. Also, it's very dark inside.
author: Sonya Z.

description: I met up with some friends in the Haight to watch the Giants win versus the Phillies.  By the time we got in the bar was standing room only and we positioned ourselves in the center of the place.  We were surrounded by TVs and a large projected screen on the wall above the back patio door.  It was hard not to see the game. The beer was cheap and I'm fairly certain it was Stella on special.  The garlic fries were alright and always piping hot.  Getting our food and drink was easy because everybody around us didn't mind relaying the baskets and pitchers to us.  The crowd that night definitely was laid back.  We got some high-fives and even some hugs from total strangers.  For some game watching group togethers with chill friends that aren't beer nerds, Mad Dog works.
author: Darren S.

description:
Tuesday night trivia is surprisingly packed. Not a whole lot of seating since there are just a few booths lining one wall and the bar along the other.

We found out last night that they recently started serving food and the wings smelled like heaven. None of us ordered food, but we vowed to try it next time. Cannot wait to test out those wings!
author: Karena Q.

description:
So sad! They banned dogs - even in the back patio area. They are going so upscale, it's no longer my nice British beer-sticky laid-back pub any more. 

I mean, I do like the place for what it is now, and I don't blame the owners for wanted to upgrade and attract more customers, I just miss my "local."
author: Mi M.

description: Slightly better than average beer selection. Lots of taps but not much social to note. Pool table. No liquor. Booth and bar seating. Gets boring crowds.
author: Brian L.

description:
Dudes, It is great as a Futbol.-Soccer Bar... 

When in Europe in a Major  City where Futbol is a religious activity, You WILL be woken up, or kept up 'til all hours,,, It's a big world..! I have experienced this in Spain many times. Learned to laugh at the absurdity of trying to sleep through it - and how wonderful was the Spirit of the People.. (fueled by alcohol of course, sound familiar?). .It is a small street - Haight, so, as a neighbor, not so good for peace and quiet.
author: Icysurfer K.

description: Great spot to watch a sporting event...especially when its nice weather since they have a TV and several tables out back.  Good selection of beer, cool staff.
author: Dilly M.

description:
London Pride on tap and 12 TVs. Need I say more. 

This quickly became my spot for football Sunday and it has been good thus far. Food is just okay and that is the only reason I gave it three stars. I've only had breakfast here and would be willing to give some lunch or dinner a shot. If that doesn't work out, plenty of great places to eat really close by.
author: Michael C.

description:
Quiet Sunday night, this place was extra big because there were hardly any people there. However, the Christmas tree did look festive. The potentials:The tables are big for those big parties-- granted you get there early enough; and I did notice a patio at the back, probably for those nicer days. 

We sat at the bar. No hard liquor, but they did have a variety of beers on tap. Since the theme of the night was "German", we chose Radberger. My colleague tells me that was an 'export-only' beer when East Germany was East Germany. Huh? I thought communism were for the working class? I..e. no special privileges. Not so. If you lived in that part of the world in those times, you couldn't taste this beer unless you were a capitalist importer. Today, this same people's beer is called Royals Pilsner. Enough of history. There are bitters on tap, and lots of other varieties to get inebriated with (e.g. Racer - 5 IPA). So choose your poison.
author: Reyz A.

description:
Mad Dog offers really tasty pub food -- especially the sandwiches.  They have this self-serve beer station that they set up in the front, too -- which makes for service "your way", because you are your own server.

But the young gentlemen who staff the place always seem to go out of their way to be polite, attentive, and thorough.  It is the staff that really makes this place welcoming.
author: Droo G.

description: A fun Irish bar if you are looking for a place to drink with friends and/or to watch a game. They have TVs everywhere and always have the most popular games on. They only serve beer and wine but it's a huge list of both. There is outdoor seating in the back and plenty of booths inside and bar space. It can get packed during games so come early and take up your seat. Their food isn't bad either and always fun when sharing with friends. The waitresses are nice and friendly, very good with recommendations and alternatives in the slight chance they don't have your beer/wine.
author: edward k.

description:
up: best place to watch "football" (proper football...) in SF  in my opinion.
lotsa screens good barca FC contingent. good service . ok beer selection (please some micro brews).  keep on rollin' Forca Barca!
author: Andres B.

description: I dig this place for 3 reasons: 1) proximity to my house - it's close, 2) good selection of beers & pretty good chicken wings, 3) trivia night gathers a good crowd tues/Thur. All that being said the bartenders are not always the friendliest....
author: Kelli G.

description: This is a great neighborhood pub. The guys and I go here about twice a month to play darts and participate in trivia night. Trivia night is Tue and Thurs nights. They have plenty of TV's to watch sports highlights. I particularly like this place because they play rugby and soccer (as opposed to just NBA, NFL, MLB). Their pub quiz is meant to be fun and it's free. It's a good place to bring a group of friends and just hang out. The drinks are moderately priced and the staff are friendly.
author: Carlos A.

description:
WHAT THE HELL HAPPENED!?!?!?!?!?! Mad Dog was once my absolute favorite pub to watch a good pitch. Grab a Snakebite, some salt and vinegars and sit back in the front room and a great day was had. 

NOW they have remodeled it and turned it into a *(^*&*&*( YUPPIE BAR!!!!!!!!! WTF!?!?!?!?! Hideous booths opposite the bar, and then standing room only after that. Gone are the blue collar people, the neighborhood kids and the expats, In are the disgusting and loathsome yuppies, marina types and B+T scum. No more pitches, no more easy comfort. They have a bunch of TV's, and I imagine the beer is the same, but I can go anywhere for that.

I am so vexed!!!! Shame on the owners for turning a public house into a pure money play. I will curse your name from shore to shore, country to country, until the end of time. From the Champions league to the Sell Out league.
author: Christopher N.

description: Not a bad place for a beer and some pretty good bar food. The bacon cheeseburger I had was tasty, not over cooked and had good sized slices of tomatoes, fresh lettuce and lots of red onion (I had to remove some of it as it was just a bit too much). Add in some crunchy garlic fries and a Guinness and it was a good experience.
author: Chris A.

description:
As the red stripe guy would say "HURRAY BEER!"

4.50 a pint? Why yes, thank you.
9pm Thursday nights? TRIVIAAAA

If those two things don't strike a chord in you, well...you are a soulless person who doesn't have an ounce of fun in your bones. Ok, too dramatic. Did I mention hella TVs and even a large projection screen so no matter where you are sitting you can see? Even if you're a 5"3' Filipino like me.

Oh and theres pizza munchies right across the street for when you need that fix... This pub has the elements to make it a deece chill out spot.
author: Samantha R.

description: We stopped in for a beverage while trekking through the city. Service was attentive. Good beer selection (or cider). Sports on the TVs. The smell of greasy food in the air. Fun patrons all around. Clean bathrooms. Awesome name too.  A solid drinking venue.
author: Julie H.

description: This place sucks.  I have never felt more unwelcome at a bar in my life.  I have been a bus boy, waiter, bar back, and bartender at quite a few places, corporate and local.  I have a good understanding of service and this place fails.  It failed so well that it made me join Yelp.  Their wings were ok and fries too.  But how hard is it to screw these up.  Although the grease needs changing
author: Hans S.

description: From Stamford Bridge to Wembley, we keep the BLUE flag flying high.
author: Geoffrey S.

description: Came here to watch a ranked basketball game that was airing on Fox Sports Channel.  Turns out they didn't have it.  They only get  more than one star because the fries I ordered were delicious.
author: Ryan S.

description:
The huge tables, patio on a nice day, and racer 5 on tap will keep me coming back. Also the fact that it's 3 blocks from home.

$1 off drafts during happy hour (4-7 i think?) doesn't hurt either.

Trivia is always great - Thursday are super tricky, so come on Tuesdays if you actually want to win. Or at least try to.

The addition of the second bar and expanded beer fridge has been clutch - so many more choices and much quicker service. I thought it was just a world cup thing, but I'm happy to see it stayed.

Menu is...apparently all the time now? I've never tried the food, but it doesn't look like it's anything that spectacular.

Sports abound - especially soccer and football.  

Last time I was there the lock on the girl's bathroom was funky funk. You have to twist it hella hard for it to even think about locking. This was learned after walking in on people on two separate occasions. My b :(
author: Monica C.

description: I have been to this place 3 times, 2 of which were fine, the 3rd is the reason I'm giving it only 3 stars. The first two times, the female drink runner was awesome- super nice. The third time I went she wasn't working and instead there was a middle aged guy working the bar. The place was pretty empty and I was one of maybe 3 people sitting at the bar. The bartender was so fascinated by what was going on with his cell phone that I had to ask him every single time I wanted another drink, food, or my bill. Not once he did he make any small talk or act happy to be there. Not one of my 5 "thank you's" were responded with a "you're welcome." Service like that is what makes me not want to return. I don't care if you check your phone or send some texts while bar tending, but if thats all you care about then I will take my service elsewhere.
author: Ned H.

description: Wonderful, friendly, soccer-loving staff who always have the Serie A on for us! Thank you so much for being accommodating and welcoming. Grazie mille!
author: Emily H.

description: Go on trivia night. Call ahead and reserve the "Tabletender." You'll get two taps at the table and it's actually a deal for the quality of the beer.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Oh Mad Dog, What has happened to you?

Mad Dog use to be THE soccer bar in San Francisco.  I've been going there on and off for 12 years to watch the biggest and most important matches.  It was a place where soccer was king in a country where soccer was insignificant.

How times have changed.

A couple of months ago I got several friends together to watch the USA vs. Trinadad & Tobago World Cup Qualifier match.  It was on at 4 pm on a Wednesday afternoon.  There were 10 people in the bar, 8 who were there to watch the game.

 When the game started, I asked the bartender if he could turn on the commentary for the game and turn off the music.  He refused, saying there were not enough people in the bar to do it.  Another one of my friends also asked and he once again refused.

At this point we all decided to leave and walk down the street to Danny Coyles, which not only had the game on, but had the commentary and a friendly atmosphere.

I heard from several other friends they had the same thing happen when watching the USA vs. El Salvador game.

Then last night I thought about giving the place another chance. I had to meet a friend that lived next door and I went to watch the MLS Cup final there.  I was on my cell phone talking with my friend from New York about the game and asked the bartender for a beer.  She ignored me several times and then finally she told me she would not serve me because I had been on my cell phone at the bar.   

I asked her if she was serious.  She said she thought it was rude and would not serve me.  So once again I said goodbye, left, and was warmly welcomed and offered a beer no problem at Danny Coyles.

Well at least i will never have to say goodbye to the holier-than-thou bartenders at Mad Dog cause I'm never setting foot in that "footie" bar again.  

And hello Danny Coyles
author: Douglas Z.

description:
Mad Dog in the Fog is great for two reasons. Trivia night and big sporting events. 

I do love trivia (and so do my friends). It's pretty organized and casual here and they don't rush you so you can just spend time between rounds just hanging out with your friends. You have to get there pretty early if you want to snag a booth but they do cover the pool tables and add some of the outdoor chairs. I've only been on Thursday night, but I've heard that Tuesday is a little easier. 

SO MANY TVS. If you want to go to a fun sports bar, packed with people but still have a good shot of actually watching the game, this is the place to be. We went for the final game of the World Cup and it was INSANE. At capacity, but we stood at the bar and from where I was at 5'4" I could see at least three tv screens clearly and the large projector. I would definitely go back to see games. 

Beer selection = great. Cash only = not so great.
author: Abbey S.

description:
This place looks like a dark pub, inside is a dark pub that has been hella renovated and now looks like some chic restaurant...with no food but some pool tables. The beers that are on draft are pretty good picks and are decently priced. It's just a weird set up in how fancy it is inside...

The crowd here on a Friday is a little douche-y and filled with t-shirts and blazers and Palo Alto start ups...so if you can fight that off- go for it.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I don't know about the renovation, but the Guinness wasn't fresh, the bar tenders are hit-or-miss, the music was too loud to speak over being played out of tinny speakers.  Just not the best place... particularly because it doesn't serve liquor and only takes cash.   

The pools tables looked nice, but I didn't get a chance to try them out.
author: jay w.

description: I've been here several times for their Tuesday and Thursday trivia nights. There aren't great deals on beer, but if you have a group, their pitchers aren't too bad. Overall, not amazing, but the trivia and it's great location makes it a perfect spot to meet up with friends.
author: Emily S.

description:
What happened to the Mad Dog?!

I'd been stopping in here for years for the occasional pint or to watch a bit of English football. Not fancy, but a good, reliable stop in the Lower Haight where you could be guaranteed a few decent pints in a good, convivial atmosphere.

Imagine my surprise then, when the last time I stopped in, the place had utterly changed...! (Admittedly, it's been a couple of years since my last visit.) Now, instead of the comfortably grotty surroundings & the Guinness posters and Aston Villa memorabilia, there are booths and lurid track-lighting reminiscent of a diner (or a strip club). The vibe in the place was dead, and when I went to the bar, I was met with a sullen American bartender (no more jaunty English barmen, it seems)  who was mightily inconvenienced to have to serve me a drink (even though the place was half-empty.) Not sure what has happened during my absence, but it most certainly has not been for the better.
author: donal c.

description: Great place to grab a beer during happy hour on Haight.  They've got Belgian (besides just the usual Chimay on tap) in bottles, they've got Firestone on tap, they've got Boont Amber on tap, they've got the usual assortment of high quality beers of different varieties on tap and in bottles too.  I didn't quite catch what the duck head on tap was in the back, but I'm going to ask the bartender next time I'm there.  Solid choice for drinks before heading somewhere else or in the middle or end of your bar crawl/dinner journey.
author: Joe B.

description:
I have a new date on Thursday nights and it's here for TRIVIA NIGHT.

A friend and I stopped in here randomly for the first time and boy am I glad we did. Everyone gets pretty into the trivia which happens around 9 and the place is packed! Great beer selection with friendly bartenders. There were 7 rounds of trivia: 5 Q&A types, 1 music list, and 1 sheet of celeb faces. My friend and I actually ended up winning the prize for small teams (under 4 people) which was a free pitcher of any beer.

This is definitely a spot to try out, and probably become a regular. Highly recommend to people looking to have fun, laugh a lot, and drink beer. What else do you need?
author: Jaime Y.

description:
Every time I think I'm out, the pub quiz sucks me back in.

The special pitchers are for a price you'd expect in San Francisco, but not in such a fun sports bar.  So I'll take away one star.

Plus they always have my Bruins on the big screen.

8 clap anyone?
author: Mike V.

description:
Derrick - the Mon/Tues (*maybe more) bartender is awesome.

I (foolishly) lost my wallet @ the bar. Derrick not only found the wallet, he got it back to me at my house -- with all credit cards, $$, a 50/parking card, and health cards.   AWESOME!

Such generosity is uncommon and praise worthy.  

I will be back... with friends..

MW
author: mario w.

description: I am not ratting this as a bar.  The bar is O.K. I am ratting this as a neighbor.  They totally do not care about the noise level they create. Worst neighbors EVER! Simple, shut the back doors and/ or turn off those speakers.  You suck as neighbors.
author: Christie L.

description:
This is a really cool place to come for trivia night.  I'm terrible at trivia and never know any of the answers, but still manage to have a good time.

I came here to watch the World Cup final and it was absolutely insane.  They have tons of TVs and was a great place to watch a game.  I can't wait to watch a Sharks game there.

GO SHARKS!
author: Aaron L.

description: VERY hipster-ish but I'll let that go because of the array of beers they have. The bartenders are mostly friendly and happy to recommend a beer for you. They get extra points for having Brother Thelonius in the big bottle.
author: Michael S.

description:
I like this place much better since the remodel.  It's not as divey.  They serve food now too, which might be a downer for those who liked bringing in their own food before.  If the kitchen is open you can't do that now.

One bonus is they serve the exact same wings as Kezar Pub (same owner) which has the best wings in the city.   Kezar also has one of the worst bar burgers in the city so I'm incredibly hesitant to try a burger here.

The bacon breakfast burrito does sound mighty tasty but I haven't tried it yet.
author: Scott W.

description: Great place to get a few pitchers with friends, play trivia or pool, or enjoy watching a game on big-screens.
author: Diana H.

description: Watched the Barca - Real Madrid game here. So much fun. Great energy, lots of screens.  If you want a soccer match or you need to do some early morning drinking, this is the place.
author: Junie C.

description:
I like this place. Good atmosphere and crowd. I go here with co-workers for Pub Quiz once a month. They started serving food which was good but if you don't like your typical pub food you can always go across the street to get a wiener or other food places in the area. 

But if you want a cool place to hang out with tons of tvs to watch sports, election results, and even Glee haha this is the place to go.
author: Angie P.

description: Super fun on Thursdays, the rest of the time....?  Not sure.
author: Ty W.

description:
I've only come here twice before, but now its forever indexed in my head as "that chill place to drink beer on tap and lounge around or play pool". The atmosphere is very relaxed and usually its populated with circles of friends just chatting over beer. There's a comfortable outdoors area in the back where you can smoke and lounge around, though I'm not sure what the criteria is for opening it up. 

Even though a good number of people will pass through here on a weekend evening, the bar is pretty big with lots of seating, so it never feels crowded or dense. I've even been able to play pool here for hours without signing up in a queue or battling for the table, which I've never been able to find anywhere except a complete pool hall.

The beer on draft selection is also quite formidable so I'm sure it'll appease any beer fiend. I don't care for any kind of sports at all (soccer, basketball, baseball or whatever), but the sports scene here is apparently pretty lively too, particularly for soccer, but don't take my word for it.
author: Tian X.

description: I was only in here briefly and for just one drink, but was impressed beyond belief.  I have passed by Mad Dog numerous times and never imagined that the inside would be so spacious and clean.  The beers on tap were more than I could count on my two hands (that's a good bar!).  Bars, for me, are all about that vibe that's hard to quantify.  Mad Dog has those intangibles in droves.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
There's more Fritos, Doritos, oversized TV and football than whiskey at Mad Dog in the Fog. I guess this tells you who the clientelle is. Bud Light drinking sports fans report back. No worries if you spill your shitty beer because the table cloths are made of Pat Benetar's old leather pants.

I do like the backyard area a lot, but still....no whiskey!?!
author: Stumbalina b.

description: when I'm in San Francisco this place is on my to do list. It's a great bar to watch soccer and have a few pints. they have a huge selection of craft beer and IPAs from all over. So if you are in San Francisco for a trip for you live there you must try this place out.
author: Paul H.

description: Its OK. I didn't get a wow moment when I was there. They've got a cool name and decent beer on tap
author: Marc E.

description: One of the best places to go when I want to watch sports. And I don't even really like sports.
author: Trixie N.

description: Overpriced beer. Friendly service. Dead for a thursday night around 12. Only thing impressive was Hoegarden on tap.
author: Shakei D.

description:
I go here to get out of the house.

Not because I am a shut in.  

But because I need to escape those god damned housewives of NYC.

I am addicted.

Oh Kelly, get on with it, you are past your prime.  

And don't even get me started on Ramona.

Good beers, cash only.

Reality.
author: Archie R.

description:
Okay...as my bf and I entered the door. We sat and waited for a waiter/menu for about 10 mins. Finally, my bf goes to ask the bartender and he said, "u have to come to the bar!" I'm just going to lay it out...he's a douche. It won't kill him to at least acknowledge our presence and let us know that instead of us sitting for 10 dry minutes. 
Anyway...moving along. We order fried fish and chips and bbq ribs. Despite the unpleasant opening to this experience, the food was BANGING. I can say the fish and chips was as good as those in Australia. Very meaty and flavorful. Price was also very reasonable about $15 for my entree. A wild selection of beer helps wash the food down nicely afterwards. As a sports bar, it's also nice that they have several big tvs and 2 pool tables there.
author: Huiling Z.

description:
I have been in this place three times. 
1. Watching a random MNF game here- decent crowd, good beer, and good service.
2. Popped in here in the middle of the week- like at 1230 before I was about to get my marriage license at City Hall for a pair of quick pints. 
3. Most memorable trip- a decade ago, driving from the Marina one night at like1230-100AM after a good night of drinking, I really needed to use the bathroom. Like I am talking borderline zebra legs, diarreha emergency. I got my bearings of where I was- mainly  being between the marina and my place in the innner Sunset and realized I was near the old Mad Dog.  I parked in a Muni bus stop and high tailed it straight to the stall in the Mad Dog mens' room. Next thing you know, I dozed off in the stall for an hour or two, and it was 2:30AM. The place was obviously closed down, and the bartender, startled that I was still there as I came out of the mens' room, told me I was about 10 minutes away from being locked in the place for the night. He was cool about it, I walked out, and amazingly my car was still in the muni bus stop, without a ticket and I made it home without incident... Can't wait to see what happens on my 4th visit.
author: Jim B.

description: Love this bar, a nice sunny back garden area, friendly staff, good booze, fun decor and you can bring ur dog in with you. Great place to chill out.
author: Ej S.

description:
I'm giving this 3 stars (with a slight shed of salty tear) only because of it's recent remodeling job.

Love trivia night, love the beer selection, love the soccer games...but they've tried to go and make a dark, moody, slightly cramped but loveable English-style pub all swanky and la-di-da!

The last time I went there for trivia, the place had undergone a MAJOR overall complete with circular booths, mirrors and wood paneled walls and bye-bye to most of the super cool World Cup posters on the wall.

3.5 because I have mad love for MDITF but I liked the decor before.
author: Faith S.

description:
Good place to watch European soccer as a lot of true football fans (especially Europeans) show up to watch matches. I was there last Wednesday for the Europa League final, which starting before lunch. Bartender is very friendly with her British accent and the clientele are engaging and a joy to be around. Solid beer selection and ample space & TVs to watch.

One disappointment is that they weren't serving food while i was there (which was around lunch). Not sure if they do at all :-(
author: Daniel A.

description: Probably the best spot to watch European Futbol, they have lots of TVS and open early for big games, beer and wine license only, but spacious and fun for good games!
author: Trent S.

description:
Friendly staff. 
Trivia!
I miss it since moving to the burbs... but I'll be back!
author: Helen K.

description:
Ahh, Superbowl Sunday. Rugged men in tight white pants chasing around a tiny ball, and most importantly, the greatest excuse of the year to go crazy and down nachos, chicken wings, mini corn dogs and beer like there's no tomorrow.

Somehow I always end up at Mad Dog for the Superbowl, probably because it's the only sports bar I really know of that I can go to without feeling like I'm at a frat party. Plus, there are always a few token Irish at the bar, already wasted at 3 p.m. slurring drinking songs and adding to the overall credibility of the place.

I love how you can bring in your food to Mad Dog... pick up a sausage over at Rosamunde or some beef brisket and beans from Memphis Minnie's and sit yourself down for an afternoon of draft brews and sports shenanigans. There must be 10 flat screen TVs in the place, and their booths are super comfy for squeezing into with friends.

You can even shoot some stick should you feel such an inkling, though I warn you, their pool tables are seriously slanted. Either that or I really, really suck. Let's go with my first theory, shall we?
author: Nicole G.

description:
Wasn't it such a nice day today?  That is, before the dense fog rolled in and smoothered everything in it's deep, billowy seduction.  And luckily, right before the fog rolled in, the BF and his family and I managed to walk over to this "secret" spot highlighted in an incredibly out-dated tour book of SF.  

It has a lot of plasma TVs.  It has a beer garden.  

We sat outside under a huge umbrella and looked at all the vintage beer adverts on the walls.  The bartender was nice and talkative, the bathroom was clean, a couple regulars were sat at the bar knocking back a few.

And I've got to say, this place pours a mean diet coke.  Whew!  Almost didn't make it home after that tall frosty glass.  Beer and wine only, and recently I think wine makes me angry.  Like my bug bites.
author: Christina C.

description:
Tuesday and Thursday night trivia!!  It gets packed so grab some food nearby (Memphis  Minnie's or Rosamunde's) and plant your ass in one of their comfy booths. Pool tables double as tables on trivia nights. Apparently Tuesday night trivia is easier than Thursday. In my opinion they're just pretty much easier than any trivia hosted by Brainstormer.

Great staff. Love their accents. Lots of beer and recently some Guinness girls have been handing out free samples of Guinness. Remember, cash only!
author: Tina Y.

description: Nice neighborhood bar. Really enjoyed the corndogs.
author: Stacy W.

description:
What the FUCK happened to this place?

It now looks like Danny Coyle's, Nickie's, or any other faux-chic Eurotrash bar in the neighborhood.

The greatest thing that this place had going for it was the fact that it was the preeminent soccer bars in SF, if not along the entire West Coast.  Kudos for knocking down that wall in front, but those diner-style booths take up too much space and are only going to make this a horrible place to watch a game.  The people sitting won't be able to see above the people standing, and the booths don't have any sightlines to the tv's that are mounted directly over them.

Attention rival SF British/Irish bars and restauranteurs: The 2010 World Cup is just over a year away, and there's a new opening to be THE place to watch it in SF.  Mad Dog has clearly thrown in the towel.
author: Doctor L.

description:
I came here on a Saturday, thought I'd play some pool. The people playing were awfully rude. They held up the play and started arguing amongst themselves. I was told to get the fuck out when I asked them to get a move on. wtf. The people in the bar in general seemed unfriendly and not willing to talk to you. 

I usually go to the Page (on Page and Divis) which is frequented by super friendly people and enjoy playing pool there even though their table is not that good. Everyone is courteous and you can make a lot of friends there. Do yourself a favour and skip the Mad Dog.

Oh, I was there earlier in the evening just hanging out and they had club music in a sports bar.
author: Awesome P.

description:
I dunno, I want to give this place 4 stars, but it just doesn't do it for me. Unlike some people, I don't believe that a bar sucks if it doesn't serve hard liquor.

However, it has to make up for it with something else. Toronado does so by serving one of the best beer selections in the city. Noc Noc does so by also serving wine and sake, as well as having a one-of-a-kind interior.

I still go here frequently for trivia, which is fun; but a great bar should be good every night, and even better on certain nights, which isn't really the case here; I can't really see myself going here on a non-trivia night. If I were a soccer fan, that might change, but I'm not. Danny Coyle's is a much better place to watch a game.
author: Mark A.

description:
I liked the cool atmosphere of the place decor-wise, but the people who were in the bar did not match the soccer feel that this bar puts out there.  It even has hot lines, etc. for different soccer info, but inside the people were all just drunk and rude.  They apparently throw their bottles as loud as they can into the recycle bin so wear ear-plugs when you go there.

What I liked the best was the out-back part of the bar.  You can sit down in the cool air and get away from all the congestion inside.  It also seems the cooler people sit out there - the not-so-hammered people who will have great conversations with you if you sit down at their table.
author: Xhris C.

description: Favorite sports bar in Lower Haight...but if you want to catch a game, don't sit in the patio...the tv sucks. Please fix.
author: Daniel H.

description: Attempted and afternoon of daytime drinking in SF a couple of weeks ago. Started at Broken Record around noon and found that it was closed so we had to throw together an impromptu plan B. I had read there was some sort of a barley wine festival or whatever at Toronado so we headed that way.. when we got there it was packed. Sardine style. I'm to old for all that shit, so we headed across the street to this place. It wasn't bad. I guess they serve food. (we didn't have any) Beezy said she liked her virgin bloody mary. Me and my buddy split a pitcher of some beer I've never heard of. It was kind of like Sierra Nevada...It's not a very big place and I can very easily see it getting packed as it was near full when we arrived at like 1 in the afternoon on a Saturday. Bottom line, it's just ok. If you're in the neighborhood, fine. I wouldn't go out of my way or anything..
author: Morris D.

description:
I have visited the Mad Dog twice. After my first visit, I really wanted to give this place 5 stars. However, since I waited until after my second visit, I am afraid that rating gets lowered to 3 stars. I discovered the Mad Dog in the Fog at the http://www.packerseverywhere.com/ site. So, I thought going there for watching the Packers play would be fun. When I went for the season opener on September 4th, I had a great time. Service was, for the most part, wonderful, except being given the wrong credit card when paying up. This, thankfully, was quickly remedied, as I did want my card back, and didn't want to charge a stranger's card for my food and drinks. Anyway, so I was willing to come back, and I did. However, Mad Dog on game day Sundays is a madhouse! It's standing room only, and eventually, Jules, the bartender began ignoring me or was too busy to check on me, or something, because I waited a good *TWENTY* minutes for service that never came. Now, I have to say she did start out serving me, but it wasn't until I made a trip to the restroom that I was ignored. I have to wonder how attentive she was anyway as somebody's cash, not sure if it was a tip, or cash for a drink, was laying on the bar the entire time I was there. After having awesome onion rings on the 4th, the cheese fries I had on the 14th were somewhat disappointing, to be perfectly honest.

Add to it I couldn't even hear the Packers game...being totally blind, I can't watch from a distance. So, after that *AND* being ignored, I left and went across the street. That, however is another review. Needless to say, I will never go back to Mad Dog alone. I think you need to make eye contact to get Jules' attention...something I'm not capable of. Go here if you like loud crowds, inattentive service and bland cheese fries on a game day.
author: Alan W.

description:
So this review will be on Mad Dog Pre Beautification. 

I love you Mad Dog,  you could probably replace my BF one day, yes my love runs that deep.

We normally rendezvous on Thursday night for what others call trivia and I just like to think of it as our alone time. U bring me a large pitch of Fat Tire b/c U know that loosens me up a bit. Then a strange man walks in and begins interrogating me in a foreign accent. He asks me questions like, what country is north of the red sea and which Spice Girl was featured on Mazim. Now, he knows I don't know but he dangles prizes in front of me like free a free pitcher of beer or a used currency bill. I can't resist so of course I indulge him by writing down an answer that is more than likely wrong. 

I never win Mad Dog, ever. Its like you hate me and you no longer want us to be together. Do you know what I have to go through for us to be together? I stalk out tables and give ppl my Mad Black Woman look in order to get them to leave so I can be closer to you. I bring in Rosemunds Because I don't want to have to leave you when I get hungry. 

Thats dedication....

You can thank me by simply letting me win....

P.S. never change baby u r perfect just the way u are.
author: Brittany D.

description:
My new favorite bar EVAR!

Why?

Because you can play Scrabble there.

And you can seem really smart when playing Scrabble there.

And you can impress your friends and lovers playing Scrabble there.

And you can win at Scrabble there.

And... wait... is Jism even in the dictionary?!?
author: Rachel G.

description:
"I moved to SF in 1990 and found the Lower Haight a great place to hang out and read the classified looking for apartments and bands. At the time, a full flat was $550/mo on Haight between Fillmore and Steiner. These days its about 6x that price as we all know. 

Well, at the time the mad dog was my fav place to grab a pint for $2 and read the rags. I went back last night (Saturday) and ordered a half pint (although I really think it was a 12 oz) and the price? $2. I think pints were $3. Just didn't want that much. Nice to see somethings dont change. 

2 pool tables, great bartender (Jules), and nice Pub atmosphere. Lots of booths and bar seating. Nice smokers lounge in the back if you partake, and nice beer, etc selection. Cash Only I believe. 

Still a super cool spot to chill 18 years later."
author: Adam X.

description:
There is a largely unmet need for good afternoon drinking spots. Somewhere you can enjoy a breeze and some natural light in the noon-5pm hours without being stuck in a dank hole of a bar, or crammed into Zeitgeist's yard with two hundred people. 

Mad Dog is overlooked in this regard, I think. Most people don't think of them as a back-patio kind of bar, but rather a sports-watching bar or a pool playing bar, or a pub trivia kind of place. This may have something to do with its rather dark interior (despite ceilings of a stunningly beautiful height) or the sportsy crowd or something. Because every time I've been in the patio on a nice Sunday afternoon, it's not been too crowded (surprisingly, in light of its small size.) The patio is mostly shielded from the elements by back-of-the-lot lofts, and the proximity to Cafe International feels friendly and warm. That, combined with tasty beers and board games that actually have all the pieces, is the recipe for a kickin' Sunday.
author: Megan W.

description:
All I can say is: Thank GOD I got there at 6:30  for Trivia Night. Because by 9 P.M., when they started the Trivia portion (which I was told started at 7 p.m.), I was tanked. Wasted. Useless. Falling asleep in my ever-so-butt-mangling heavy wooden stool that could be used as a torture device on anyone lacking sufficient meat on their ass bones. 

This place is far from bad. In fact, Matt Capital r and I were observing just how yuppy-friendly it's become. Cheers to that and to the fresh coat of paint and the cozy patio and the framed prints on the walls. But no thank you to the stools that have made sitting on anything but an inflatable donut a non-option for me today.
