It's also a sports bar, with around 6 screens that are suspended high enough that non-sports fans can totally ignore them and forget about the sports component altogether.

Their happy hour specials included a $3.50 Stella, $3 pear cider, and some $1-off coupons for budweiser beverages, which Classy Chewie took full advantage of but the rest of us only turned our noses up at. The bar staff here are pleasant and attractive and the patrons are decidedly un-lower-Haight, in my opinion. Cleaner than the Toronado crowd and less rowdy than some other venues in the area, this is a bar I'd come back to if I happen to be in the neighborhood and I find myself in need of alcoholization. 

With TONS of takeout joints in the surrounding block, you will never go hungry at Mad Dog. And if you're a smoker, they'll let you light up in the back. Thanks, fellow Touched By An Uncle teammates. We went. We saw. We didn't win. But we did get touched. By an Uncle.
author: Autumn K.

description:
The first time I came to Mad Dog an Irish gentleman, slowly falling off his barstool, tried to sell his only son to me for a Stella and a smoke. Although I declined the offer of taking his ruddy-faced, pissed-off son home to Sassy's House of Love, the actual bar made an impression on me. 

It was spacious, homey and beer-filled. Just like Sassy's House of Love!!! Except that my studio is about the size of a coffin, I've lived there for four months and haven't attempted to decorate it, and I'm fresh out of beer.

The second time I came to Mad Dog, I brought my hippie Yosemite transplant for a few drinks and a game of Connect Four. Half the pieces were missing, so we pulled out the Girl Scout skills (I actually never made it to Girl Scouts. Bona fide Brownie for two whole years bitches!!!) and doctored up some game pieces out of bits of torn up coasters. The place was a little dead and space-out inducing, but I still enjoyed the cozy atmosphere and laid back patrons.

Third time I came to Mad Dog I had two things on the mind: Sleeping pills and trivia. Because I arrived at 7 p.m. with my game face on, and the festivities didn't begin until 9 p.m., I ended up cutting out early to partake in the former. I would have liked to stare blankly at the trivia host while my team mates shrieked wrong answers all around me, but my bed was beckoning me....loudly....I could it hear it calling my name.....and then I woke up; nose blowing bubbling in my Stella like a freaking snorkel, and I knew it was time to take the fuck off.

Good place, four blocks from my coffin, reasonable drink prices, a charming jasmine-smelling patio, and friendly, hot-accented bartenders.
author: Sammy S.

description: Quiz nights and pints, oh yeah! I'm becoming a regular against my will, why does this happen to me? Cheap suds, we're talking cold PBRs, folks. The crowd is friendly, too.
author: Chris M.

description:
I have a confession to make...

I kinda hate people sometimes. 

Not all of them or even a specific few, but sometimes I just don't want people getting in the way of my good time or my drinking and when you are in that kinda mood, Mad Dog In The Fog is awesome. 

We were here on a Friday night at prime drinkin time and we pretty much had the place to ourselves. By we I mean a good 12 people and we were able to throw back beers, play trivia (well I watched), shoot pool and just enjoy the company of friends...who trick you into sticking your nose into the bright red pool stick chalk (thanks Michael E, revenge is pending).

They only serve beer and wine and that is just fine with me. Plus they let you bring over sausages from Rosamunde and don't give you any static about it. And that's pretty cool :)
author: Stephy S.

description:
Heres a little story about this place from years ago......

One sunny afternoon I totaled some guys car, and my own, by rear ending him. The entire time the cops were on the scene I kept referring to this person as a she (dude looked like a lady).....adding insult to injury. Not only did I total their car, but I misidentified their gender to their face. Lets just say this person was not my biggest fan!

So, that night I am out drowning my sorrows and leave my wallet in a cab on the way home, which some nice guy finds. He is looking for someway to contact me and what number does he find? The person I  rear ended that same day. Now this person thinks I am a bad driver, a moron and an alcoholic. Thankfully they gave wallet finder dude my number so he could contact me and give me my wallet back. I tell wallet guy my tale and we have a good laugh over why rear ended dude was so rude to him on the phone when he heard my name.

Wallet dude and I chose the Mad Dog in the Fog as the drop off point.....it was a middle point to each of our homes and this way I could buy him a drink or two for his honesty and trouble. Plus MDITF has pool tables, an outdoor patio, good beer selection and a mellow vibe for hanging out with a complete stranger who is making your week a little less hellish.

I arrive, he looks stressed out....and proceeds to tell me that on the way to MDITF HE rear ended someone and totaled HIS car. I swear MDITF had something to do with it, I swear it was all their fault that I managed to look like a complete douche bag to two people in two days. Maybe we should have met somewhere else, maybe there wouldn't have been 4 totaled cars! 

Or maybe it had nothing to do with this place and I am just bad luck.
author: Drue C.

description: mahi tacos and garlic fries were decidedly mehhh. also nuts that on gameday they only have one guy working the tables, he was doing a valiant job but really he had a lot to cover.
author: Misha T.

description:
I came here a few times many years ago. I just made it back last night. Things have changed.

It's much cleaner and more put together now, like when you run into that grungy stoner kid that you knew in college and he's cleaned himself up and landed a decent job. A.K. and I started to complain about how this place has become gentrified when we realized we were the sort of people doing doing the gentrifying, at least at places like this; The 25 to 35 set that don't mind a little dirt and noise but are done with their filthy gutterpunk days. Sorry everyone.

Anyway, 15 or so beers on tap, soccer and some other sports on big screens, and trivia night starts hours later than advertised but show up on time anyway so you can get more drinking in.
author: matthew r.

description: Trivia night is where it's at!  Great atmosphere, fantastic selection of hipster IPAs available.  Four billion TVs that always seem to be playing soccer, even though I was there during the NHL Playoffs.
author: Aaron C.

description:
I echo everthing Autumn K said in her review of this place.  However, I thought the chairs were fine.  I'm probably a glutton for punishment though.  I do have one criticism.  If you advertise that trivia starts at 9pm on a weeknight, then trivia needs to start at 9pm on a weeknight.  There were several grumblings in relation to the tardiness of the event.  

I was surprised at how easy it was to find street parking so close to the pub.  That made me happy (+) the fact that no one sideswiped my car in the city this time.  Yeah.  For those of you searching for something lighter to imbibe with, select the pear cider.  Its deliciously cold and refreshing.
author: Richard R.

description:
The bartender was nice. One star.

The drunk guy who was just fired was nice. One star.

The group of guys who asked me for trivia help were nice. One star.

My date's friend was nice. One star.

I felt like I was on one big date with Mad Dog in the Fog.  MDitF gave me beer, laughs and a warm feeling inside.   If MDitF was a male incarnate he'd be big, strong and dark.  He'd give me drinks and we'd have a blast watching sports and playing trivia.  He'd probably buy me a hot dog from Rosamunde, too.  Best imaginary date EVER!!!

My date himself was not nice, a flake and pretty much lame.  

Date   =  : (

MDitF =   : )

I'd totally give it up to MDitF man incarnate.  

I definitely DIDN'T give it up to my date.  I left that ass there and went salsa dancing.
author: Jay H.

description:
I walked into Mad Dog last week because i had time to kill before an interview. It was 3:30 and i was like, a quick one wont hurt, it could only help, you know, make me more chatty.... to my disappointment (in that moment), I come to find that the bar is beer and wine only   :-( 
(oh no i thought!!)
I asked, is there anywhere around here i can get some vodka before 4? The friendly bartender and nice customers (most likely regulars, come on,  its 3:30 on a Wednesday afternoon) all thought long and hard for a good 30 seconds, and where like "nope!"  
So I sat,  I thought, and decided to do something i never do... I ordered a beer, well almost, a cider. It was delicious.  My experience was good, I liked the place. I'll go again. Years ago I would go to watch games at 7-am and for $5 you'd get English breakfast and a beer, i wonder if they still do that??
author: Rachel L.

description: Mad Dog is THE place in the lower haight for game watching (go giants!), trivia night, or casual pints any day of the week. tuesday night trivia is not so ridiculously challenging that you won't know any of the answers (i hate that!) and generally has a pretty decent crowd gathered by 8:30 (trivia starts at 9) also bonus points for the fact that. the scene is unpretentious.
author: Kelly N.

description:
One of my favorite (Sports) Bars in the city. 

Lots of TV's, awesome people, staff, AND a pretty decent beer selection. 

Oh, and the wings are awesome.
author: Christian K.

description:
I am biased, because of the spiritual tradition I practice here once a month (read on):

I never really went here much but always respected it as an ale and stout-serving Britbeerfootball joint. Now that we have a monthly dj gig here though (am I allowed to say that?) I've had a chance to penetrate this place a bit further. Terry at the bar is cheerful, good selection of tap handles, vintage, utilitarian and red interior with epic ceilings and I have an epic time drinking Guinness and Big Daddy and spinning vintage Jamaican vinyl.

Yelper Makaha F. is to be thanked for his kind loan of a JBL speaker, which means that we now have our sound together and rock monthly (the first Saturday), Jamaican and UK "old hits" style. Quaff a Guinness, an IPA or a lager as you listen to people like Dawn Penn, the Maytals and the Dice the Boss.

What was this place in 1910? I would give someone's pinky to know.
author: Mark G.

description: Thursday - trivia  night. I wish they had better beer specials, but nonetheless it's a great spot in the Lower Haight.
author: M R.

description:
I don't see the appeal of this place... the location is great and there are tons of other bars in the area, so why were there hardly any other customers here on a Saturday night?!  No booze.  Just beer and wine.   I wouldn't complain if they made up for this lack of liquor with something else, like the unique beer choices at Toronado, but here they have nothing special to boast about.  If a bar doesn't have a liquor license, they need to step up their game and find some other reason for people to come in.

Although Mad Dog in the Fog is an AWESOME name for a bar, and I had high hopes, and it would have been an alright hang-out place... there was no one else around.  Hence: no cute girls for our single guy friend to flirt with.  That's a travesty.  We ended up searching for a new bar where we could have more fun.  So unless I'm really craving a Heineken in the middle of the day while walking down Haight (which is highly unlikely) I will probably not be stopping here again.
author: Laura W.

description:
I had Good Times!
I have a lot of friends who won't shut up about how much they love this place and how they watch all these soccer games there at all hours of the day. I finally went a couple days ago and it was cool.
I don't really care for soccer but when I came here it seemed good enough! This pub with a smoking area in back, they have trivia nights and a few pool tables.
I kept getting the feeling that everybody there was a regular.
author: Kim S.

description: Pretty sweet bar.  Huge flat screen video system here.  Several dart boards too. They let you bring in your own food too, so that's tweet.
author: Rick H.

description:
I come to Mad Dog for several reasons:

1) I live across the street
2) Tuesday Trivia 
3) Jules the bartender
4) A quiet getaway for after work beer

Sadly, since moving to the neighborhood from my old Western Addition hood, I have yet to find a bar that compares to my old neighborhood bar 821. *sigh*  Mad dog is the closest, and only because Jules is such a sweetheart.  You really need to have a bartender you can relate to in your neighborhood. Tuesday night I come with my fellow comrades to try to dominate quiz night, yet we have yet to win the title of winning team.  Damn IPHONES!  This isn't Who Wants To Be A Millionaire people! you don't get lifelines!
author: Jade L.

description:
Nothing says Saturday morning to me like a post-hangover English Premier League match on the telly, PG Tips and an English Breakfast at The Mad Dog. Whether you're rooting for the Gooners or the Scousers, you'll have a great time because everybody here is into it. 

The home of football (soccer) in San Francisco indeed.
author: Andre L.

description:
Stopped by for a world cup game this Sunday, lots of internationals and tons of 'young' people there.  However, there was no seating at all, and it really reminded me of a Marina-type bar with standing room only, loud music, and people trying to dance at noon on a Sunday.

Not a traditional pub, but a great spot to hang with lots of excited people there.  Cash Only.
author: T. M. B.

description:
I usually go to the Toranado. However, some friends were gathering here. I have not been here in awhile. It was fun to revisit. Beer selection is good. It always puts a smile on my face when I see Fuller's beer on tap. Bartender was friendly and fast. 
They were accommodating for a large group.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Decent. Been here a couple of times with a Brit friend of mine to watch his club (Sunderland) play on the TV. 

Unfortunately I've now been to enough pubs and bars that, unless something compellingly dysfunctional happens or the bartender blows me (which I guess could qualify as the former), I can't get excited about neighborhood watering holes.
author: Karsten P.

description:
I just went there for the first time to watch Real Madrid VS Barcelona, and I had a blast! This is a great place to watch footy.  It had a nice amount of fans and a great atmosphere. The only problem I saw was that they allow people to sit on the pool tables, which inevitably leads to spilled drinks on said tables.  It didn't take long for that to happen.

Highly recommended if your in SF or visiting and need to watch your favorite match.
author: Rene C.

description:
An old local hang out for me that I STILL stop by when I'm in San Francisco.

I'm not a regular anymore, so I'll just say, in terms of British style pub.  They have fun.  They drink lots of beer.  They have trivia (a big UK thing - I learned this when I lived abroad...there was always a trivia match in the UK/Commonwealth dominated bars and pubs).  Watching soccer matches there is a blast!  That was always a the best part for me.

Plus, the location is great.  It's pretty easy to get to from downtown.  I could walk there in about 10 to 15 minutes from my apartment.  That stretch of block has some good restaurants too.  It's simply a fun bar in a great location.
author: Regina W.

description: Ok, went here after a date to watch the tail end of the Giants game. We were looking for Danny Coyle's but decided to just go in Mad Dog so as not to miss any more of the game. Ok crowd, comfy seats, not too crowded. There was an annoying drunk chick that started touching my dates arms and pecs but Im at a bar so drunkness is to be expected. I only have one question. Why was there 1970's porn playing after the game? There was some 1970's disco type sitcom streaming and every time I would look up someone was getting freaky. Weird. And the music was horrible.
author: Lauren N.

description:
The beer selection is not Toronado's, but the wait staff are friendly and it tends not to be crowded. 

I mean, I had my birthday party there, so that's gotta tell ya something...
author: Terika B.

description: A great place to go watch futbol.
author: Erich V.

description:
Ever since moving here I've been looking for a local pub, somewhere to hang out and have a beer or two at the end of the day. Thanks to the Dog my search is over.

There's a good selection of beers (including London Pride!) and the bar staff are friendly, so long as you don't take the piss. For smokers there's a back garden that's open most of the night and it's got enough seating to make sure you're seldom left leaning at the bar.

Other attractions include the pub quiz on Tuesdays and Thursdays, which are the only times the pub gets really rammed, and the two pool tables.

The only downside is no food, but the staff don't have any problem with you bringing in stuff as long as it's not too smelly.
author: Iain T.

description: Loud. Most of the patrons are not engaged in the soccer game - which is actually sad for a place that advertises itself soccer friendly.
author: Albert A.

description:
Somehow I'd lived here a year and had never been to Mad Dog. Then in one week I ended up there twice and purely by coincidence. 

The first time, I was at a charity function down the street and wandered over to Mad Dog after wards. I instantly fell in love. Pool tables, dart boards, pitchers of Stella and several tubes all playing soccer. Are you kidding me, is this what heaven is like?

Two days later I ended up there for a friend's birthday party. Another rockin time and now I'm hooked. A bold claim, I know, but this is my favorite pub in the city.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Fat Kids Are Harder To Kidnap.

Yup, that was our team name last Thursday night. And we were proud of it!  We arrived early, almost too early (630pm), but we did get the prime table in the room.  Enjoyed take out from Indian Oven and started drinking pitchers of beer, playing darts and watching old school soccer games.  

This was a great night!  I wanted to run around the bar yelling, "we have Yelper, Kirsten M. and you don't!  You are so going down!" But I held back and just played trivia.  Our team consisted of about 10 of us and we did have a couple of players who didn't really contribute, except to add, "yeah, I think that's the right answer." Overall, the beer was pretty inexpensive and the crowd was laid back.  

We had a perfect score after 2 rounds and then got our asses kicked with the 4th of July trivia.  So, we took second place and our prize, a free pitcher of beer and felt accomplished with our trivia skills. 

I'd totally recommend playing trivia here.  Everyone shows up to win! No BS.  Just beer and trivia!
author: Valarie A.

description:
We ended up spending the vast majority of our San Francisco vacation on Haight Street, primarily at Danny Coyle's or Toronado.  We stumbled into here (figuratively, not literally) one afternoon when we didn't feel like dealing w/a crowd at Toronado.

The place was fairly empty, which is just the way we like it.  The barkeep was engaging and very knowledgeable about beer (and a the second QPR bartender fan we met on our trip...what are the odds?).  There was a more than decent selection of beer, both on tap and in bottles.  

This place is def worth checking out if you're a beer lover on Haight St (particularly if the Toronado is chock full of hipsters...).
author: Summer K.

description:
Well, about ten years ago, I had just moved to the city, and was running around with a dodgy group of UK expats... spending much time in the lower haight area, partly 'cause I was living right there. Some of those Brits were staying at the cracked out hostel next to noc noc, and we often, sometimes, a few times at least, would begin an epic evening out by congregating with beers in hand at the mad dog. 

One of those nights, seems like ages ago now, one of the Brits brought a fellow hostel-ite, a sweet young swiss lass, with whom I fell into conversation with right away, through the eve, and on till dawn. And then the next night, and the next, and so on...

Events have occurred, times have changed, people have moved on, things are different...though I suppose some still the same; but I still talk for hours on end to that same swiss girl, because she became my wife, and I will always love mad dog in the fog for that reason right there.

Mad Dog... kinda dirty, sticky, rowdy, lots o' beers, sketchy characters, disatrous toilets, and lots of footy on the telly. Pretty traditional pub food too, if yer eatin'. Don't change a thing.
author: Jeremy H.

description: Great beer selection, pretty large space, pool table, trivia (on Thursdays) and one large table with a tap (great for groups).  Seemed like a good, mixed crowd of people and was comfortably casual inside.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: I came here just after a broadcasted event when the place had just cleared out. I sat down at one of the tables and read a menu. After 10 min I asked a bus boy if I should order at the bar or if there was table service. He told me he'd send someone right over. 10 min later he came back and said it would be just a minute. During that time there were other parties getting table service. After 5 more minutes of waiting we left and went down the street to Nickies where the service was prompt and friendly.
author: Nicole A.

description:
This has become one of those places I can pop into with friends or by myself.  This says much about the bar, and a ton about the bartender.

By far, Derick is one of the best in the biZ :)
he's always friendly, on point with service and a handsome mug for those into a lil eye candy ;)

They have an outdoor patio, which is nice on the occasional sunny day!
author: sUper j.

description: Coming from the East Coast (NYC) it was a godsend to have a bar like Mad Dog down the block from me. Great beer select (both tap an bottled), great food (you have to get the mahi tacos), and best of all they open early for all the soccer matches!  Showing up at 8am to watch Manchester United in the Champions League supplemented by a full English breakfast brought me back to my time in Manchester. Derek, the stylish Irish fellow, is also one of the friendliest, nicest bartender/owner that this city has to offer (chat him up and you'll see what I mean). This is not a scene bar!!  No pretentious hipsters or bad/loud music.  There is lots of seating, a long bar and even an outside patio in the back.  I highly recommend it for all of your good time - night out - needs.
author: Mike S.

description:
The people who work there are soooo nice. And they pour foamless pints. And Trivia Night is kind of my reason for making it through the week.

I'm just sad it's so popular with loud fratty asswipes who're living their own real-life 21st-century versions of Pulp's "Common People," or at least acting like it. Go back to the Marina and spank yourselves with your SAE paddles, tardfaces.
author: Alyssa R.

description:
I used to come here all the time.  I took a break and recently returned.  The entire place has changed.  The bar knocked down a wall and really opened up the place.  They added comfy and roomy booths too.  It wasn't too crowded on a Friday night but busy enough to not feel weird.  They had decent beers on tap at 4.50.  The bartender was nice and attentive and the crowd ranged from yuppies to hipsters, but all friendly.   I will definitely be back.  It's a great friday or saturday night stop.

A note, my friend said it's an awesome place to watch soccer.  He's been there at 7am and the place was packed.
author: Emily G.

description:
Last night yet again I found myself drinking beer at 7pm on an empty stomach. Good thing the trivia wasn't until 9 (well, advertised as 9, time is a little fuzzy, but I'm pretty sure it didn't actually get started until around 4am. or thereabouts). Gave me plenty of time to prepare my brain with the required ethanol. Other than having a great time meeting some new people, I rate this bar as Pretty Standard. Plenty roomy, reasonable beer selection, and an apparently delicious pear cider as well! I was only mildly offended when offered $1 off a Bud coupon. But don't worry, I didn't use it. 

Anyone need a $1 off a Bud coupon?
author: Ben M.

description:
Back in the day, this place rocked!  They had damn-good bangers-n-mash that complimented the rest of their food menu.  Unfortunately, the food is gone now... so you can't really call it a pub anymore; it's a beer and wine bar... no liquor.

The original owner made sure this place was as authentic as you can get a British pub in the US, but the new owners haven't kept up the pace.  The problem seems to stem from the new owner treating this place like a stepchild; he has another bar that gets more of his attention.  Nowadays, the Mad Dog is often used as a warehouse for the new stuff that will go in the other bar.

One other problem I've encountered here is that one of the new bartenders doesn't understand that the word 'football' means 'soccer' in a British pub; as a result, she changes the channel to American football games on Sunday, despite the fact English football games are rerun at that time per the information on the sidewalk chalkboard and the phone match rerun hot line.

The final straw for me was when I was bothered at the bar by some shady-lookin' dude that wanted to give me a lighter if he could scan my drivers license into his hand held computer.  I thought the 'No Solicitors' sign at the front door would keep scum like this out, but bartender in charge didn't see this as a problem and allowed him to continue harassing her patrons.  I haven't been back since.
author: Stephen B.

description:
Ah, good ol' Mad Dog. My favorite place for trivia on any given week. My favorite place for "I'm in the lower Haight and don't know what the fuck to do with myself" on any given week. And who knows what else.

Some great memories over 8 years here: of sweet victories, of loud abrasive arguments, of lurid team names, of bad photocopies (is that Henry Kissinger or Ben Affleck? Could be either), of 1998 & 2002 world cup matches, along with premiere league and Euro cup and all that hoo haa (Senegal beats France! Ireland beats somebody! Everyone gets wasted anyway!), of downing a Boddingtons with an Ali Baba shawarma from across the street....man, am I missing it.

British pubs in Phoenix? Nothing remotely the same. Alas... 

But as long as I know Mad Dog is still open and hasn't been converted into some Marina-oid scenester lounge, I'm a-ok. Keeps me going...
author: Mr K.

description:
Looks like I'm an outlier here. I was wandering around the haight on a sunday and wanted to watch the redskins game, so i ducked in here. It was pretty empty and there was plenty of space and a decent beer selection, which is the only reason it gets 2 stars.

It took us about 20 minutes to get a tv station changed. Not because there were multiple requests, not because o one wanted it to be changed, not because the bartenders were busy. I know people are enamored with this bartender but my god I think the guy has a serious case of ADD. Should not be a bartender. We'd ask him to change a tv to the game, he'd say "yeah, ok" and then disappear for 10 minutes, and then come back and sort of stand there like "oh,  guess I'll just chill out." We seriously thought he was playing some prank on us, or didn't want the redskins game to be played. but no, he just forgot. so we asked again. This happened about three times before he finally got the remote out and changed the station - we missed the kickoff. we were kinda pissed.

This is a sports bar... they have several flatscreens that are NICE. good seats to view them. but more than one were on blue screens for several minutes when I knew there was a good game that could be showing. 

further evidence that this guy was a little ADD - he left a tap running for about a minute, I watched about two full glasses of beer run over the top of a glass while he was down at the other end of the bar having a conversation with a friend. Another time, he left a guy's full beer just sitting there while that guy just waited and waited for it, and the bartender wasn't even serving someone else, he was counting cash. weird! 

I think there's a reason this place was empty. weird vibe. seemed like everyone was there for the first time, except for a few rude and obnoxious regulars. won't be returning.
author: Rachel D.

description: I went here to watch a Giants game tonight and was having a fine time until I realized that the seat had Duct tape on it and my pants had gotten sticky from the tape!  It was so annoying.  The nachos were delicious but they had cilantro in them, which I hate.  If you are looking to pick up straight white men in their late 20s, this is the place I think.  The Irish server was really sweet.
author: Julia D.

description: This is a fun sports bar with a huge beer list, enough TV's to play every football game on Sunday plus a few Euro soccer games.  I like that you can get a pitcher here for a reasonable price but I don't like that they give you those cheap plastic ones (but then again, the sports fans in here seem like they can a little rowdy after a day of football so the less broken glass the better).  I didn't get any food but the table next to me with the chicken wings smelled great.  I also always appreciate a bar that is dog friendly and I really like their back patio.
author: Scott G.

description:
I like to come here for trivia on Thursdays.  The place is packed on these nights, though, so unless you're an early bird, forget about any worms...or seats.  

Unlike some other places, you can at least be competitive in this trivia, and the music round is particularly good.

If you need cash, forget about the fee-mongering ATM machine, and instead hit up Walgreens across the street.
author: LJ W.

description:
Great pub in the Lower Haight that shows soccer all week long and has trivia night on Tuesdays.  It's a more mellow alternative to the Bitter End's pub quiz, which gets extremely crowded with intense trivia fiends (some of whom take it WAY too seriously).

Be aware that Mad Dog serves only beer and wine... Luckily, I happen to like both.
author: Andrew E.

description:
The tuesday night quiz master pockets his way around the room, the blearly eyed wonder, drunk with routine. Even the lines get spat out with forgotten glee, "do you think yer winners this week eh?!" He's that same kid from London-town with his three-striped sweat pants and Manchester footie top. I knew kids like this, albiet this one's turned fifty since. This place feels like Dublin; I know the scene. I'll stroll to the bathroom stall, one of the wankers will be splaying his name against the wall - beer held high, "how's this fer fookin' rain, lads?" Turning on the fly I bump into some girl with a mouth for offence, she pushes me off only to pinball into the eyes of a smiling bar-tender. You're only a man if you order a beer, son - an alcopop for the sister you say? Tucking in my pot-belly I stroll off to a series of mock-pregnant girls for a quick snog and a two-touch grope.

A snap of nostalgia shaken loose by a finger thrust into my side. I could do this again.
author: Marc M.

description:
As a seasoned bar vet (serving in both of the great bar wars), this single handedly is one of my favorite bars not just in my neighborhood but in the bay area. If you're into cheap GOOD bear and a super laid back atmosphere, this is the place to be. As much fun as Toronado's and the Page can be, I never liked the crowded atmosphere at these places and having to stand... (i'm a lazy bum, what can I say). Mad Dog in the Fog doesn't ever get too crowded full of bodies and there's always room for you and friends; especially if you can land the semi-private pool table room right next to the entrance.

Overall, if you like good inexpensive beer (like Newcastle or Guinesses)  and like a laid back private bar experience with your friends (or just watching a Premier League match on the big screen), then this is your place
author: Alex P.

description: Great pub in the Haight, a true gathering place where you can catch up with friends over a decent pint. Very friendly crowd, and it's a great place to watch soccer, especially at nine in the morning!
author: Nish N.

description: Great staff- great beer selection. A lot bigger than most pubs in the area-even has outside patio. Nicole & Jewels are super sweet. Glad to have such a great bar in my new neighborhood!
author: Susan C.

description:
I stopped in when trivia was going on, and I don't see how anyone can understand the quizmaster!  The questions are hard enough without struggling to interpret the Irish accent and fuzzy mic.  And the crowd didn't seem to have a real competitive vibe going on.  But I'll be back to try my (lack of) skills anyway...it's humiliating, but somehow fun.  Trivia is 9:15 on Tuesdays and 9:30 on Thursdays.

Good variety of beer on tap, but my friends and I got persuaded into a pitcher of Red Hook cuz  a rep was there handing out coupons.
author: Gina K.

description:
Oh trivia...trivia...trivia...trivia! 

I have never won.
I have never come close to winning.
I probably will never win.
and you know what? 
I don't care.

why you ask?

Because I love you Mad Dog...I LOVE YOU.

(even though you now charge me $2 more for a pitcher)
author: Kat R.

description: Best bar in Lower Haight.  Bartenders are super friendly for this big bar that always has a great mix of people in it.  Good place to watch a game, hang out and shoot pool, mingle with locals, or even groove to the DJ they have on the weekends.
author: Captain J.

description: Cool sport bar. The owner was great, he accomodated our request to watch a soccer game. Fun environment and good beer. I totally recommend it!
author: Alessandra V.

description:
I checked out Mad Dog for the first time the other night, and loved it!
Any bar that plays reggae all night is awesome.
They have a couple pool tables which is great.
Lots of seating with large booths.
The only thing i would change would be to add liquor to the bar menu!  Beer and wine only folks.
author: Jordan D.

description: Three words: wings for breakfast. I love this place and all the people who work there because, in addition to being completely awesome and adorable, they do not judge me for my aforementioned breakfast choices.
author: Chloe S.

description:
This place breaks rule #1 of a bar -- it's way too bright inside.  Combine that with the high ceiling, and the sparseness (at least for a Saturday night) of the patrons, and it makes for a less-than-cozy ambience.  Plus, I ordered a drink off their own cocktail list (the "Han Solo") and they didn't know what I was talking about.

But in spite of all that, it's a nice, attitude-free place to knock back a few, and you can show up with 10 people and still get to sit down. Plus they have 2 pool tables, darts, and Connect Four (with almost enough pieces to make it winnable!).  Bonus points for the name and for being in the Lower Haight.

Also, I had no idea they have a pub quiz here, so I will definitely be back to check it out--so far I've only been to the Brainstormer ones.
author: Wes M.

description: Love the trivia night. Had an awesome time with our group and there were loads of friendly people around.
author: shadi m.

description:
MAD DAWG IN THE FAWG!!!

We wanted to find a new place for trivia and this is THE spot.  Place has a great vibe that makes you feel welcome.  Nice open spaces.  It was kind of funny sitting at the tiny table.  I felt like the kids at Thanksgiving who have to sit at their own mini table.  

They trivia was better than other places I've been to.  The questions were reasonable yet in depth, and the celebrity picture round was great!  My friend said the beer prices were awesome too.

Mad Dog, we'll be back.
author: Levi B.

description:
I like Mad Dog, I recommend coming for the trivia night.  It's fun although the amount of participants has fluctuated from 7 teams who all have seats to like 13 teams and half of them are standing.  I know they only have beer, but I like beer and their selection is pretty good (Blue Moon, Weissbier, Sierra Nevada IPA) in comparison to some other bars (although no match for Toronado).

Oh and for you hardcore trivia folks...  beware...  there is supposedly some mysterious 5-tool team that likes to show up every Tuesday night and miss maybe one answer.  Let's just says my team has come in second/third place more than I'd like to admit.

Trivia aside, the bar is pretty roomy even though the bathroom is a little cramped.  They manage to keep a few american sports on the tube alongside the various football (soccer) matches.  Additionally, the bartenders are pretty nice.  It can be a little tough to get a beer since there are a few regulars who belly up to the bar, but overall, this is a good place to go.
author: Steven R.

description:
I've been going to Mad Dog for a long time and it's always been one of my favorite bars.  Cheap beer, outside patio, good pub atmosphere, trivia night, pool tables and sports on TV.  Oh, and the biggest reason I go there, the two dartboards.

Well Mad Dog recently did some major renovations.  They ripped out a couple walls that used to form a small room with a pool table at the front and opened up the space.  They replaced the tables with booths, put mirrors on the wall, added some mood lighting and mounted some nice LCD TVs on the walls.

In general, the remodeling looks nice, although it somewhat takes away from the pub/dive bar feel that I actually liked on a cold foggy night, and it can get a bit cold in there now that there is no long hallway to keep the cold air out.  I could do without the booths, they seem a little off.

But the BIGGEST sin of all.  They removed the dartboards!!!!  They plan to move the bar down and when they do that, the area where the dartboards used to be won't exist anymore.  Up until this travesty, I would have given Mad Dog 5 stars for sure.  Now, without the Dart Boards, I have to knock them way down.  It's hard enough to find a decent place to play darts in the city, now I can't think of any place in Lower Haigh, Divis or Upper Haight that has a board.  The only options are to go to Kilowatt and play on their horrible boards which can't hold a dart half the time, or head to the Inner Sunset or Geary.  

2 stars may be a little harsh, but I just don't see myself going there because now it is just another sports bar with pool tables and the atmosphere is different.  Trivia night may be the only draw left for me, they better not get rid of that or I'll have to update my review and knock it down to 1 star.

Such a dissappointment....
author: Bill K.

description:
Early morning sports. Darts.

That's what I have to say about MDITF... and that's about it.
author: Chris L.

description:
As a local, Mad Dog was my favorite spot in the neighborhood.  Friendly bar staff (Jules), Tues / Thurs trivia, allowed food in the bar, back smoking patio, futbol all the time, and the crowning jewel: two dart boards with the boddingtons scoreboard between (pictured in one of the photos here).

Unfotunately with a recent remodel they've gone to booths... huh?  Flat HD TVs (thats a positive), mood lighting - which I suppose I could get used to but it just doesn't feel like the same place, they removed the giant Mad Dog mural... come on that's your name sake!  It's colder now because of the removal of some walls... and the worst... no dart boards.  These were literally the only darts within a 10 block radius and I'm pretty frustrated that I can't just walk down the block and get my dart on anymore.

I do love this place and it is still probably my favorite spot in the neighborhood, but I have to knock it from 4 to 2 stars because of these changes.  I'll give the ol' Dog more chances down the road to earn some stars back, but for the time being, I'll be scouting other bars in the neighborhood and spending more time at Steffs (downtown) and Killowat (mission) where they still condone the use of sharp objects thrown through the air.
author: Dustin P.

description: Just wanted to congratulate you guys on hosting an awesome BarCraft Event!!!  Keep it up!!!
author: Dyami A.

description:
this used to be my local for years,it was sold a  few years  back i would have to give it one star for beer prices,5-6 dollars for beer is too much some beers are 8 dollars
the have not put money into the bathroom they put glossy coat of black pant to cover it up it cant cover up smell,of piss,1 star for barmaid wednesday night about 6pm
bad service,its a dive bar they put some lights up and some screens and charge a lot for beer,they pump load musc out to make it seem trendy,they need to spend a lot of money to fx it up,i will not be back there
author: cc c.

description: Very friendly pub. The bartender was super friendly and they and drinks on tap you normally wouldn't see. It is definitely a good spot if you just want to hang out with your buddies while watching a game.
author: Sonlay V.

description: Been meaning to come back here: good ambience and they have a great range of drinks, including a couple of different types of my beloved cider!
author: Darren O.

description:
Great beer selection and overall a pretty chill place. I also came here about a year ago for trivia night which was good fun. Oh and they have a dart board and board games (which people were actually playing). I saw people playing Battleship, Monopoly and Scrabble.

One thing though...the bathroom was WEIRD. The toilet seat was ripped off of the toilet, and there was a piece of plywood covering one of the walls.
author: Stu M.

description:
I love football. I don't like waiting 20 minutes to get a beer on Saturday. This place takes care of both problems. 

The bartender who was working the night I was in looked like a cross between Patty Duke and a Suicide Girl and was pretty much fucking awesome (playing Neutral Milk on her iBook through the sound system, good sense of humor, smile that would kill mere mortal men). 

If she completely forgets to charge you for your beer, or brings the wrong change, be nice and let her know without grief. You never know when you might be in the next day, stoned, and forgetting to pay after you order each round!

I'm so going back. Often.
author: Aiden B.

description:
I used to love this place! Of course as a customer and an "outsider" you don't see what goes on behind the curtains. Well I've had a little bit more insight lately and to be honest, it's not pretty at all. 
First and foremost, this place is infested with cockroaches!!!! I've seen them walk around behind the booths as if they were owning the place! It's cockroach paradise! I would think twice before ordering food there. 
Second, the place is understaffed. I feel bad for both the waitresses and bartenders who have to deal with this shit. Then again, they chose to work there. There is no certificate mentioning the max capacity for the bar which is a clear law violation and as much as an animal lover as I am, they allow dogs in the bar. I have even seen a dog sitting on the back patio tables. Would you really eat from a table where a dog you don't know has been sitting on all day? 
The staff keeps on changing, coming and going, the turnover is spectacular! It makes me wonder.... I've seen some of the waitresses hold back their tears as they were getting scolded in the midst of a very busy shift! Not professional at all! 
I don't feel like this is a place worth returning to. There are so many more exhilarating places to explore in SF than to return to this bar which pretends to be the ONE! I'm sorry guys but if you want to keep it up you need to step it up a whole fucking notch!!!!!
author: Pasion P.

description:
-1 star bc the music sucked-- i thought it should be more upbeat less folk c'mon i am drinking i dont want buzz kill music.

This a great place to chill w friends.  Its such an activity bar. My friends and I had such a great time playing TABOO with pitchers of beer.  We then made the mistake of going to the Marina on a Saturday night- and then get sardined with random smelly people with no place to put a pitcher of beer.  i digress.  Ne way definitely a TOP KICK IT place.  Great GREAT place to go with a group of people that don't care to be lost in a club and just really wanna get drunk watch some sports play some games. etc.

but the music has got to go.
author: Paola L.

description:
Since the remodel, I have become a bit of a lingerer in Mad Dog. It's clean and welcoming with plenty of seating as well as an outdoor patio. 

Serving only beer and wine creates a nice pub feel that's amenable to conversation. They have a several English beers on tap (love my Boddington's) and it's not as frenetic as the Toronado. You don't get the Toronado's selection but I'm not that hardcore of a beer connoisseur. 

If I were a soccer fan, this would probably be my place of choice to watch the game but since I'm not, it will have to be my favorite place to eat my Rosamunde sausage, enjoy a brew and visit with the people I heart. After all, friends don't let friends go to bad pubs.
author: Corey F.

description:
I wish I liked it here b/c it's one of my four or five neighborhood bars.  

I love my neighborhood and I love bars but I do not love Mad Dog b/c the lights are always way too bright and the music sucks.  Otherwise, I'm sure it would be a fine place to watch whatever sports I always see people watching in there.
author: Abby M.

description:
Great bar- probably one of the better Lower Haight Bars and one of the top sports bars in the city

Pros:
- Trivia (FYI, Tuesday is the easier night; Thursday is tougher- starts at 915)
- Good beer selection
- Friendly barstaff
- Really comfortable vibe
- Best place in the city for watching European soccer.  This place gets packed around World Cup / European Cup / Champions League time.

Cons:
- No hard alcohol
- Tables are hard to come by
- Would be nice if they had more bar food (although Rosamunde Sausage is right across the street!)
author: Jeff A.

description: This place was almost the perfect destination. It's a sports lover's paradise with several selections of beer on tap, wide screens, and a cute waitress. But ask the dickhead bartender to change one of the screens to baseball and you get the evil eye. You're better off at Danny Coyles where the staff actually wants the patrons to feel welcomed and valued.
author: Suzanne T.

description:
Yes the bartender with the funny accent, he is from Northern Ireland.  

Okay so I went to Mad Dog to watch the USC vs. Cal game (go trojans) after the Lovevolution explosion downtown.  It was nice to walk into a bar and not be overrun by drunk half-naked people (or maybe I had just gotten too much of that on this particular day).  There was an empty high top just for my friends and I and we enjoyed several rounds of beer.  Great choices available here.  The heffe on tap was super.  We also ate many bags of Kettle brand potato chips.  It would be nice if there was something else to eat, BUT I saw pizza boxes and later some other friends brought in Mexican food so evidently it is BYOF, which rocks. 

The outside patio is really sweet and cozy, although not very warm, but that is the fault of the wind.
author: Stephanie E.

description:
Stella on tap - and although on a recent visit to London, I learned Stella is a Chav beer - I still love it and love the places that have it on tap.

We went last night with some old and new friends and had a very good time.

Love the feel of the place with the pool tables, and tables etc...

-1 star because the music got a little loud at times, and I feel like the bar and the crowd didn't necessitate that.

Went to Rosamunde's for sausage and came back to Trivia - who doesn't love trivia!!!!????


Defiantely a good place to meet for a pint or 2 or 3 and some sausage and pool!!!!
author: Annie M.

description:
I've like this place every time I've gone. The beers were cheap enough and the service was quick. It's a pub that actually feels like a pub and the crowd there is usually of the Western European sort and reminds me of high school, but in a homey, familiar way, not a pathetic one. 

I only gave it three stars however because I went there on the night of its closing party. Last night ever. Drink some beers and shed some tears for our friend that will be disappearing into that fog. The bartenders were somber and the patrons were melancholy. So sad. 

...That was four years ago. It's still there. It's still crowded every night. There's never been any mention or evidence of new management. I have, however, heard rumors that its "closing" over the years.

So what gives? Not that I actually wish them to go close down, not at all, its one of the only bars worth while on Haight street. But I feel lied to, Mad Dog, lied to.
author: Torey B.

description:
At first you think the evening's going to end with a friendly game of Midnight Monopoly as a come-down from the cinema, courtesy of Mad Dog's stock of board games.

For some strange reason though, you inhale your opening round of icy Blackthorne and impatiently belly back to the bar for a sequel, which the strawberry blonde pulls effortlessly. Only after your Jackson's broken does she mention that while one round is four dollars, upgrading to a pitcher sets you back a far-too-reasonable fifteen.

Fast forward to the next morning when you've spent thirty minutes shaking your head in the cafe and apologizing to the cute barista for not going firecracker from the triple cap she served up in a pint glass. Somewhere between that morning's opener and the David Cronenberg siesta you silently thank Mad Dog for it all.

Thank you Mad Dog.
author: JD L.

description:
Mad Dog in the Fog is the place I go when I visit Susan and we stick around her neighborhood.  

Who is Susan you ask?  Don't ask,  you're not good enough for her.  But Mad Dog is!

There's a mellow atmosphere, 2 pool tables, 2 dart boards and a nice patio out back for those of you who didn't just quit smoking.  SHIT!  RRRAAAH!  You'll get some sun out here if you sit on the right side and it's before 2pm, otherwise it's shaded and you need a sweatshirt, unless you're a big badass and cold is your bitch.

When find yourself a bit peckish, there's a bunch of eats on the block.  I like to get a few beers here and then grab a brat at the sausage place across the street, or falafel at Ali Baba's.  

Oh, yeah.  Plus Mad Dog has one of those awesome bathroom windows that's always open, so when you're peeing, you're pretty sure the person in the second floor apartment across the alley is looking at your ding while they wash dishes.  Vintage SF personality.
author: Lee P.

description:
very fond memories of THAT game early on a sunday morning (i couldn't do the gin and tonic at 9am, so I just had OJ) where Man United ended Arsenal's record breaking unbeaten run.

Made some new friends and shouted myself hoarse. A long time ago though. But still have many fond memories.
author: Sarav C.

description: Great place to watch almost any sports game. They have a really wide selection of beer, as well as a nice outdoor patio with a television. The food here isn't too bad either.
author: Dale S.

description: Weird little bar in the rough and tumble lower Haight.  As good as anywhere to get drunk and kick it.  I enjoyed my times there.  I would go back.  Good beer selection.
author: Cynthia B.

description: Yay !! I'm a fan but  $8.50 for  a glass of white   wine. Hadn't been there in a while  a stopped off fo  a minute and  saw  that the bartender had  already open a  bottle  of white  wine  -yes  I should have  checked  the   price after the bill came I felt that  maybe  I had walked into some  expensive Italian Trattatoria. YFYI
author: Roberto A.

description:
Let's do the time warp again! Wow, we wandered in here on a Saturday night to find a rockabilly band, The Haywoods, rocking out with style. Everyone in there was dressed up like the 50s dancing to Johnny Cash covers. I had a fair amount of whiskey in me at the time, so I seemed to fit in there just right. I hear about the pub quiz here all the time, so I'll have to go back and check it out as well.

Ooh, and their Soju bloody marys (with a shot of Guiness) are a wonder of the liquor world.
author: Michael E.

description:
Nothing but beer + Only one womens' toilet = Potential problems for me.  Yeah...
Anyway...This is a good place for groups to meet, when it's not all that crowded.  It's not overly loud and you can actually have a conversation.
And there's root beer on tap.  Just try to find that in England.
author: Lego S.

description:
Who doesn't love an Irish bartender?? Who doesn't love soccer on the flat screens?? Who doesn't love pub trivia that you can actually answer after a few pitchers of beers & sitting on high chairs, which you nearly fall out of when you need to go the bathroom but have to end up do the wee-wee dance in front of everyone because it's a solo toilet behind door #1?? 

I only frequent this fine establishment on Tuesday & Thursday nights for the trivia night. Nonetheless I always leave with a smile on my face... even though majority of the time we end up losing in the trivia- but we won once, that's the real point. Everyone can be a winner. The beer selection is superb- American & foreign taps & all available to be served in a pitcher.
author: Madhu D.

description:
Mad Dog!  Holy mawhat?!?!?!  Legit places to sit?  Now with new cleaner, sleeker interior without losing the flavor of the bar--indeed probably enhancing it!

You still pour me a beer when I want it.

And not only did you finally get real HD, but you got a ton of new screens.

Easy fourth star, you earned it.
author: Stef A.

description: I want Mad Dog to be better, as I live in the Lower Haight, and they have so much potential. However, their service is simply horrible. They are slow and understaffed. Most of the time, the staff is unfriendly. We waited 30 minutes tonight to pay our food & drink bill (they had my credit card). We walked around to find the waitress. After searching, we went after the bartender, who told us to wait. The last 5 visits have been very disappointing, and they've all been on weekdays. Management, please get it together!
author: Doug K.

description:
Met some friends here on a Monday night.

It was one of the most relaxed bar experiences I've ever had.

The place wasn't packed full of people which made it very easy to order from the bar.

The bartender was a really nice girl, who must of liked Oasis a TON because it was playing off and on all night.

Great bar all around! I can't wait to check out Trivia night!
author: Ericka A.

description:
Like many other people that have posted, I've never been a fan of sports bars.  The main reason being that they usually only play American sports.
Personally, any pub that plays 7am live football games and replays through out the day is good by me.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Really liked this bar.  Very laid back and casual.  They seemed to play more soccer and other things like Rugby rather than the Mainstream Sports.  Kinda cool to check out some of the other sports since I AM a Sports Nut.  

Definitely want to come back and experience their patio in the back.  Came here on a chilly night so didn't do it my first time here but would love to come here just for that on a nice warm and sunny day...  

Had a chance to shoot some pool too as they have 2 tables payable by quarters.  Cheaper than most coin-operated tables at $.50 a game........
author: Mark W.

description:
Mad Dog is like a perennial standby. It's usually got a good crowd during big tournaments (it's elbows to assholes during the World Cup), and I like watching US games here and drunkenly heckling Landon Donovan (as if he could hear me). 

I don't follow the Premiership as much as I used to, or I'd be up here on Saturday mornings taking abuse for being a Scouser by Gooners and glory hunting Man U fans.

Regardless, it's one of my favorite soccer ("Football" is a context-sensitive term in the US; correcting people makes you sound like a pretentious douchebag unless you're not American) bars in SF because

A: It's technically walking distance from my apartment.
B: Kezar is not.
C: The bar staff is awfully nice and take care of me rather quickly.

I wish they showed more games from other leagues (Serie A and Bundesliga come to mind), but there's only so much time to show so many games.
author: Sterling M.

description:
I got them to play the Oilers vs the Flames on the big screen on a Saturday night - 5 stars! (OK, no other major sporting events were on....)

The satellite feed kept wonking out, they tried to fix it a couple of times, then gave up on it - minus 1 star.

They kicked my friends out who brought food in before Mad Dog's kitchen was closed  - minus 1 star. Almost gave a star back because we were allowed to bring our Rosamunde's in after the kitchen was closed, but still poor form to kick people out who already began eating, right?

The Oilers lost, but I can't subtract a star for that, as I actually didn't watch it happen there.
author: Priya S.

description: Cool place to hang out with your friends.  Even better place to watch the games - baseball, football, soccer etc.
author: Jo P.

description: Best place in SF to watch the World Cup. The atmosphere is electric and you've a multitude of TV screens to choose from. They do a great breakfast!!  Staff are very friendly and service is always excellent.  Special mention to their new bartender Sylvia who is super friendly and very attentive. I was equally impressed with  Mickey and Derek. They're very chatty and engaging. The bar was renovated a while ago and the owner did a nice job. The outdoor patio comes in handy for smokers and on a warm day, it's nice to be able to throw back some coronas outside! The booths are VERY comfy and I love the pool tables. Great place to go with a bunch of friends.
author: Clare C.

description:
Great lower Haight bar, only serving beer and a damn fine trivia night!  Now that the wall between the bar and the pool tables has been removed, there's more room.  The patio outside is ace on a sunny day, and sports are always on the large screen tv's.  

Good clean fun, cool bartenders and no attitudes!
author: regina k.

description:
Is it wrong that I love the Mad Dog? It's always my first choice for a place to hang out. Unfortunately, I don't go as often as I'd like because my friends think the place is dirty and that the clientele leaves something to be desired. They're right, but it doesn't stop me from loving the Mad Dog. 

The food is only so-so, but they will often let you bring in outside food (maybe just if their kitchen is closed?) and there's a bunch of good places for food on the street - indian, sushi, sausages, etc. But, at 7 am, when you don't want to leave in the middle of the game, their breakfast and a shandy will do nicely.

Another dog-friendly pub (as all pubs should be)...Charlie loves it here.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Me: I'll have a gin and tonic
Bartender: Nope.
Me: No really, gin and tonic
Bartender: Nope.

ok, it turns out they only serve beer.  This is a really fun neighborhood beer bar and their quiz nights are really fun, just don't come by when there's a sporting event on.  Blue Moon and Longhammer IPA on tap, works for me.  

ps if the weather is nice check out the back patio.
author: Alex K.

description: I live in Chicago, but my brother-in-law brought me here because I wanted to catch an Italy/Brazil friendly and he said it was the best bar in town for soccer. It was mid-day on a weekday, so it wasn't too crowded, but I LOVED it. I believe the bartender was Irish, and she was sweet as could be. Super nice lady. Beer selection's great. Lots of good craft brews. And the food was good for what it was-bar food. I got the fish and chips and they were legit. If I lived in SF, I'd hang here all the time.
author: Melissa G.

description:
I have frequented here pretty regularly, as I live nearby and I am a most comfortable in a good English style pub.  Unfortunately Mad Dog does not have much of a pub feel to it.  

It's not a bad place to go, but it never feels inviting to stay.  It often seems pretty vacant - but crowds up a bit on Tuesday and Thursday quiz nights, and also on weekends.  

The kitchen closes at 8.  I still haven't tried their food - in part because it is not an inviting place to sit down and eat.  (I don't know why they have all those weird high tables along the one wall, rather than some regular pub tables in the room.)  

The final straw though that really knocks down the ratings scale is the FLAT Boddingtons I keep getting there.  They would probably only merit 2 stars if I did not live so close to them.
author: Carl ..

description:
Went here for the first time the other night on a cold, rainy night...the place was pretty empty...but that's ok with me...I don't think pubs should be overly crowded in the first place.  Darts, pool tables, plus a fine selection of board games, which always a nice touch. Bonus Star for having Newcastle on tap. (obviously). Minus one star for not having a liquor license, which saddened me when we came here, since it was so cold out, I really wanted some whiskey.  But, those are pretty expensive,  so can't really say much about that...

Overall, I'd say it's a thoroughly average bar, which would probably be best in the afternoon for a game of darts, pool, or perhaps monopoly (which I will destroy all comers at!) :)
author: Matthew S.

description:
My friend and I found this a few months ago in looking for a place between our apartments to meet. It manages to remain a strangely generic sports pub in the middle of the quirky lower Haight. Beer only, but get excited, because they have board games available behind the bar. What is better than a generic sports pub where you can sit down with your friends and play Mall Madness or Taboo?

Overall, not a bad place to get drinks, especially if you're looking for a laid back night, and don't feel like battling the crowds at the other, trendier bars in the area.
author: Kristen M.

description:
I can't believe how many times I've frequented this place because of the trivia or the weird pseudo-sports bar feel (I'm usually thrown off by the combination of soccer and Arcade Fire). I like it though, in a weird way, because everyone is so friendly and nice, there is a lot of space, and the beer is cheap.

I guess I just hate going to a bar to talk to my friends, only to spend a good chunk of my time hovering over tables and pouncing on the first person to leave.

It's a great neighborhood bar, though it doesn't strike me as anything fantastic. Just comfortingly average.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Awesome Football Pub that plays almost all the premiere league and champions league games.  You can always count on a good turnout for Saturday and Sunday morning matches, and if you think it is too early for a pint, they black out the windows to help boost the atmosphere.  Watching games with a solid Football crowd like at Mad Dog boosts the experiance 10 fold, I mean what would be a good game without heckling and team chants like "GLORY GLORY MAN UNITED!".  I have been their for all the big premiere league games and plan to continue to go no matter what hour of the day - next time you stop in raise your glass to the red devils - Mad dog is a must go for all footy fans.

- CSE
author: John G.

description:
Still a good place for Premier League matches early on the weekend.

For years I came by every weekend; but that ended when they got rid of the old breakfast menu.  I guess the new owner decided the economics did not work.

WTF "breakfast burrito"?
author: helge m.

description:
Nothing too special about this place other than there's a lot of space. I was amazed they had so much empty space, both floor and ceiling. A couple flat screens on the walls and a small bar. It had a Euro soccer feel for some reason and I'm not sure I'm basing that off anything other than my gut thoughts. Good for a laid back evening putting back a couple cold ones.

I'd be fine revisiting this place another night.
author: Jay U.

description:
I went to Mad Dog in the Fog for the Champions League Final after reading about it on Yelp and was very impressed by its enthusiasm for soccer and the atmosphere it created for the game.  The place was packed with fans on a Wednesday afternoon and had a television or projection screen on almost every wall, so you could see the game regardless of where you were standing.

Mad Dog in the Fog is a good pub for a drink, but more importantly is a great place to watch a soccer game.
author: Trevor J.

description: If you are in Lower Haight on a hot day do not pass on the back patio here.  The beers are normal priced but they offer a wider selection than your average place in the area.  I got to try out "London's Pride" on a hot day and it worked out nicely.  They try really hard to offer the UK style beers like Kronenberg 1664 which differentiates this bar.
author: Joey S.

description: I love trivia night here.  They generally speaking don't have enough chairs to accomodate on trivia night, but still a fun place.  They only serve beer and wine, but I've gotten water & OJ before.  I wish they had funner non-alki beverages.  Cash only is annoying, but that's most of SF, innit?
author: Cara J.

description: This place gets a good crowd for its Tuesday night trivia contest -- run by the same guy who does the Pig & Whistle's.  The patio out back is nice and the layout inside is pleasant enough.
author: Tim G.

description: The service here is a hit or miss.. Not sure what happen today, I understand that it was really busy.  I stood by the bar  for nearly 20/25 minutes. With a twenty in my hand, patiently waiting for any of the bartenders to get my order.  I was skipped over and over and over.   They were taking orders from people just walking up to the bar.  I gave up my spot.  Another person quickly took it.  He was served immediately.  I've been here over 50/60 times and I've had good times here.  Again not sure what happened today.  I didn't even have one drink.  I stepped away.  I wanted to try again, but I knew if I went DC just a block away, I would get served.  I thought about it.. I decided why not , the owner knows me.  He always gives me great service.  I stepped out, went over to DC, it was crowded, found a spot to order my drink , and was served in less than 15 seconds.  I showed my gratitude by tipping double every round.  Thank you DC,:) I should of known better.
author: Demanding T.

description:
I don't quite understand how Mad Dog can have so much interior space... and not utilize it. They have these huge plush booths that can seat six to eight... but if you're unluckily beaten by a trio of pretty petite blondes then the booth is out of the question. That leaves you with the always-full bar seating and... standing. Lots and lots of room for standing when there could be a few more tables and chairs.
While I don't care much for the lack of interior comfort, I had a really good time coming here for trivia night Tuesday night so plus one point. It's a jovial crowd, pretty competitive, easy to medium in difficulty, so if pub quiz is your thing I don't think you can go wrong with Mad Dog. Another plus point for letting you bring in food to pair with your alcoholic beverage, and they have a good standard set of draft beers.
The service was okay, it's too bad this place only takes cash so minus one point there. Overall I wouldn't mind coming again but it has yet to prove itself as a favorite haunt.
author: Jessica L.

description:
q: so you get your most delicious rosamunde sausage and walk into toronado for some beer.......and it's a mob scene. what do you do? what do you do?

a: mad dog in the fog!

mad dog in the fog, which is right across the street from rosamunde, is where i go to enjoy my rosamunde sausage when toronado crowd gets to me. it may not be the watering hole that toronado is, but mad dog can definitely hold its own drinks.......and it's much quieter.......and it's much much cleaner.......and the staff is much much much nicer. i like that.

makes me wonder why i even bother going to toronado...
author: frisco j.

description:
It is just barely okay. I like it that you can usually find a booth to sit in, or at least a bar stool. Quite often they play good music like the Cure or the Smiths (at least until the DJs show up). It's not too loud to talk. 

The downsides are it's not particularly cheap, I think it's $4.50 for a beer. There is little atmosphere to speak of. It wasn't that nice before the remodel, and it's even more soulless now. There have definitely been several rude bartender incidents, though I haven't spotted the worst offender in a while, she seems to no longer work there.
author: Estevan M.

description:
Stopped by last night to watch the NBA finals with some friends - somehow after 5 years of living in SF I had still never been here, but I was pleasantly surprised.  Not the Lower Haight dive I expected it to be! The place is clean with attentive bartenders and a nice patio out back.  They should consider changing the name to something more sports-related (unless I'm missing something).  "Mad Dog in the Fog" sounds like an ironic hipster dive more than a sports bar to me.

Big TVs everywhere and really loud sound for the game made it a great viewing atmosphere, especially once the bar filled up and there were tons of people standing and cheering.  Not somewhere I would likely hang out unless there is a game on, but great for watching sports with some buddies.  Get there early if you want a seat during big games.
author: P P.

description: I used to come here when it was pretty funky but I think they've upgraded. I wanted to make sure my friend got a good Black and tan and I figured if anyplace in the neighborhood could provide it. I remember when this place had scruffy bartenders and soccer hooligans for patrons, I was already pretty gone when I got in here but everything seems nicer than I remember it.
author: Manny F.

description: By far, Mad Dog is one of the most comfortable bars in the City. Fits you like an old favorite sweater.  What's not to love? There's Newcastle Brown on tap, plus no attitude nor judgments. I haven't been for trivia night in several years, but that used to be a ritual amongst me and some of my buds. However, I just might dust off my plethora of useless knowledge one of these days and show up again for it.
author: Gregor G.

description:
i spent many years missing out on good bars because i refused to drink anything that wasn't liquor. 

no whiskey, no thank you.

but i've changed my mind, and ADULT IRENE drinks beer and likes it. 

this place has an excellent patio which is perfect for afternoon beer drinking & apparently you might come to watch soccer but not me, because even ADULT IRENE still doesn't give a shit about sports.
author: Irene S.

description: Great bar, friendly staff, two pool tables which are often unoccupied. I like to go here to shoot pool with a few friends and have drinks. Also, Derrick is AWESOME. I idiotically left my backpack and the laptop inside one night. He got it back to me the next day, after taking it home to make sure it was safe. KUDOS, that was a life saver!
author: Chris V.

description: So maybe the fact that I went to Toronado first ruined me for the day but Mad Dog just didn't leave the same sort of impression on me as Toronado did...It's a serviceable bar and they do have a small patio out back where you can smoke but other than that it just didn't do much for me. If the World Cup had still been on it probably would have been a different story. Still one could do much worse and we did meet some truly interesting folks there so I say give it try if your are in the neighborhood.
author: Todd E.

description:
Lord, you take a break from Yelp for a couple hours and everyone scoops your review!
Believe it or not this was my first visit to MDitF, although I've hit up a few other Lower Haight bars in my day.  I was always tempted to come for the off-hour rugby matches, but I'm a sleeper, and I'll be damned if I'm getting up in the cold and dark to go alone to watch a sporting event on tv.  I like sports, but I'm not a freak.  Well, I'm not a sports freak anyway.
Lucky for me, my backside comes with extra padding so the stools were no match for my squishy posterior and I was fine sitting down until the last half hour or so of our marathon four hour sitting session.
Full from Indian food, I opted for the very lame and girly Pear Cider which sparked first horror, then interest, then a cultlike following.  Yeah, that's right, I'm drinking Cider bitches.  Yeah, it looks like water that's a tiny bit green.  What of it?  It's cold and delicious and sweet and nowhere near as filling as beer.  Sometimes you just have to Cider.
I blame Chewie for making my night so very long, but it's not really a complaint.  I had a great time meeting some new Yelpers, watching a magic trick, playing Taboo, and then getting our numb butts handed to us at trivia (yes, we really did all that; we were really there for four hours).  The trivia was okay - way too hard for this dumb blonde in most cases.  Thank God we had an excellent mix of intelligent folks, clever in different areas, and thank God for Fly A.  I highly recommend bringing Fly A to any general trivia night as he will pull history and politics answers out of the ether.  We're talking random and obscure things, like James Knox Polk's wife's shoe size.  (Yeah, I had to look that up, I can only tell you like four presidents - * twirls hair and makes "duh" face *)
Mad Dog in the Fog.  It's okay!
Three and a half stars!
author: Jennifer D.

description: I came here for the first time a few weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised!  I healthy selection of beers on tap, pool tables, an outdoor seating area, and plenty of room within.  My only ding would be their selection of super-loud, sometimes annoying, music.  But they recover somewhat by playing a Jackie Brown movie in the background.
author: Corey C.

description: I love this place. Great happy place to watch soccer. It can get crowded during Premiership games but it's a good place to get a seat during weekday World Cup games. Yes, there is a $10 cover but it goes towards whatever you spend in drinks or food, so if you were already planning to have a couple beers, then you're fine. Mad Dog is also a good place to catch the Barca/Real Madrid games during the La Liga season.
author: Susan S.

description:
jenga! most excellent beers! 

this was the end of a very awesome bridal shower/birthday embarrassment night. the drunk guy (sorry, the names are all a bit hazy now) had his head on the table, steady hands were doing unspeakable things with jenga. and most importantly, all the beer was frakking amazing. 

eh, yeah. i'm easy.
author: eliza w.

description:
I'm still irked, five days later. But I'm giving three because they're a good, okay bar for what they are. They have 3 IPAs on tap, outdoor patio seating and the bar + table service was fast enough (cash only). And I'm sure it will be a great place for morning/afternoon matches in the summer (if they don't have some basketball/baseball replays they'd rather show at 6am). Plus there's a telly on the patio (wasn't on.)

That being said...

This is not a pub, at least it wasn't when I walked in. It might as well have been any old sports bar, it doesn't deserve the name pub. Pubs don't let pubs play basketball, baseball, handball (American football) or hockey on the telly *IF* there is a football (soccer) match being aired. (Psst: If there's no footie check for rugby.)

Sooo they played another sport, why am I so upset? 
Because I called, hours before. I called to check on what I wanted. During that conversation when I asked if there'd be sound so I could hear the match they instead could have told me.. "By the way, we'll have two back to back games of some other sport playing at the same time on the 6 other screens pumping through the speakers but since we're a soccer pub we always keep soccer on one screen. So sure." 
Yes, as I was asking if I should go somewhere else someone actually said "Since we're a soccer pub we always keep soccer on one screen." They actually had it on two screens a different game on each screen and one of them was the channel I wanted, but the match before was in stoppage, so no pre-match not that it mattered by this point. For future reference turning the sound all the way up on 1 tv, when you have surround sound speakers broadcasting a different channel does not count as having sound for a match.

I did get to see my match, but I could have done the exact same thing 2 blocks from my apartment- bar, flat screen, beer, no sound- instead of going out to Mad Dog. I hate wasting my time and effort. And in the end I feel like I was lied to for extra business- and they don't need it. What's one less actual pub/football patron, when you have 40 sports bar customers? 


Some consolations of the night were: The Irish bartender seemed just as disappointing in not being able to give me the sound for my footie as I was in not having it. Two other supporters showed up and our enthusiasm for our match actually was briefly louder than the other 30+ people in the bar, twice. We won.
author: Brandy B.

description: Yes.  Finally a place where I can watch Premiership Footy without having to deal with people that don't understand the game or obnoxious "white hat" wearing ex-frat boys still loyal to their uni.  There is a reason why this sport has been around in some form for thousands of years, american football is merely a marketing department with a bunch of thugs posing as 'athletes', do yourself a favour and get to know a real sport.
author: George K.

description:
solid
my world cup hangout. close to me, and livelier than watching the game at home by yourself (sigh, my roommates don't watch with me).  Funny thing: the prices for drinks and coffee and such can change on a whim, even with the same server!  But it's open at 6 am for games. Can you beat that?
author: Markell M.

description: This is a fun, chill, neighborhood bar with a great little patio in the back. Who'd have thunk this place actually serves one of the best Bloody Mary's I've ever had?  Soju and Guiness...sounds odd, tastes great!  Just as random as the Rock-a-Billy theme night we stumbled across.
author: Tanger T.

description: I come here with friends once a week for trivia night on Tuesdays and it's not a horrible pub.  That being said, there are better pub options around town like the Pig & Whistle.  Trivia is always fun, but a bit too easy.  The beer selection is adequate, but nothing to write home about.  In short, if you're in the lower haight on Tuesday night with a group, there are worse ways to spend an evening, but for my drinking dollar I'd rather be in the Toronado or Molotov's.
author: Joshua W.
