description: I've never been a big fan of sports bar. Why? Cause I don't watch sports, that's why. There's nothing that screams special of this place besides it's full of a bunch screaming testosterone.
author: Perry S.

description: Love trivia night! Probably one of the most "open" bars in the city. It somehow avoided the bar + long hallway + too many people = no abaility to move equation, which I enjoy. Pool tables, tv, beer. Its a typical irish-feel sports bar. Yep, thats about it.
author: Afton T.

description: Rugby, Guinness, sexy people ... quick service even though it was packed .... brilliant !
author: Amy W.

description: Decent prices, with a decent beer selection.  I've really only been in here a couple of times during the day, so I'm not sure how the night crowd is.  During the day there's usually a handful of people watching a game of some sort. I like that they have a good sized outdoor patio, makes for a little nice outdoor beer drinking spot.
author: Kristine C.

description: Loved this place!  I was visiting San Fan recently for a week and really enjoyed the atmosphere, Pub Quiz, and the great bartenders.  Terri and Jules are the best!  Great wine selection too, my favorite was the cabernet sauvignon.
author: Jill J.

description: I'm a big fan of Mad Dog in the Fog. It's a great pub to watch soccer at, it has a good selection of beer and they let you bring in your own food (though they do have some small things). What could be better?!
author: Sara W.

description: Has the fine distinction of being the First Bar I Went to When I Knew I Was Moving to the City. It's not the same place as the First Bar I Went to in the City, nor would it be the First Bar in which I Lost My Pants in the City. But hey, it's two blocks away from the First Flat I Had in the City and, if you stand outside the entrance, you can see the First Street Corner where One of My Car Windows Was Broken By Stupid Crackheads in the City. I'll always remember one sad Friday night when I was Puffin -- the job, not the bird -- and since both our nights were slow, the bartender bought me a beer and we talked about public transportation. Then I had to go back to work and while I was waiting to get in the car, my driver ran over my foot, marking the First Time I Was Temporarily Flattened by a Moving Vehicle in the City. Ah memories.
author: Kimberly V.

description: Drunk Girl, who features in my Royal Oak review, brought me here with her once-and-again-husband to play 80's music trivia.  We should have killed, given my musical tastes, but we got our asses comprehensively handed to us because Drunk Girl, who doesn't even remember the 80's and knows them only through daytime television ads for compilation CD's, overruled many of my selections.  I'm still bitter, yes.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Maybe I'll give this bar another chance sometime, not late on a Saturday night, but I was really annoyed by the service here.

Yes, I'm sure at 1:00 in the morning on a Saturday night the bartenders are tired, have dealt with lots of drunks and want to go home.  I've worked in the service industry and get it. But the fact of the matter is you are still open and serving people so you ultimately do your job.

 So after some debate as to if my roommate and I were going to split a 22 oz seasonal beer (which turned out to be priced at $22!  We decided it was not worth it to spend $1 per oz) I ordered the house red and my roommate got a beer.  This bar is cash only so we were pulling cash out of our pockets to make sure we had the right amount. Yes we were drunk and maybe a little sloppy, but certainly not doing anything rude and  we were working it out amongst ourselves. We put our money together on the bar and we were going to collect the money and hand it to the bartender in an appropriate way but instead she grabbed the money from the pile  and said sarcastically bitchy "thanks for handing it to me so nicely". My roommate said he gave a $3 tip which I have no reason to doubt- but while I was still at the bar preparing to go back to my table the bartender shouts "thanks for the tip guys"  I calmly apologized and said that I thought we had left $3 and she said there was no tip.  I left another $2.  But really?  Shouting that out?  I would never not leave a tip but her YELLING at us certainly made me not want to leave one.  

The house wine was UNDRINKABLE- I mean it had clearly gone bad and was disgusting.  It was sour and vinegary tasting (believe me I'm no wine snob either) I would have said something but I didn't want the bartender to bitch at me again.  So thank you Mad Dog in the Fog for serving me tons of attitude and a disgusting glass of wine.  You probably got a $5 tip out of it.  

There isn't anything that makes this place better than the tons of other bars in the neighborhood, so I doubt I'll be coming in again.
author: Amy G.

description: The only thing that I don't like about this place is how cold it can get.  Super drafty bar.  Other than that, great place to hang out.  Cheap pitchers, good patio up front.  Tons of TV's for the soccer lover in you.  Best thing about this place:  THE OUTDOOR PATIO!  You can even smoke weed out on this one.  Great spot to meet some crazy English fuckers, great spot to play trivia on a Thursday night.  Oh, and if it's cold enough out, when you pee in the men's urinal (trough) steam rises!  NICE!
author: Max M.

description: When I moved from the 'hood this was the thing I knew I was going to miss.  Well, besides my friends.  I remember one time Joel (the bartender who makes the cool videos) jumped over the bartop and kicked a guys ass for stealing money off the bar.  Things have changed since Cyril took over, but I look forward to stopping by and visiting.  Best place in town to watch football.  They also serve Hoegaarden.  Mmmmm....  Speaking of remembering stuff, I also remember when the ceiling fell down, and when Twigger ODed on the patio.  So if you wonder why they close off the patio with that big velvet curtain at night, that's why.
author: Corie W.

description: watched west ham lose the semi final carling cup against Birmingham  there.......that aside a great bar....check it out if ur around there......good crowd and choice of beers...very friendly
author: Davey C.

description: Reliable.  Open at the crack of dawn for the World Cup (serving beers and english breakies with fat bangers and baked beans).  Tues and Thurs "pub quiz" where you can show your intellectual and pop culture wisdom for alcohol prizes.  Sweet!
author: Melanie C.

description: Best soccer bar in the city and the makeover actually did the place some good rather than ruining an institution. Did they get their hard liquor license yet? 5 stars when they do.
author: patrick g.

description: Ive only been here once, and it was for some Tuesday night trivia thing. i was 700 watts of being lit, so im sure every answer i gave to every question was something like "fart", "elephant piss" and "Esther Rolle". I do remember, however, the beer service being very prompt and friendly. I also remember the crowd being chumly as if it were a HUGE group of pallies going out for one. I think my biggest bitch was the seats. The barstools were scarce, and the seats at the tables were annoying. I felt like i was in elementary school again as my knees were constantly lifting the table and spilling everyone's friggin beer. Course, they had it replaced quicker than you could yell "Florida Evans!"
author: Mick F.

description: If you're a European football (soccer here) fan then you really can't go wrong with this place. Nice pub environment, lots of beers on tap to choose from, plenty of screens and games on, they even have a game projected onto a ginat screen on the back wall. It gets a little crowded when the big games are played so get there early or you may find yourself standing for 90 minutes.
author: Tommy P.

description: I can't give it 5 stars because I didn't eat here to give an informed decision. This bar is great....though and this place deserves the top of the mark. I plan to go back over and over again. I first heard of this place as a place that shows NHL hockey, which might I add is a sport that is severly underrated and should be televised more on TV and in bars alike. This place has 6 tvs all playing different sports.....SCORE. A great place if you're a soccer and beer fan since this place definately stays true to it's british roots. The Thursday night pub quizzes I hear are pretty sweet too.
author: Laura G.

description: Great neighborhood bar; the staff is very nice, the beers are great, the booths are comfy and trivia night is always fun.
author: Christine H.

description: pretty solid bar, haven't been in since the remodel, but from the outside it looks pretty nice.
author: Michael E.

description: My old local bar.  They used to not be able to spell football with anything but a U, but the newly renovated version has softened it's edges a bit and americanized its ways.  I admit it was weird when you wanted to roll in on a Sunday and watch good old American football and they were irritated about putting it on the big screen, but I actually kind of miss that too, that and the hoards of futbol fans that would pour into the street at 9am on a saturday...
author: Willy c.

description: I was in town for the second game of the Dodgers/Giants series @ AT&T Park. Came with an old friend who has a cousin that stays off Market and 9th. Went to this spot after the game and the atmosphere was great. Plenty of TVs, not overly crowded, 2 bar sized pocket billiards tables, and live music. Grabbed a few pitchers of the 250 stout and watched the highlights from the game. Great place. Definitely planning to come back.
author: Bryant A.

description: If you can find a place to sit, it's a great place to kickback and watch a game or just hang out. Beer selection is decent, Toronado across the street is better, but this place is cleaner and generally far less crowded. Personally, I don't really like being distracted by huge LCD screens at night in a bar unless I'm going there with the specific intention of enjoying a game, but it's a sports bar, so I would say this drawback for me in unavoidable.
author: Matt F.

description: Interesting that this place prefers futbol to football (especially on a Saturday), but no matter, the patio was the place to be on a sunny day. They've also got some nice beers on tap (Fuller's pale ale)...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Grew up down the street and spent most of my 20s at this place. This is still my favorite bar, feels like home when I return.
author: Carmine M.

description: Got to give it 5 stars automatically, for being a British pub that also shows football, hurrah!  Went there for the first time today for a v.early start.  8am kickoff, England vs Austria.  I liked it- the pub I mean (-England were shite I have to say), it had a great atmosphere and crowd and the woman behind the bar worked her socks off, bless her.  Sat back with a nice cuppa occasionally hurling the odd swear word at Micheal Owen.  Didn't eat, but the english breakfast smelled sooo good, looked like proper bacon too, so I will have to try it next time.  The rest of the menu looked OK, but please don't think it's representative of british cuisine.  We don't just eat fry ups, steak and kidney pie and sausage and mash.  Only sometimes.
author: Carrie A.

description: One of the nicest things about Mad Dog is that they allow patrons to bring in take-away food from nearby eateries. (Smart, too -- bars don't make money off their kitchens, so why bother competing with so many tasty locals?) Grab your Meat Mountain from Hahn's Hibachi or your pile of ribs from Memphis Minnie's, then stroll right in to the Mad Dog and settle in for the pub quiz.
author: Jennifer A.

description: It's got a quiz night, it's a pub. It's the lower haight..in the mess of dingy dirty bars in this area it stands out as not one of those. It's comfortable, everyone is kind of there to mind their own business-a good first date kinda place. The drawback- beer and wine only.
author: Erin O.

description: Went in search of a full English breakfast. I was pleased to find football on the tele and HP sauce for my breakfast. For $11.75, I got eggs, candian bacon, sausage (more like the bangers you buy at Safeway), beans, toast, tomato, and a pint of Guiness. Unfortunately, when I went- I didn't hear anyone with a British accent except the barmaid but overall it was a decent experience and I would go back for quiz night.
author: Noel H.

description:
we wandered over this way because the toronado was extremely packed, and this bar was in spitting distance.  i did have a good time here, and although i didn't use any of them, they had an assortment of board games for entertainment.

they had some good micro-brews on tap, and a few standard beers as well.  all the pitchers we ordered were $17... not sure if they have happy hour, but we didn't encounter one during the 4+ midday hours we spent there.

oh and no food here, good thing rosamunde's is right across the street!
author: Sean L.

description: FUTBOL!!!!!!!!! YES I SAID IT! not soccer. FOOTBALL. FUTBOL. or whatever they say in whatever country to signify you are playing with a ball,  while using your FEET! hahahaha! Mad Dog always has good matches on and they will change channels to view other matches if you ask (or at least see what's on). OLE! OLE! OLE! OLE!....OLE!....OLE!
author: santiago g.

description: Sigh.  Always used to come to Mad Dog to fix my hangovers with grease and starch. I miss them sinced I've moved!
author: Jude F.

description: Oh, to have back only 1/4 of the time I have spent in this place.  Why, why, why?  (Oh, yeah, to be on the consistently winning pub quiz team.)  But now that my dreams of trivia stardom have faded, I hope to never darken it's doorstep again.
author: darla s.

description: I went here with a bunch of my friends to watch a soccer game. It was a big game and the bar was packed.... so packed that they had to stop taking more customers. We sat outside at the back of the restaurant. I thought the service was going to be slow because there were so many people but I was very glad that I was wrong. The server was very polite and attentive. He took my order almost as soon as I was seated and brought my food in less than 15 mins. I ordered fish and chips and my friends ordered a burger and chicken sandwich. The food was just OK. Nothing to write home about but not bad either. One of my friends ordered wings later and they were actually quite good. So, if you go there get the buffalo wings!
author: Jonathan L.

description: Although this bar is known more for its sports fanatics, I recommend hanging out during any one of its political events. I saw the last Bush - Kerry debate here, and there's nothing like watching a political debate in one of the most liberal hoods in the country. The Peanut Gallery shouted down the candidates as the beer flowed freely.
author: Babs P.

description: Much less annoying that most Lower Haight bars.  Plenty of seating.  Outdoor patio.  Few good beers on tap.  TV's.  That's it.  Really.
author: Eric S.

description: Things are looking up for Mad Dog after the remodeling in late 2008 early 2009.  Nice spot that is attracting cool and diverse people in lower Haight.
author: Shawn H.

description: Everytime I go here I am left wanting more.  Like more and better beers on tap.  There is something so banal about it.  However, after living here for a year have yet to hit up trivia night.  Which is quite strange due to my affinity and bizarre knowledge of the trivial. (I am the proud owner and ruler of Trivial Pursuit original edition.)  So perhaps I should attend one evening, kick ass, and re-review.  But otherwise, I am generally frustrated because of unrealized, and unmet potential of this bar. An extra point for a smokeable, back patio though.
author: Katie M.

description: I don't usually frequent Mad Dog because of the huge TV screens but it was the best place to go to check out this past election, it was crowded and it took forever for them so serve us but whatever! They have a nice beer garden in the back which they usually close around 9-10pm.  They've recently renovated and it's definitely more spacious now, but I don't believe they sell drinks in here? Just beers right?
author: Gina R.

description: 5 stars because this place is cool and the drinks can kick you in the ass later.
author: Dani D.

description: It's not the classiest thing to admit, but sometimes when I am having a few beers, I like playing darts.  Thus, when my friends and I are looking to have a moderately chill night, nothing too packed or rowdy, it is nice to walk to Mad Dog.  The beer selection is pretty good and the bar staff is amiable too.  It just has a laid back kind of vibe.  Oh, and there is soccer on all the time and the guy friends are huge into soccer, so they are more than happy to head to Mad Dog.  It's always been a fun night out for me here.
author: Lauren H.

description: One of the few places that has Boddington's on tap is already a plus. Good selection of taps overall (including Fuller's Pale Ale). Apart from that, it's very cozy and has a good friendly vibe. And they let you bring in your own food, as they don't serve any (save for little bags of Fritos and such). They plug football (soccer) on the big screen here, so if you're an ex-pat from the UK, this is the place for you. Nice little outdoor patio, too.
author: Maximillian M.

description: A million beers, a million TVs, pool tables, backyard.  This place is pretty sweet to kick back, have a few beers and watch sports.  The chicken wings are some of the best around.  Recommended for drinking beer and watching sports.  One downside is lack of hard liquor.
author: Daniel B.

description: Ever seen Eurotrip?  I half-way expected to have Vinnie Jones screaming at me and demanding that I sing the Manchester United song upon walking into this place.
author: Eric L.

description: Don't get me wrong. Mad Dog's not a bad bar. It serves it's purpose of dispensing alcohol and keeping the TVs tuned to sports. It even has a pool table and a dart board. It's just that my idea of a good night out isn't sitting around with a bunch of people watching sports on TV while we silently drink ourselves into stupor. I prefer a little interaction, and the crowd here always seems a little to testosterone saturated to be friendly. Just my two cents.
author: Jesse H.

description:
they show most of the football games, today they showed champions league games:Liverpool-Barcelona and Chelsea-Porto, the atmosphere was awesome and for a Wednesday mid-day, it was packed !!!

they even tivo all the big games, which is a god send.

classic british pub grub - Thatchers Heavy Head is my favorite.
oddly, no fish 'n chips.
author: s s.

description: Great environment, but I wish they would accept credit here.  There's a pool table too!
author: Jonathan T.

description: What can I say about Mad Dog, other than it's a typical Anglophile sports bar.  You got yer cheap beer.  You got yer multiple screens showing rugby, bball, le foot, or golf.  You got yer semi-rowdy crowd.  And, the best part (for me at least), is that you got yer trivia nights two days a week.  The rounds will make you feel smart and dumb in turn, and your team just might end up with conquests such as $30 or a pitcher of beer.  It's not every day that intellect (or smart phone prowess) is justly rewarded, but on tuesdays and thursdays at Mad Dog it is.  Cheers to that, mate.
author: Momo R.

description: I gotta give them five stars, since Mad Dog is the proud sponsor of my women's soccer team!  An extremely fun English pub.  Saturday mornings are my favorite - 7am and the bar is filled with die hard fans watching futball games going on across the Atlantic.  Almost every Saturday afternoon my team is there having beers, watching soccer, and enjoying sun on the back patio.  Go Lassies!!!
author: Stephanie P.

description: I only come here to see my friends' bands since it's out of the way but whenever I do, it's a good time.  The barflies are chill, not seedy.  They like their rock loud, which is important; nothing kills a vibe like a bartender who's always telling you to turn down.  And I only saw this the last time I went, but they have THE most AMAZING video loop playing in the background while the band plays.  It's like, 5-10 second clips of B-movies and other pulp-like video from it must be the 60's and 70's...just stupendous.  And the bartender the last time I went had a Joan Jett haircut, so props to them.
author: Deb T.

description: If you love sports from across the pond, then this is the place to come and watch them.  They even have headphones if you're totally into whatever game it is when nobody else would care to hear the TV.  Otherwise, it's just a bar with a lot of space inside.
author: matthew w.

description: A decent place to go for a game of darts, as I don't recall it ever being overly full during the week.  Trivia night was decent and as best I recall there was some decent competition, but it wasn't up to the standards of the castle or the 540.
author: Alured P.

description: Before dinner and going out, we hit this pub for a few beers and to watch the Warriors game.  High ceilings and lots of open space, makes this a great bar for people who don't want the person next to them, breathing in their drink.  Boddington's, Blue Moon, Stella. . . the usual suspects.  The pool tables are well-kept and dartboards hang around in the corners.  Damn those Warriors play well at home!
author: E L.

description: Good selection of beers, cheaper pints than elsewhere, but no food. I was really craving some hot-wings when I went here last, but alas, there were none to be found. However, they did let us bring in some pizza from mythic across the street. Two thumbs up for being that laid back! Watch some soccer here, enjoy a good beer, play some pool, but its probably not the place for you if you want to dance/get smashed/hook up/eat.
author: Micah R.

description: We went to watch Mon night football here. Good beer, decent bar food. not too crowded, but it being a holiday weekday probably helped.
author: Chris C.

description: Awesome place to watch sports.  Lots of TVs.  Great place.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: You can find me here every sunday during the football season.  They have the sunday ticket so you can watch any game you want.  It is never to busy, like it's sisterbar the Kezar.  Great selection of beer, but no alchol which is a bummer cuz something bout football and bloody's on sunday makes so much sense.  Oh yeah and if you get bored they have cork dart boards for freee of charge which is always a bonus, and on thursday they do a quiz night.
author: brian m.

description: Great spot. I've probably been there 50 times and never had a bad experience. sometimes seating can be a bitch during trivia and such, but usually its not a problem. Love it.
author: Andrew L.

description: Ok I should give it three stars. The beer selection should be better, the interior needs work and the vibe isn't always there. But when my life went (and still somewhat is) this bar allowed me to return to lower haight and somewhat took me under my wing. I've made some new friends and when i am lonely I can read my book and nurse my beer and know i can be ok for a little while. That is precious in what can be a very impersonal city like san francisco.
author: Cassandra T.

description: I watched the World Cup here a couple of summer's ago, I maybe go in about once every three months, and maybe once every six get shithoused here, I like it, it's a bar, it reminds me of the bar I frequented back home in Santa Barbara, a girl called me a dirty British snitrag one night, weird, because, well...I'm not British. Still, as far as good ol' fashioned bars go, this is just fine, no complaints really, but I prefer the Hemlock or the Page!!
author: Steve l.

description:
Imagine this: you put some money on some of the nfl playoff games, so you want to go watch the games. you dont pay for cable so you are left with the option to go watch it in a bar. you dont want to walk far, so you go three blocks down the road to mad dog. you already like mad dog because you have been there on trivia night, and because its mentioned in a one man army song that you like, so when you get there you are pleasantly surprised that it isnt crowded at all and they are playing the game on several screens, and the loud people that are there are cheering for your teams so its not as obnoxious to hear them...beer is fairly priced and you drink several pints and are winning your bets and everything is great. then the 4th quarter of the second game starts and its close and if the giants win you win your parlay and an extra $60.....sounds like a 5 star review right?
then a man walks in....a large man tall and kinda wide wearing a dirty track jacket and stained black jeans with a lame ass white trash pony tail with a few grey strands forming, the bartender for some reason is excited to see this man and calls his name out and pours him a drink....normally i could give a shit if this guy shows up but they say half the taste of something comes from the smell. and this man smelled like a european without a shower for a month and a skunk had a baby, and someone took that baby's dirty diaper and whaffed it in front of air conditioner at the bar. I couldnt finish my beer and couldnt finish my game....if i had walked into that initially i would have given this a 1 star review....so i comprimised, 3 stars.
author: Brad O.

description: awesome for winter afternoons. the interior of this place feels like your uncle's living room. i don't really understand football but i come here and watch it anyway.
author: Jane P.

description: Awesome bar if you want to get the buzz going, the bartender Derek is the best, no problem filling up my own glass that was more than a pint. The music is good but a bit too loud, fortunately there is a nice back yard area for talking and other outdoors activities!
author: Anders O.

description: Quite possibly the best pub in the area. Friendly, laid back, incredibly helpful with everything from beers to restaurants in the area. Even let me recharge my phone behind the bar while I enjoyed a perfectly poured pint of Guinness (or 6). Be sure to look for Terri the redheaded bartender. She won't let you down.
author: Jon F.

description: Somehow I ended up here on my 21st birthday. I guess I wandered in there, and I know I went to about 10 other bars that night, and to be honest this was the one that stood out the most. The bartender was the kind of an asshole who blasted The Beatles all night long, and I loved every second of it.  Loved the guy and had an all around great experience.
author: Shawna E.

description: i love this place--the best local neighbourhood pub to catch games of footy. and the bartenders are very cool and easygoing
author: Caitanya M.

description: two words - trivia night!  tuesdays and thursdays are awesome (although tuesdays are much easier and less packed).  be sure to study up on your current events and odd music knowledge.  stop by rosamundes or mystic pizza before hand and bring your food in.  be sure to get there by 8:45 to get a table.  on other nights, it's a good place to play pool or darts.
author: Jessica W.

description: we walked into this bar on a sunday night to watch a soccer game and were greeted by rowdy irish fans! need i say more? perfect atmosphere for a game and the beers were cheap. i guess the only downside is the the bar is narrow and there arent enough seats, but i had a great time!
author: Andrew T.

description: I was there today to watch some Champs League matches namely the Arsenal-PSV match and I had a great time despite the unfavorable result in the match. I had to buy $10 worth of 'tickets' in order to come in and watch the games, but the tickets can be used to eat, drink and be merry. I would have spent $10 easy anyway, I was planning to stay late and watch the taped delay Real-Bayern match on ESPN Classic so I knew I was in for a few pints as well as some food. I was surprised that the menu was so limited but the beer selection was excellent. Plenty to choose from and they had my favorite, Anchor Steam. After two of those and about halftime, I ordered the Greedy Bastard which was two pieces of bacon, two sausages, tomato, two pieces of toast, baked beans and two eggs. It was rocking and all that was left was the fat off of the bacon. I was in town visiting, from L.A., but I had lived in the city some time ago in the same neighborhood as Mad Dog, and decided that it was prolly the best place to watch these matches (other than my hotel room, but it would be boring to watch it alone). It does look different than the last time I came in here, almost ten years ago, but it was still a good experience and I was surrounded by a bunch of people who cared about the game which is more than I could say for any old sports bar, AND I was able to watch two matches at once. It was awesome and I'm glad I took the time to come back.
author: Mauro T.

description: The place rocks.  I feel like I'm in a pub back in England and the crowd creates a great energy.  I'm not into sports really but if you are here you just get swept in and that is fun.  I mean who wouldn't get excited watching David Beckham-gay, straight, male or female!
author: Misti L.

description: great place to watch english soccer if you don't have a dedicated soccer channel.  Quiz night was fun, but the 3 of us stood no chance against teams of 12.  Also has a pool table and darts.  I'd go back to watch soccer.
author: LT B.

description: trivia is fun in this bar, but i never come close to winning. that doesn't stop me from polishing off a couple of stouts though. and apparently this is the place to watch a friendly or an english premier league game.
author: Dean E.

description: i only go here for pub quiz, which is tuesdays and thursdays, and when i do i invariably have an awesome time. a lot of people don't seem to be familiar with the pub quiz concept - it's a british thing. you get some friends, go to the bar, order drinks, make up a stupid name for your team, and then answer a few rounds of questions. if you win, you get...free beer or something. i don't know, i've never won. but that isn't really the point. it's pretty informal - it's free, the questions aren't super-hard, although some are very esoteric, and there's something for everyone: celebrity gossip, current events, the photo round, the geography round, the music round ... what  have you. it's the perfect thing to do when you want to hang out with friends but you don't want to have serious conversations about, like, life, and shit.
author: Erika C.

description: Friendly atmosphere and cheap beer (no liquor though, sort it out please) - but more importantly all of the football (soccer), with replays for those of us not masochistic/alcoholic enough to get up and start drinking at 6am.
author: James B.
